text: Love this place. You can always get a healthy smoothy when it's 4am instead of getting some junk at some fast food place. I always get the chunky monkey protein smoothy. It's quick and it's 24hrs. I wish there were more of these is the city.

$45 for two take out bagel sandwiches and two drinks?? The bagels were stale AND soggy...Plus, I was sick for a whole day after eating that!! Worst food experience ever. I cannot recommend this place to even my worst enemy.

Great food and the apps are amazing. Good beer selection as well. Jamie our waitress was super fast and nice. When we arrived we didn't see the hostess stand, so walked in and sat down. Robert, a waiter was a complete jerk and told us we needed to go and wait in line for a table. There was no line. We walked back up to hostess, she sat us immediately. Robert needs some help on how to treat customers.

Great flavors, professional and poised service, and yummy dessert. 
I had the BBQ Chicken Salad and it was delicious and a generous portion! It didn't have BBQ or isn't your typical BBQ but the flavors all matched and the toppings gave it variety and texture. 
The waiter was super nice and never rushed us. It was reasonably priced for being on the strip. 
We had the cheesecake and the bread pudding and we all loved the cheesecake. It was huge! 
I would come here again.

My wife and I come to vegas each year for a conference, and have eaten here often, this last time though, the service was extremely sub par.  Our server 'Danny' made zero effort to check and see if the kitchen could make my wife two eggs for her special food allergies, and brought us the wrong sides.  My wife couldn't eat, and I got the wrong thing. I think we'll keep walking next time and eat at the border grill.

Stayed at the Mandalay and ate here for most meals. The food is delicious and most of the staff pleasant but I have to agree with another reviewer that the bartender was unpleasant, if the same one? I think she had a nose ring or some other facial piercing. Asked for a Diet Coke and she asked if Pepsi was ok and I said no thank you and she gave me a sour look. I don't like Pepsi, ok!? At any rate, the food is delicious, juices are also great (9 bucks a pop though, no surprise there for LV).

I had the best time coming to this place. I am so glad that I was able to find it in Mandalay Bay. So I just came here with a friend just to watch a show and we had plenty of time to kill. The bottomless mimosas were absolutely amazing. The bartender Lizzy was so nice and genuine and had the most funniest conversations with us ever. Also Glen who is a waiter there is great as well. These people have amazing customer service and made me and my friend have nothing but an amazing experience full of laughter and fun with these people. They are so wonderful at customer interaction and multitasking. If you are going to go to the bar, I would put in a request for Lizzy. If you are looking for a sit down, Glen is great too. In my personal opinion, this place is the best for a breakfast, brunch, and lunch. I would definitely come back here again. Atmospheres great and so are the employees. Thank you Lizzy and Glen for an amazing experience, I will see you guys soon!
Great food. We had the breakfast burrito and it was large enough to share.  Blueberry muffin was also delicious.  Highly recommend

Told you we'd be back before we leave!! Haha. Seriously, what is up with the low ratings for this place?? Second time here, on Sunday, on Mother's Day and still received amazing service and food! This time our server was Lane...awesome guy. Both times we've been, it was a phenomenal experience. See my other review. I can't wait till we come back next year. I will be thinking of this place until that time.

Love that it is 24 hours and it's not fast food. Cool atmosphere. Mahi tacos were good. My husbands grilled shrimp was fantastic! If you are looking for a light option go with that, you won't be disappointed.

one-word review: SLOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOW

Surprisingly bad. Took forever to get drinks, took forever to get food. Server was apologetic and nice and friendly, but that only goes so far.

My friend got a burger. Asked for jalapeños on the side. Told it would be extra, no problem. Jalapeños never showed up, we complained. By the time the server returned my friend had already finished his burger. Server came to explain they ran out of jalapeños. Burger itself was a bad, obviously frozen patty. Oh, and they forgot the fries as well, which were uninspiring.

My salad was fine, a C+/B- level type meal.

I'd be shocked if that initial 5-star review was not a shill post. This place was baaaaaaad.

Taking over the giant old space that was once Red, White and Blue, Citizens was designed by a 'famous' design firm for the Light group. The space is huge, and comprised of all hard surfaces; hard floors, hard ceilings, and hard walls. What this equates to is an extremely loud dining experience, even if it's not that full. The vaulted ceilings, light fixtures and finishes are all cool, but this place is just huge. I would also point out that if you want comfort, do not sit on the incorrectly proportioned backless bar chairs at the bar, and instead get yourself a table.  More importantly this place is overpriced; you'll notice that just about everything on the menu is about $2-3 more than you'd be willing to spend. I had this gripe when I ate at Mandalay's noodle shop a few weeks ago when my lunch special was an astonishing $18 for a soup and lunch-portioned dish. Apparently the property really likes to take advantage of their massive convention crowds. With everything from breakfasts, salads, burgers, entrees and desserts you can certainly find something you'd like, just expect to pay handsomely for it. Also, they use the words 'specialty' and 'signature' quite a bit on their menu, but looking around at other people's dishes and based on my meal this definition seems to be based around providing mediocre, high priced sandwiches.

My classic hamburger was placed in front of me and looked as mediocre as it tasted. The bun was dry and a bit too big, but well-proportioned to the patty. Not sure if you have a choice of cheeses, but when I asked for a cheeseburger I wasn't offered any options and was given American cheese. The presumably frozen patty had ok char flavor, but was of your extremely generic back yard BBQ variety, and very overcooked at that. But I guess one of this quality shouldn't be ordered any other way. One small slice of not too fresh tomato didn't provide much coverage, but I had plenty of pickles, lettuce and red onion at my disposal. Overall this had nothing great going on. 

My waffle fries sucked as they always do, and considering the menu gives you the option of skinny fries, potato salad or coleslaw I'm not quite sure why I got these stupid fries. They're clearly never fresh due to how they're made, so why bother? Plus, $21 for a burger and iced tea is about $9 more than you should pay for this, even in a casino setting capitalizing on desperate conventioneers. After this awful experience, combined with Burger Bar's drop off, I can probably now claim that there are no decent burger options south of Tropicana along the Strip until you get much more south away from the casinos. If you're at Mandalay I would still recommend Burger Bar over this as you get far better quality for the money, but I can't promise anything there anymore.
Worst host told my party of 3 to wait 15 minutes then proceeded to seat other people complain to manager disinterested in making it right
Best bloody Mary's in town and great service in the bar. I believe her name was Raquel.

Horrible food and even worse service. In fact, mandala bay should be ashamed that a restaurant of such scale is inside the hotel. DO NOT COME HERE! Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else. Paid for $20 per person for basic food but was given the worst attitude by the waitresses in my life.

Truly a 3-star restaurant. Citizens has a down to earth vibe that reminds you of a Classic American diner...until you see the $4 price for a cup of coffee. But then again, you're not really in America, you're in Vegas. 

Unlike other Mandalay spots, this is a good spot if you know how to order. The $8 side of eggs during brunch is RIDICULOUS. Don't do it. Interestingly, the $2 side of toast is worth it: two slices so large they are a breakfast in themselves. My regular way to start the day at a Vegas trade show at Mandalay is with the chocolate peanut butter smoothie ($9) and that side of toast ($2). For $11, it's a great starter to an intense day on your feet. 

And speaking of being on your feet, the floors in Mandalay leading into Citizens are crazy slippery. I'm shocked people aren't breaking their hips on a regular basis. I ate at Citizens twice this week while in town for the Project trade show and nearly fell over another guest waiting in line for a table. 

The service at Citizens definitely makes up for the overpriced menu. Servers are cheery but not cheesy and just conversational enough. Not bad, but really overpriced (isn't everything in Vegas), so definitely NOT great.

Amazing food and great service if you get an awesome waiter. My first morning we had the best service ever. The waiter was spot on, the food amazing. The next morning the waiter chose to not listen and didn't communicate to the chef what my travel partner wanted. He asked specifically for Banana pancakes that were on the menu. He ended up with regular pancakes with a couple of bananas thrown on top. The manager was spot on and professional and took control of the issue. I was very impressed and will be back. The food is top notch and I highly recommend Citizens for breakfast. It was quite tasty. The overall feel of the restaurant is spot on.

Awful service. Rude server. Our family waited 20 minutes for our breakfast orders before we decided to walk out. Manager defended her slow kitchen and tried to justify why another family of five next to us who seat down after us got served before us. Overpriced too. Skip Citizen and to the buffet if at Mandelay.

Love this restaurant located in Mandalay bay casino next to light night club
They are open until late food is great and fresh like there chicken Cobb salad
And wing  and service you get I will recommend to everyone.

It's funny, you can always identify an ineffective manager when the easiest most simple request is denied for an unknown reason. ...Ate dinner at Citizens the first night of my stay in Las Vegas.
The next morning I went there for coffee and here is where the problem arose. I eat oatmeal as I have a special diet for breakfast. 
I asked for hot water with my coffee and after a discussion with I guess her manager, the waitress came back and said I could have the coffee but would have to eat the oatmeal elsewhere. I mean they are not crowded, I'm at the Bar so I don't take up a precious table. Won't be eating there again this trip just to reward their service. Went down the hallway at Mandolay Bay to the next eatery and they had no problem with the hot water. 
I love yelp as you get to make sure the owners realize how their employees treat their customers.

I went here for lunch and it was very good. I ordered a cheese burger and their fries with some green tea. their fries were the best fries I've ever tasted, the burger was a bit dry but it was still very good. My mom got the lamb burger with the mashed potatoes and she absolutely loved it. She went back a 2nd time to get the lamb burger because it was so good! The only thing that I can't even call in issue it was just something that was a bit annoying was our waiter talked very quiet and seemed kinda out of it, like he had a hangover or something so we had to keep repeating or selves when we ordered and he asked the same questions a few times after we already answered him.
There's a billion people behind the counter and yet they can't seem to get an order correct or out in a timely fashion.

Once you get past the cold, unfriendly hostesses (and sole reason for the 2 stars) the food is delicious and the wait staff is fantastic. If you hate your job, especially if you are the first person a potential client interacts with at an establishment, pretend to love it. We went there twice and after dealing with those girls, we avoided it the rest of our stay, and cant say we would ever go back because we aren't into feeling like we are a bother when we pay a good amount of money to eat somewhere.
Food was disgusting and way overpriced. And the interior is very bland and ugly. Very uncomfortable seating. Diner style feel with shitty food. $40 for unflavored chicken. Blahh!!'

Just had lunch at Citizens.  We had the mahi mahi fish tacos and the chicken quesadilla - both were very good.  The tacos has big filets of fish , rather than the usual chunks.  Fish was delicious as well as the entire taco.  Bustling, but relaxed atmosphere, good service even though the place was busy.  I also tried the Ginger Snap juice smoothie - was very good.  There was a choice of 6-8 juice smoothies.  This place offers comfort food, but plenty of healthy options too.  We saw a few burgers come past - they looked great.

The absolute worse breakfast I've ever been served. Greasy hash browns, gross pancakes that tasted like they forgot to mix the bisquick batter and the most bitter cup of coffee I've ever had. All for the low price of $25, what a joke. Also I could not get the waitresses attention and she didn't come back to my table for 20 minutes. When I told her I almost did a spit take when I tasted the coffee. She took the cup and came back 10 minutes later with the same bitter brew. If you want bad food and bad service this is the place for you. I can't believe food this awful would be allowed in Mandalay Bay. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!!
Great food and our server Lotus was wonderful.   Would highly recommend this place.  Everyone at our table loved their food
This place has the best sandwiches in vegas.  The portions are HUGE!  It's a perfect place to eat after partying at Light.

After a long day, I wanted something quick and delicious. I chose to try Citizens and had their Reuben (no kraut) and fries.  This was probably some of the best corned beef I've had in quite some time and it certainly hit the spot.  Good food with great service.  A hit with me for something quick and simple but yet tasty.
The food and service are atrocious. The staff isn't friendly and the food we had was awful and took forever. Let's not forget the prices which are 2x what they should be. Never again.

We ordered the calamari, cheese dip and fish and chips. Food was mediocre and pricey. Our bill came out to $80 (inc tip). Servings were generous though. The calamari was mostly fried flour. We were very disappointed by the juice bar. It isn't really juice, but more smoothie. We spent $30 for three drinks and barely made through a quarter of each drink. Gave them an extra star for decor and the servers were polite and friendly.

I'm SO angry that they removed the lobster roll from their menu! Thanks, Hakkasan, for buying them out, and ruining the menu, WTF. Every time my friends and I are in Vegas, we come to Citizens just for the lobster roll and mac & cheese. I got all my friends into the lobster roll, and we all couldn't wait to come back and get it.

I was having such a horrible weekend, and on the day I was leaving, I went to Citizens to try and make the weekend up with an amazing lobster roll, and mac & cheese. I was so excited, and was anticipating it all weekend. I looked at the menu and boom, NO lobster roll. I asked the waitress, and she said they removed it. So I left. She didn't think I was serious when I said I was leaving, lol. I'm not interested in any other dishes on the menu. You lost a very loyal customer!

I'll just share my experience. Although service was good, the food was not worth the price. Appetizer (chili fries), 1 salad (Caesar), 1 entree (penne no chicken), soda and tea was $92!!!  I can't give this more than 1 star because I expect the whole package. Especially for $92!!!

Best place to eat at Mandalay! Split a meal with someone. Served in two separate plates and plenty of food! Fresh and delicious! We always eat here when in Vegas. Chicken club sandwich is a favorite for lunch or dinner. Ultimate breakfast was great too! Both were plenty share with my husband! Try it. You won't be disappointed!
I had the spinach and mushroom omelette. Food was fantastic! Tim, our server, was outstanding. We will definitely be back.

Good food and good service...
The only restaurant open when your arrived after midnight.
We ate lunch here, it was just ok.  Not great, but not horrible.  We ate burgers and the wings. Price wasn't too bad.
$25.00 for a stale tiny chicken pot pie! Stay away from this place its a sucky rip off!!!
Glen is the best server we've had out of several at the Mandalay Bay resort thus far. Fast, friendly, and accurate! Thanks Glen!!

This real estate used to be the Burger Bar...

But 10am hungers could be just for breakfast foods now. Vegas is known for its edgy entertainment, gaudy bling, and top notch reviewed eaterys. Despite that flashy sign, this one is average, and I will only wonder what that Burger at 10am would have tasted like.

Lox and cream cheese, side of hashbrowns: Nice platter, medium smoked salmon, nice smooth shreddable texture, just enough to cover that not so thick plain bagel. Need more cream cheese - the design squares are nice, but not functional. Easy on the red onions was good, and a nice pile of capers is always good too. Maybe it was the not typical squirt of lemon from me, but the usual salty flavors weren't there in harmony as usual.

SIde of hashbrowns was nice. Perfect portion sized tater tot crumbled hash nicely mixed with peppers.

Nice but not glamorous or creative, and the taste is what you'd expect, but my novice could do this at home, and have, which is why I shouldn't pay to eat this out.

This was a great experience ... so good that we went twice in the space of 20 mins.

Okay, so the first time, I was there with my boss and his wife and we were served expertly by Art who managed to talk me out of the steak frites in favor of the prime rib. He made the right call as the prime rib was out of this world. I have to say, though, that I ordered medium-rare and got something more like rare, Boss and Mrs Boss ordered medium and got medium-well. Picky, perhaps, but honestly the flavor was amazing and it melted in the mouth. For dessert, Mr and Mrs picked up a seven layer chocolate cake that was extraordinarily huge.

When my co-worker arrived slightly later than us, we suggested Citizens and so we ended up back in the same place about twenty minutes after we'd left, so she could get something to eat. She ordered prime rib on our recommendation, medium-well and it came out medium-well. This time we were served by Aleck, another fantastic server who was great fun and really added to the enjoyment of our night.
Was here about a year ago and came back to the same great food and service. Great environment also, and Lotus is a very organized and attentive server!

Nothing here stands out and makes me want to go again. 

It wasn't that far out of what Red, White, and Blue had to offer. 

This place is NOT vegetarian friendly. The chef was nice enough to make our party specialty items (off menu) to satisfy. 

I ordered a flat iron steak. It wasn't bad, but this also isn't a steak house - it's like an upscale cafe....maybe. 

I did really like the beer selection! Although no beers are on tap, all bottled.

Want to let you all know what an outstanding sever we had Bailey while we were attending a convention for 8 days - not only courteous, professional, attentive but truly a wonderful worker as she took care of us like she knew us for years!! Thank you Bailey!

We come to Vegas all the time and Citizens is one of our favorite places! Addison is a super friendly face that greets you at the host stand! Lotus served us and took great care of us! Food and drink are wonderful!

Went to get a sandwich the one I wanted was already pre made. I don't eat turkey only wanted ham they said make your own. So I did and instead of paying 11-14 dollars I paid 24 because I got extra chesse abd avocado but didn't even get the extra cheese didn't expect it to be that much. I will never go there again

I was in Vegas for a short vacation and came across Citizens with my girlfriend, so we decided to stop in. We were greeted promptly at the hostess stand and were offered the choice of inside or patio seating. We love people watching, so we took a seat on the patio. We were quickly greeted by our server, Art, who was kind enough to take our beer and mixed drink order, brought us some waters and recommended a few appetizers.  We decided on the Spinach Dip. It arrived quickly and piping hot.  There were multiple different cheeses, an abundance of fresh tasting spinach and they had enough chips where we didn't have to worry about running out of chips with a lot of dip left (a huge pet peeve of ours). We would go out of our way to order this again.

Our dinner entrees were delicious and promptly served after our appetizer was completed. Everything was hot and tasted fresh. The manager, Andrea, even stopped by and not only asked about how our meal was, but asked us about how we were enjoying our time in Vegas and gave us a couple additional ideas of things to do. That was a nice touch. Great food, great service, we will definitely go there again next time we are in town.
Best Bloody Mary's around town. Food is delicious and couldn't get any better service. Bartender Raquel was  super nice, helpful and fast.
We received great service on both visits.  He first was at 3:00a.m!   Food was fresh as well.  We would definitely go back for the rice crispy treats, fruit cups, and drinks
This was a very inefficient operation that doesn't represent the Mandalay Bay brand well. There were many people working, a lot of activity, many customers waiting and not a lot of results.

Dinner was great. I had the Cobb Salad, wife had the BBQ Chicken Salad. Next morning, breakfast was less thrilling. I had the Ultimate Breakfast, the potatoes looked warmed for too long...like they were from the day prior. I'd eat there again, but iHop does a better, cheaper big breakfast...NOT trying to slam Citizen, but I was hoping for a little more.

i made the mistake of ordering the pasta prosuttio. took 3 bites the( pasta over cooked the meat undercooked and the sauce watery thin not thick like is should be) and asked for the check . asked for the mgr on duty  waitrer says he isn't in right now he is out of the restaurant. the waiter never even offered a replacement.
0 for 3 come on- its sad when the highlight is I got the faster drink refill ever

Great place to grab a drink or a bite to eat before you hit the casino. Raquel the bartender is one of the best in the business. She always remember your drink orders from previous visits and really makes you feel at home!!

The cafe has the worst customer service ever including a not so friendly staff. We ordered a grilled cheese and a shake. After waiting for 15 minutes (mind you the place was dead), the girl brings our shake to us stating that she forgot about it. No mention of the grilled cheese, we walked up to the counter and asked the status on that order. The girl look puzzled and stated that she burned our sandwich and would make a new one. The panini press is in plain site, and no sandwich was ever made to be "burned". The manager was on the side of the cafe making a drink, then brought it out to a girl outside of the establishment. We highly don't recommend this place, unless you like waiting for your food that will never come, and like to experience some of the worst customer service.
Great steak and rib-eye! Watch out for the portions! They are gynormous!

Only place to eat after 2am at Mandalay or Luxor except McDonald's. The food is decent. Great Chicken Soup for 2am. Appetizers were fairly good. The chili is too spicy with the cheese fries. Service is very slow so don't be in a hurry.
If a $20 plus tip martini is your idea of a good time, this is your place. The food is like a medium burger place with premium prices. Decent for breakfast to go though.
The food was pretty good. But one of the employees there named Diana was the best!! She deserves 2 raises. She's got it goin on... She be parkin lot pimpin in her dunks!

Turkey Ruben is sooooo bomb, I'm drooling just thinking about it! Service was quick and attentive and menu selection is perfect for cheese lovers like myself. Its a bit dark in there but...eh...ambiance I guess. Would definitely go back to try something else!

I stay at Mandalay Bay for two weeks at a time about 5 times a year so I am always looking for a place to eat. Citizens is ok but the customer service is lacking. The food is pretty typical of what you get in Vegas prep aired to an average standard at an inflated price. The staff is also pretty typical Vegas, lacK of experience with a pulse. I often dine alone since my trips are for business. I work for one of the shows out here so I am always around the building. The often blank stare no personality hostess is put off by having to seat one and will always try and get you to sit at the bar. The bar with its uncomfortable foo foo hard plastic bar stools is always loud due to its hard tile surfaces. The service is unpredictable depending on who is working at the bar. The take out can be a good option but it's take it as it is. Pre made and don,t ask for it any other way. Once again young no personality who gives a shit attitude. Even Burger King will give it to you your way if you ask at a fraction of the price. They are open all the time which is a plus since I often finish working late.

Stopped here for dinner one night while walking the strip. Totally overpriced for the quality and atmosphere, in my opinion, but that's the strip. This is in Mandalay Bay, near all the nicer restaurants, so it's cheaper than everything around it.

The portions here are enormous, which helps make up for the prices. My husband ordered the fish and chips and they brought him an entire fish, battered and fried. Come hungry! I had a pasta dish which wasn't terrible, but definitely not worth the price. They also charged us both different prices than what was listed on the menu.

The dining room is kind of cramped and really dark. Our waiter was friendly.

Overall, it was a decent meal, but I wouldn't go back here.
Went there late night and they have a very limited after hours menu. Food was just ok. Little pricey for what we got but the service was great.

Restaurant looks great from the outside and my review is specifically for the Tuna Salad wrap. Not impressed at all. For $11, it was totally not worth it. The wrap was pretty much tasteless. There is no seasoning in the tuna and it's on a regular flour tortilla. I expected a lot more for the price I was paying. The size of the wrap is decent, but do not go to this place if you're expecting a gourmet tuna salad sandwich/wrap. The only reason I gave this 2 stars was because the staff was friendly.

Citizens gets 5 stars in my book. Hands down the best place to eat after 12a.m in vegas. Prices might seem a little high but when you see the portions you won't be complaining and let's face it, this is vegas and you have to pay for quality.  The staff is great here and upbeat. If you find yourself in Mandalay Bay stop by citizens for a bite!
The food was amazing and the server was so helpful and promp...had an awesome experience...will recommend to all my friends and I will be a returnng costumer.....

Do your self a favor and skip the patty melt, perhaps the worst burger I have ever had in my life. The patty had no seasoning what so ever, the fries were not even warm. The bread was thick but hard on edges. Waiter never checked back u tip the end, only reason i gave it 2 stars is because it was open 24 hours and  my fiancé liked her rueben.
Cool little joint. When I am in town this place is a solid stop for breakfast and lunch.  RaqveL at the bar is awesome! Friendly and informative.  Made the visit worth it!

So Weird to be in Vegas at the Mandalay and not have much choice for good food after 10 p.m. (that are above standard Denny's type food). This place is better than Denny's but the price for what we got is not equivalent to the lack of quality in the dishes. 

If you are starving, it will get you by. With extra spending. 
If you want some GOOD food of quality and care in preparation and presentation, PASS!

Wanted to give a shout out to Destiny 
Her customer service and professionalism was great !!!! And kept the Conversation fun. Ask for her station when you go there ! 5 star !
Great place for lunch, yummy food and yummy drinks! I definitely recommend the mahi mahi tacos, the fish was cooked to perfection!
Awesome food..Great place. Great service. Shanna is the best. Super nice and very attentive. Will definitely come back...

Lotus our server was fantastic . She was prompt for us and went above and beyond for us. She was fun and informative and I will be a repeat customer because of our server .. she kept my ginger ale full thanks !

I normally don't review many things but I have to say the food was great!  However, the bartender was extremely unpleasant and even expressed her "unpleasantness" to her fellow co-workers in front of her guests. 

What should have been a great meal and experience was ruined by a sour attitude. Maybe she was having a bad day???

Was looking forward to having lunch here after spending the day with my family. Up until I was told you had no space in a semi empty restaurant with an empty patio to accommodate a party of 3 adults and a baby in a stroller. They didn't even bother in saying we can put the carrier in a sling or anything. It was just we have no space for you. I've seen chairs and tables moved and space made for everything else but can't make it for a baby. Sad to know that's how you take care of customers. Won't ever go back.
Breakfast was great! Reasonably priced...good service. The manager, JR was very friendly and made us feel at home!

First, let's talk exterior because obviously this is the first thing you see. It looks like a "Home Decor" Pinterest fan's wet dream. Everything about it is cute, warm, and welcoming - definitely a step away from the chic, haute couture-esque vibes that other Light Group places like Yellowtail & Stack aim for. 

This review is only for the beverage & such service, but I don't think it's going to be too far from home. I was meeting a girlfriend at the bar for some drinks after a long workweek and we settled on Citizens because neither of us had been. 

The restaurant was pretty much empty save for the bartop, which was close to being full. Next to us were a group of what looked like A/V or production guys that were just out from a gig at the House of Blues. With no seats, my friend and I posted up at the bar, and were quickly provided bar stools by two observant servers. The bartender was nice but it was hard to get a hold of her when we needed the check. 

I am usually a fan of Light Group venues for the most part, but this one just didn't quite seem to hit the mark. It seems like it could be something really great, but maybe it was just too much hype too soon?

Excellent service at the bar for breakfast. Went there to avoid conference breakfast food and was greeted by friendly staff, smiles, eye contact, and great food. Try the omelets,  granola and yogurt, or oatmeal. Or have all 3 together for a great start.

Stopped by here for lunch and was seated right away. They have a bar and wide range of food options. I had the quiche and mixed green salad. It was hot and delicious! I'm picky about quiche and this was excellent. The salad was fresh and had a nice lemon vinaigrette. Great service too. Would visit again. A little pricy but pretty much everything is in LV.
All of us enjoyed burgers and fries.  Great food, prepared and delivered as ordered.  Was actually our 2nd time eating there on this trip.  Open 24 hours so we will probably dine there again.
Everything we ordered lacked flavor. Service was ok. Pricing was high for the quality of food.

Wow terrible food. We were in a rush to grab a bite to eat before a show. So we stopped by to grab a bite.  The food came fast however, the sandwiches we ordered were terrible. I ordered a simple BLT and the bacon was super salty stale and over cooked. It was like chewing glass. Maybe if I was part of circus sideshow then I might have found it enjoyable.  And my friend got a Ruben that made them sick. And it's overpriced as well. You're better off with fast food. Heck White Castle is better than this place.  Should be called Communism instead.

Chicken soup comes in a square bowl, large portion, 3.5 stars for the taste.  French dip was also 3.5 stars, an additional pickle spear would be nice... Fish and chips is served with tartar and cocktail sauce, 4 stars.
I ordered corned beef and ginger snap, quality of the food is great.  Corned beef is not overly grease, great crispy texture and very tasty.

I am sure there are greater things on the menu rather than what I had ordered my first time here. I got the mac and cheese... and I was not able to finish it from how greasy and mushy it was. Not the right balance but I can't give a bad review based on just trying one thing! My drink tasted great and staff was friendly and quick in the wee hours of the night. Hopefully I have a chance to be there again to try something different

If you happen to be in Mandalay Bay, check out Citizens restaurant. I was showing my "tourist"  friends around this hotel last night when we decided we want to rest our feet a bit. And there in the middle of everything was Citizens. It seemed like a pretty slow night. Few tables in the other side of the restaurant and just us in our side :) exactly what we needed. Lotus ( i will never forget this name. I mean how can you? ) was our server. She was professional and had a great personality and funny at the same time. She made us laugh GOOD at least 3 times. Lol. She helped us navigate through the menu and recommended her favorite bottle of of wine. It was spot on!! We then asked her to get us some munchies and said we trusted her. She got us some calamari, artichoke dip and potato skins. AGAIN SPOT ON!! They were all delish. She finished us off with a carrot cake to share ( it's HUGE) and some coffee. After chitchatting and winding down for abt 2 HOURS, we were all refreshed and left to walk some more. Great food and awesome service. Thanks for awesome experience to citizens and Lotus! I will definitely be back :)
Not bad for desperate diners who have been on the road for 10 hours trying to get to Vegas and need something to eat at 2 am.

The food was ok.  Well maybe.  After taking my $35 they told me I could not eat in the place.  They had me leave.  I promptly returned the viscous salad to the unapologetic which manning the payment station.  Tell people they can't find there before taking their money.  Also hire a few people that handle this crap better than a 24/7 McD.

Our server Art was attentive, helpful, and funny. The portion sizes are bigger than expected and completely welcome. We ordered the Brick Chicken and the Meatloaf, both were delicious. We skipped dessert but only because we were so full and on our way to another location. Definitely will return the next time we visit Las Vegas. Thank you, Art!

Had another awesome lunch with my kids at Citizen's. Arturo Camacho was our server and he was fantastic! Service was great and he took great care of us. He made sure we had a great experience! Thank You!

Since we are locals, we rarely go to the strip; however we had guests visiting so we had to be polite and take one for the team.

We stopped at Citizens for a quick meal, hoping I would be able to find something that would fit my odd dietary needs. 

I hate asking the servers for guidance; mostly because it's never a simple process and it's frustrating.

We were fortunate to have Robert M. as our server. He was happy to help me navigate the menu and steer me away from the ingredients I avoid. Robert M. also made sure I didn't feel like it was too much trouble to ask and was quick to joke with us.

He also helped choose wine to go with my companions meals; I don't drink but they were very happy by the time we left!

Breakfast was a waste.  Pancakes were not fresh.  Tasted like they were out of a warmer. They were stuck together as if they had been sitting and sweating on each other for an hour. Eggs were a 3 on a 1-10 scale. Then the dish came with some unadvertised glop that appeared to be an attempt as a south west style hash brown mixture but all it did was make the rest of my food taste like hot peppers.

Please don't eat here!! I love to eat, trust this is true! For the price and the sake of being surrounded by highly renowned chefs/ restaurants this place was a letdown. My husband, friends and I came here for breakfast and the food was cold. (How do you mess up breakfast?!) My eggs Benedict was overly poached and hash browns were cold. I asked if they could just bring out another side of hot hash browns and that's exactly what I got. My second plate of hash browns tasted like rubbery overheated hash. What do you expect if it came out a few mid later. Despite the reviews we gave it shot and the reviews were right, sadly. I mentioned to the waitress that my eggs were suppose to be runny and dripping yolk over my toast and all she could do was apologize. The manager on shift was snooty when she came over to our table. She asked why we didn't enjoy our food and asked if we would like another dish but had an unfriendly demeanor. We felt really awkward and just wanted to leave. Denny's would have been a better choice.

Great food, huge portions, weird servers. 
The disco fries are worth trying. The nachos, fish and chips and sandwiches are all enormous but actually very good. Love the steak fries with the fish and chips. 
Our server was a little strange and touchy...made some people feel uncomfortable.

For a 24 hour restaurant the food, look, and service are very good. The menue is simple but good. The bar offers great drinks. Our service could have been faster and the noise can be an issue but I was very happy with my late night dining.

The food was surprising good.  I ate the reuben sandwich with a side of cole slaw which I thought was so delicious.  Never had I ate a sandwich like this!  The bread was toasted well, light and very crispy.  The corned beef was generous and tasty.  The thousand island dressing, sauerkraut, and Swiss cheese together made the sandwich awesome.  Cole slaw on the side complimented the sandwich.  Excellent!

Loved this place so I came back in the evening and had their popular French onion soup and a side salad.  The soup tasted like heaven and portions were generous.  3 different types of cheeses, thick and gooey, covered slivers of soft sweet onions chunks of bread soaked in the soup...It was the first time that I couldn't finish my soup!

Great service! Great food! The servers are very nice. 
They have many good juices to try. 
The tots were out of this world. Worth a try. I loved them. Coming back soon!
The bartender Raquel was very personable and was so knowledgeable with the menu. I was here for a convention and she definitely made my experience memorable. I will be back.
This is the perfect late night spot. The food is actually pretty damn amazing. We had the French onion soup, the blue cheese burger and the mahi tacos. So glad we went. Would definitely go again.

Well when everything else is closed at 4AM and Mandalay Bay room service wait time is 2 hours, there's nothing left but Subway and Citizens.  Service was really nice but the food was okay.  Chicken noodle soup was not pleasing to my easily pleased, drunk tastebuds.  Nachos were good but when is nachos never good?  

Oh and another thing, we had a party of 6, but only 4 of us were present at the time. Hostess would only seat us at a table for 4 and said we can move to a bigger table when the rest of the party arrived.  I meaaaaan, the restaurant was practically empty at 4am, but okay.

I am writing this review because of excellent service we received from Teasha. She waited on us for breakfast during Interbike 2016 and was so good that we returned to the restaurant the next morning and asked for her. She was cheerful, helpful and extremely efficient. She didn't even write anything down but got all of our orders perfectly. Marjorie Rugg - you have a great waitress in Teasha and we hope to see her again next September while we are attending Interbike 2017.

Ordered the signature Bloody Mary. Huge crab leg, shrimp, and beef jerky. It was a meal in itself. Worth it, even though it's kind of pricey. The creme brûlée French toast was excellent as well as the corned beef hash. Service was good too.

This place is awesome. I have been here a few times with a group and the food is always wonderful. I have had the doughnut breakfast sandwich twice now and it's so amazing. You must try it!! Tuna sandwich, quesadilla, and BLT was great as well!

visited citizen this morning, what a difference from last review I wrote. we were taken care of by Rachel. she is just ray sunshine what a sweet smile. And another thing "the food". absolutely loved my breakfast. Got the eggs Benedict. I will recommend this restaurant to everyone.

Good food at a decent price for a big Vegas hotel. I had a turkey and avocado sandwich which was stuffed full of fresh sliced turkey. It came with crisp french fries. It was a nice presentation. The sandwich was easy to eat too, it didn't fall apart when I picked it up. It came on sliced cranberry walnut bread that had a good texture and flavor. I could only finish half of it. The other half was my breakfast the next day. I also got a good bloody mary, nicely spiced. Service was good. The interior was too noisy for my taste, between the high ceilings and tiled floors, so we ate in the sidewalk café section. That's a better place to watch people anyway, and half the fun of coming to Las Vegas. Good bargain for the money. I recommend it!
Had a nice time being served in the bar by Steven S.  Great food and drink on 6/4/16 before the Heart concert!

Citizens is the best 24 hour restaurant in Las Vegas. It is the perfect place to grab a bite at any time of the day. Try the French onion soup or if your really hungry, get the prime rib. Also If your in a hurry you can always order from the deli counter.
Service was not the worst but definitely not the best.  All the food tasted frozen, the artichoke dip, the calamari, even the beef. Not good. Pricey for frozen food!
Excellent mahi mahi tacos.  Maybe the best that I've had anywhere.  All the food looked really good.  Pricey, but in line with casino/resort pricing.  Good, friendly service.

Really overpriced food! I really wouldn't mind the prices if the food was worth it, but my Brick Chicken was too dry and seriously wasn't worth 24 dollars. The portion for that thing was too small. 

Go somewhere else to get better food in Vegas. Even when the place was empty the food took forever to come out!

Staff members are unprofessional and lazy. I waited 15 minutes longer for hot tea water and asked for ice (ahead of time) and overheard an employee say "we are out of ice and I'm not going to the bar to get it!" If you are too lazy to help a customer, I suggest a new line of work.
Excellent service and food! If you're  in Vegas and looking for a great meal that is also a good value (very rare in Vegas), you will find that at Citizens.

Items here are actually quite expensive, especially for what they are.  Cost aside though, the food here is purely average.  If you decide to order something here, it is likely pre made.  All of the sandwiches were pre assembled and sitting together in a large container with the same sandwiches.

The smoothies were pretty good. We tried the green machine smoothie and I thought it was enjoyable.

The cashiers here both times I visited were pretty nice and service was not an issue, although I did order something that they didn't already have pre made, so I did have to wait a little bit longer than everyone else, including a few people who ordered after me.

Sat at the bar and truly enjoyed my experience. Bartender is very personable which pays dividends. Good eats and drinks. Killer music soundtrack playing as well. A place I may come back to tomorrow as I am here on a conference.

A casual American restaurant located inside Mandalay Bay is a great option for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

There is a to go bar to order off the limited menu, which has sandwiches, salads, juices and coffee. I dined in for lunch on Saturday and the service was horrible. It was not busy at all, yet the waitress was very slow to take our order and to deliver the check.

I ordered the mushroom bleu burger, which is exactly how it sounds, a burger with bleu cheese, mushrooms, jalapeño, lettuce, onion and tomato. It is a bit pricey for a typical burger that did not stand out.

I would try this place again and try another dish with another server, but it didn't give a lasting first impression. I recommend it to hotel guests not wanting to leave the hotel, but there are other restaurants in the Mandalay Bay Shoppes including another burger joint.

My best friend Megan and I ate at the bar area. Steven was our bartender and server. He catered to us based on his very accurate observations. He was an excellent server and bartender, he had amazing advice, and was really easy and fun to get along with. Because of him, my friend and I will both suggest the exceptional service and quality of food and drink that we received. It's not overally common to get such tailored service that we did, but we both really appreciate it, and highly highly recommend this place, for both hominess, quality, and experience. This is a really cool place :)
Nice bistro/ café feel. Had an awesome breakfast and an amazing experience. Shanna was great with her service and super friendly bubbly personality. Will definitely be back and highly recommend.

I stopped by for a smoothie which tasted pretty good. I had the Berrylicious for about $10. The problem was the service. The girl who made my smoothie made it quickly but left my drink behind the counter and went to the back. Someone else happened  to come out and noticed that I was waiting for my order. The girl came out again but never even bothered to look at me. I shouldn't have been surprised because a customer before me was waiting and had to ask for her order which was sitting on the counter waiting to be picked up.
As good as it gets as far as comfort food goes! Love the meatball grinder. Can even grab a coffee here, lattes are great! Def a must!
We had to wait 30 min before the food came out, and the waitress was a stoic bitch. The food was just mediocre and over priced.

The food is quite expensive but it is located inside the casino so it's something that should be expected. Our waiter was Art and he was very nice and answered our question well. He was also worked well considering how busy it was. The food was also good. The spaghetti had really good garlic bread with it.  You also get free cheesecake if you check in

Food (Breakfast) was wonderful.  Waffles, steak, and Juice smoothies were great actually.  The price is a different story - yes it is expensive.

We had lunch here as well - their Steak chili frieds are fabulous.  Sandwiches are ok.  Cobb salad was no bueno, but bbq chicken salad is good.

Their servers are decent.  They screwed up our togo order (horribly) - that is why the 3 stars instead of 4 stars.

Bland. Slow. Cold. Food came out one at a time - one of our girls didn't get her gross breakfast burrito until 30 min after we all got our food.  "crispy potatoes" inside of breakfast burrito were mushy French fries. Mgr. tried to "save" the service by offering "shots" which ended up being watered down blueberry vodka - I swear I saw him spit into one bringing it up to his mouth at the bar.  SAVE YOURSELF and avoid.
Service was average. We went for breakfast and split an omelette. I thought the food was fine although definitely overpriced..even for Vegas.
Absolutely the worst & slowest service in Vegas! 50 minutes to get our food, an hour & a half total. There were only 4 tables with people at them. Ridiculous!

World famous bacon egg on a kaiser roll. Add .50 for a donut. Mistake. . 50 more drops the kaiser roll entirely and they serve the eggs and bacon between 2 donuts . True gastrononsense. Dirty tables no attention to detail in cleaning. Why no spoons on their tables. Tragic won't come here again.
Thumbs up the food is Delicious I'm here for breakfast I had the Biscuits and Gravy with a side of sasauge and bacon.. Yummy lol

This place is charming and has delicious food. 

Love the decor and theme of this restaurant. The customer service was on point and very friendly. 

I had the bacon burger with a side of mac n' cheese. Wow out of this world, the bacon is so delicious you will want more and more. 

I will definitely be coming back to try other menu items that caught my eye. 

Thank you for the great experience and delicious food!

Went for a late night dinner after checking in at Mandalay Bay. Had one of the best fish and chips ever. The fish was nice and thick also huge. The batter was thin and crispy exactly what you would expect. My party also ordered the fish tacos and brick chicken both were recommended as well. Only thing was there was music playing really loud just outside the restaurant made it difficult to talk but the food made up for that.

Food is decent. Visited this restaurant on two separate occasions and the management should fire them selves. There's absolutely no leadership. All of the waitstaff run around like chickens with their heads chopped off. There's Apsley no organization whatsoever. Fail!!!

Citizens is just a horrible example of a standard hotel restaurant.  The food was mediocre but priced on the high end of other similar restaurants.  The service was poor and the server was very inattentive.

If you are walking through Mandalay Bay and decide you are hungry, do not choose to stop here.  We were hungry and we saw this place. It didn't look like there was a long wait, so we put our name in. She said 10 minutes. After 25 mins I asked what's up. She said "That time was an estimation and as soon as the "right" table opens we will be sat". I said ok.. 5 mins later we had a table. Now mind you the surrounding 4 tables were empty too. We sat there for at least 10 minutes  before anyone even came over. We ordered drinks, I a soda, my nephews soda and the last a water no lemon. When guy finally brought the drinks he brought water with lemon. My mom is allergic so we asked if he would just change it out. He had the worst attitude and when he came back
he tossed the water on the table.This was completely offensive. I located the manager and asked or another server. The new server was nice but extremely slow. The surrounding tables all got their food long before we did. It was just not a fun experience. We will never, ever be back!
Service is terrible. Hostess was very unfriendly. She said they are closed for transition from breakfast to lunch but offered no solutions. Was very rude and dismissive.

Stumbled upon Citizen on a quite Monday morning.  Tim was an awesome server and really was spot on with his recommendations.  French toast was great and the orange zest in the whipped cream was a nice touch.  The breakfast burrito was great and had tons of flavor with good guacamole.  Fresh fruit smoothie was made from scratch, not from a mix.  Cool vibe, decor, and good tunes.  A solid discovery!
The ultimate Bloody Mary could easily be a meal in itself ! The chicken noodle soup and buttered crackers hit the spot . The service was a tad bit slow.

We eat at Mandalay Bay occasionally, when we get enough poker comps to enjoy a nice lunch  We were there with our 9 month old so we opted to sit outside of the main dining room on the "patio." The hostesses were very sweet, one even came over to meet our little guy. Our server Deon was great, very personable. When the food & beverages arrived he even made sure they were far enough from the baby so he couldn't grab. We had the lasagna, french dip, cheesecake and I enjoyed a blueberry spritz - all were delicious. It was a very nice experience and I'm happy to give them 5 stars!

If you go here expect to be overcharged and disappointed. I asked is they had actual corned beef hash or the stuff from a can. The server said they do their own. So I ordered that. The only thing they do is open their own can and fry it up. I had more oil in my dish than a super tanker. I pointed this out to the server who asked if I wanted him to take it back and get something else instead. I sent it back as inedible and I was not happy that they tried passing of the $2 canned stuff as their own. I got the eggs benedict which was mediocre but not terrible. I was then billed for both items when I asked about this they were not willing to correct it and said that they had to make both dishes it is not their fault I am not happy with their food.

If you want actual corned beef go to Ri Ra in the same casino. If you want good food and service try any place but this one.

Typical Las Vegas hotel restaurant. Everything is an up charge. My boyfriend had the eggs Benedict while I had the waffle and that's all you get - the waffle. We paid extra for fruit and extra for a side of bacon (like $7 for 6 pieces!!!). This place is only worth if you're staying at the Mandalay Bay or maybe even The Luxor, otherwise I'd go elsewhere.

Got appetizers here with my girlfriend at 1 in the morning after failing to find a 24 hour pizza joint. The kobe chili was excellent, and the calamari was good as well. The chorizo queso was too salty and had a weird texture.

Me:" do you serve breakfast food?"
Rude hostesses:"no it's brunch, look at this menu"
** hands me a menu of ONLY breakfast food items**
I know that brunch is a combination of lunch and breakfast but if I'm asking if you serve breakfast food just say "yes" and don't make me feel like an idiot for your lack of social skills and common sense to understand what I'm literally asking. I had a party of 4 and we all were confused and put off by this weird altercation that it actually made us laugh for 15 minutes. Oh and my eggs Benedict was $18 which I thought was also hilarious.

Awesome location and people. If your ever here please ask for Ivonne she will make your day lovely. This lady should get a raise just for how inviting she makes the atmosphere feel. Definitely a must try!

I had a late night snack with some friends here. The chili cheese fries were good. It's not put together. They have the chili cheese in a bowl and you dip your fries in. Yummy! I had their turkey burger and it was pretty decent. The fries are a must.

Food was OK but service was very, very slow :c
After looking at my food and reading some of the reviews, I hope I don't get food poisoning.
Great breakfast! Eggs Benedict was awesome! Service was friendly and fast. Coffee tasted great, was really surprised to find this place so good for breakfast

Was just here, picked up a fresh juice. It was tasty. 

The cashier couldn't have been more unfriendly, totally flat and unwelcoming. 

I've been in the service industry for 8+ yrs even if you are having a bad day, you still have to suck it up, put a smile on your face and be nice to customers! 

So juice gets five stars, service gets two stars.

Stopped by today with my husband and had Destiny as my waitress. She was extremely informative and super sweet. She suggested the BBQ chicken salad and it was delicious.  My husband ordered the turkey sandwich with avocado, she was right about the cranberry bread was awesome my husband really enjoyed it.  A little pricey but really big portions.

The food here is great! Ordered on several occasions and happy with every meal! Love the atmosphere, it's not a high end restaurant but more of an eccentric, rugged, everyone fits in type of place - modern American - and I loved it! The waiters are awesome, very attentive. Bonus: open 24/7 and it's perfect for those after the bar/club munchies.
Had a great meal.  Lotus was a wonderful  waitress. There were 6 of us and she got our order right without writing it down.  Everyone loved their food.  Highly recommend this place.

I definitely would recommend this place. We went to this place right before the MJ One show.  We didn't make reservations and was seated within 5 minutes. We were pressed for time and I swear I've never had faster service. I had the grilled hockey sandwich and it was delicious. They give you a lot of food! I couldn't finish my fries. Definitely trendy and nice atmosphere.

WARNING: the "Late Night" menu starts at 7:55PM.  This is so crazy that I drove all the way from Wynn to eat my usual, fish & chips, brick chicken, gumbo, etc... but wasn't to be...  what good is all of good reviews if you can't order the lunch / dinner when you get there?... This place is soooo lame now.   My fav place of 5 years, quickly became a place that I will never go back.  This place will probably go out of business if they keep pulling BS and can't take care of "regulars" like me.  Time to look for new place that I can leave good reviews for y'all yelpers!

Ugh! I only went here a second time (on a separate Vegas trip) because my group was starved and drunk... and couldn't walk another hundred feet to another restaurant or something ridiculous....  I can't remember.

BUT I CAN REMEMBER HOW SHITTY BOTH MY VISITS HERE WERE!
The first time, I ordered a pretty basic burger that ended up coming to the table late and undercooked.  While I would typically eat it if it was anything else (my standards of food are pretty low), I would probably have yakked it out if I decided to eat it.  I asked for it to be recooked, but the waiter was pretty unresponsive about me getting a new one, so I didn't even end up eating it as my group was in a rush.  I gave up and decided to never come back again....

But I did, several months later.  This time, our group was much bigger (about 10) so understandably, it would take a while to get our food.  However, we were there for maybe a half hour-45 AFTER ordering and our waitress passed by our table once, only after we all spent time staring at her from across the room.  Finally got the food and it was cold as Antarctica.  Wow! It's like they cooked it on time but left it on the counter to hang out or something.  Some people at my table refused to eat most of their food so I asked (shamelessly) if they "were gonna eat that" so I could doggy bag it.  Even the boxes took some effort to acquire.  I was determined to salvage as much as I could from this experience and never return again!  

Oh, 24 hr Vegas McDonald's.  I will never forsake you again.

Good and bad...this would be a 4/5 star because the quality of the food and flavor was really good......but my experience was annoying. I called them at 5 AM asking about the menu options at that hour and they said that the to go part was open and what I wanted to order was available when I told her. Once I got there and made my order(Turkey avocado sandwich), they said they were out of the cranberry walnut bread it's normally served on, which is part of why I wanted to go there to try it and they should've told me that on the phone. Whatever, I got it on sourdough instead. Then I ordered a chicken Caesar salad, the chicken soup and the green mean juice shake. They said that they wouldn't serve me the soup because it had been sitting there all day..... Ok then why have it on a late night menu if you're not going to serve it? 

Once I got home I realize there was no avocado in my turkey avocado sandwich...again annoying...to pay for something I didn't get and not wanting to drive all the way back for it. Anyways, the food still tasted good and I could tell was fresh. 

My bill was $35 for a salad, sandwich and drink.....pretty pricy but I don't mind paying to bad because the quality was good. I will definitely come back here to try it again. Hopefully this next time I'll have a better experience and can give it more stars.
Didn't get a chance to even eat. We just left there moments ago. Both hostess were really rude for no apparent reason. Gave them a chance to correct politely. No luck.

Every time I stay at Mandalay, Citizens will forever be my go to spot! Not only is it open 24/7 but it basically has your breakfast lunch or dinner. This time we ordered the tuna melt, frisco melt & a tuna sandwhich that all came with fries! Again everything was on point. Easy, fast & casual. Check in on Yelp for your free cheesecake! The donuts we took to go were delicious! 

Our waiter was very helpful with the menu for the first timers so thank you for that! Very fast, helpful & attentive!

Def not a bad spot for Vegas. The hash browns were really good. Service was good. I like higher quality food but it's tough to find in Vegas. I was in a rush , so I picked this place. I  would go there again, in a pinch!
GARBAGE!!!! what they serve here is not real food.....it's all frozen crap they microwave or fry then expect you to eat and pay for.

We had breakfast here on Halloween morning. I had the traditional Eggs Benedict with breakfast potatoes. BEST EGGS BENEDICT I ever had....Seriously. Best coffee too. They serve Lavazzo Coffee which is amazing and very smooth in taste. Can't wait to go back. Oh and was waitress was super sweet.
I have ate at a lot of restaurant here and this is by far the best and Art is a fabulous waiter. I highly recommend this place to everyone

Staying at Mandalay Bay, we ate breakfast here several times, and the breakfast was always solid. The lattes were good, regular coffee was also tasty, and you get a lot of food for the price. 

The downside was the service - we never really had a good server the whole time we were there. I'm not sure why the middle-of-the-road restaurants in Vegas seem to have such lack-luster staff - you'd think that people would be lining up for those jobs, but we seem to only get good servers in the super-high-end places. 

Anyway, Citizens is worth the money for breakfast - and if you can share a plate, even better.

We arrived on 8/21 around midnight and found the only 24 hour restaurant in Mandalay Bay (why!?). Waited for 10 minutes to get seated when the left half of the restaurant appeared empty. Hostess acted like she was doing us a favor by speaking to us-- not friendly at all.

We were finally seated in a small deuce crammed next to a party of 4. We felt like we were sitting on top of our neighbors, when there were at least 3 other open tables nearby that weren't jammed top of anyone else. 

We waited for 10 minutes with no greeting by anyone. We finally just cut our losses and walked out, figuring that if our experience was that bad already, it wasn't worth waiting to see how bad it could get.

We ate here and we all loved the food. This isn't gourmet dining more like a higher end coffee shop in my opinion but with more selection of booze. I found the prices to be reasonable for a Vegas restaurant, people can't expect to eat at Denny's prices in Vegas in a higher end hotel. Even Starbucks charges double the price in the hotel. We ordered the chicken sandwich (excellent and fresh), Caesars salad (just enough dressing),  chicken fingers, buffalo wings, and nachos( it was a huge platter). All the portions were huge and was just yummy, if your kids aren't big eaters they could easily share a platter. I recommended this place to a friend and they loved it also. Our server was Lerani and she was so nice and just a great server, I would ask for her if I was to go back. This for sure will be a place for us to eat at when we stay at the Mandalay or Delano.

I've decided to hold off this review because I wanted to come here a couple of times to make sure it was just because I was starving. The food is decent, but massively over-priced, but it is open 24hrs. Large portions, make it easy to do a tapas style meal. Order a couple of appetizers and get a salad and you get a pretty decent meal without having to gorge yourself on one entree.

OK service, decent menu selection, and they have pastries, and smoothies. Try it out.

Food & service alone would have been 4 stars, "management" deducted 2.  Small issue, could have easily been rectified, no biggie, but ended up talking to this "Marjorie" person who said that she was the GM. What a pathetic excuse for anybody who believes that they are actually running a business. Make the customer feel like a jackass, then berate your staff (within earshot of at least 5 other customers, who, by the way were also appalled by her behavior). I actually tipped the server double because I felt so bad that he was subjected to this hostile work environment even though what happened was not his fault. PS. Marjorie; I saw your electronically generated responses to other Yelp posts. Save your time & please don't respond that way to mine, if you don't have time to respond personally, don't bother. After witnessing the way you openly insult your customers & your own staff there is nothing more I need to hear from you unless it's your supervisors contact information.

The food was great, but I docked off a star for the painfully slow service and inattentive staff. 

I came with a group of 4 and we came in the late afternoon for lunch. Even though there were empty tables, it took around 10 minutes before we were seated. We ordered as soon as possible because we were starving and it took 30 minutes for our food to come out even though none of the dishes we ordered were complex. We ordered two salads, an artichoke dip, and a teriyaki chicken bowl. I got the BBQ chicken salad, and it was pretty good. There were a lot of different ingredients, such as beans, onion rings, corn, and avocado, so I didn't get sick of it. Portions were pretty big, and I was actually full from the salad, but I don't think it was worth $19. I also tried the artichoke dip, which was pretty good! It came with two different kinds of chips. I liked the pita one better. The artichoke dip was hot, creamy, and cheesy.

Came here for breakfast during a big convention weekend and was surprised to see the staff handle their tables pretty well despite the chaos.  As for food,  nothing special at all.  In fact, very underwhelming.  I had the Greek omelette with egg whites and friend had the eggs Benedict sub salmon.  Mine was tasteless, even the side of fruit! Friend's smoked salmon tasted funny and potatoes were underdone.  Wouldn't come back.

We had brunch here on vacation. We both ordered the ultimate breakfast. 2 eggs, bacon, homestyle potatoes and 3 pancakes. I had scrambled and my husband had over easy. The scrambled were fine but the over easy were overcooked. No runny yolk at all. Bacon and potatoes were good but cold. The pancakes were hands down the worst ever. They were cold, hard as a rock and sponge like. We tried cutting them with a knife and it was impossible. We ended up not eating them. I've had microwavable pancakes with more texture and flavor. Disappointing for a $21 A piece breakfast. Terrible slow service. The cafe wasn't even busy and it took forever to get cold food. The fact that it wasn't busy, in the main entry from Mandalay Bay to the restaurants, should have tipped us off that this was not the best choice.

As typical of Vegas casino food it's expensive. Let's get that out of the way. It's about $20 a plate. That said, the food is actually quite good. I came for breakfast and they were fast and very friendly. When I finished up they gave me some extra coffee in a to go cup which was very nice. Overall I'd certainly eat here again.

I'm only giving this place an extra star for the spinach dip because it was reeeally good. I got the pasta and didn't even take a bite of it because it smelled so bad. The other people in my party tasted it and said it was gross. The chicken quesadilla was bland, the fish tacos were SUUUUPER fishy and the tortillas were mushy. The burger was dry and came out twenty minutes after another person in our party's chicken sandwich. And to top it off, the waiter was rude. The manager was kind enough to take off a whopping twenty percent of our bill for food most of us didn't even eat. Won't be going back.

Really delicious foods including sandwiches, appetizers, steak, burgers and salads. The service was amazing! They also have a bar and a cafe like spot where you can pick up food on the run. However, I did think the prices were a little high for what we got, but what else would you expect from a luxurious hotel!
Citizens Restaurant in Mandalay Bay Hotel is awesome...Raquel that's works behind bar is friendly, easy to talk to, and always has a smile. God bless her and everyone else associated with Citizens!!!

It's nice that it is open late and that things are premade so it can be a quick grab and go, but it also is annoying that things are premade because you cannot customize anything. I don't like mayo and unfortunately every premade sandwich has mayo. I got the cous cous salad (twice). It was pretty good, although probably not worth the $12. Just veggies and cous cous, no meat at all. Something you could get at a deli or supermarket for like $4. 
 
They have breakfast sandwiches too. I didn't have them, but I get the feeling they'd be descent.
Erick gave us amazing service during a busy time!! He is an intelligent man that knows his business!!!  We ate dinner and enjoyed a cocktail.  Thank you, we will be back!!!

Many of the restaurants inside Mandalay Bay are on the pricier end, but Citizens offered an eye-catching Prime Rib dinner deal served with broccoli, salad, baked potato and glass of house wine. All of this for $49 per person!  We saw this as quite a bargain, especially considering that the glass of wine costs about $10 by itself. 

The hostess told us at the door that the prime rib would be 8 ounces, but it turned out to be a whopping 14!  Our waiter laughed with us as our jaws dropped when the entrees arrived. (He was friendly and provided great service throughout our meal.)

Wow, I've never eaten so much beef in one sitting. It was cooked to a perfect medium as requested, but could have used a bit more seasoning and the quality of the meat wasn't that great. It had a somewhat grainy texture. Considering the price of the dinner deal though, we couldn't expect the best cut of beef. For something more top notch, StripSteak is down the hall, but at much steeper prices of course. You get what you pay for! As for the side items, our portions of Caesar salad were generous, crisp and fresh. The baked potato was huge, topped with cheese, sour cream and some chives, but was still unfortunately dry and starchy inside as opposed to being fluffy. 
If you order this dinner special, make sure to come hungry! 

Citizens is open 24 hours and serves typical American fare day and night. Peering around at neighboring tables, their burgers and fries looked delicious so I'd recommend just based on appearance! The main restaurant is sit-down, but they also have a deli section for ordering items like sandwiches, salads and desserts at the counter to grab and go. 

3.5 stars.

Burger is dry and cold, no sauce and cheese wouldn't even melt. I had to drink two glasses of water to swallow a bite. It gets stuck in your throat. The worst burger I've ever eaten, especially for $20.  The nachos are okay and the spinach artichoke dip is average at best. It is drunk people food and the only choice at 3:00 am. Next time I'll go to bed hungry.

The crab cake Benedict is AMAZING! Pricy place but WELL worth the money. Huge portions, especially on the pancakes. The rasberry tea is SO good, not too sweet. Everything that the table ordered looked beyond my expectations. Delicious. A++. Definitely come here if you have the chance.

Had dinner here tonight before the Ellie Goulding concert. Ordered the nachos with chicken which were listed as $16 plus $6 for chicken. 

Some how they changed the price to $22 plus $6 for the chicken so I paid $30 for nachos....I understand this is a hotel but $30 for a plate of regular nachos is just ridiculous. 

Luckily we still made it to the concert on time and I could have stayed and complained about the $6 up charge but I just wanted to get to the concert on time. 

So overall I won't be back unless someone talks me into returning. Waste of $30 plus $4 for a soda....

We had a surprisingly delicious brunch on our last day in Vegas here. We ordered the Benedict and it was flawless! Perfect toasted English muffin, ham, and seriously great poached eggs topped with hollandaise. The potatoes that came with it were hot and delicious. This was one of our favorite breakfasts that we had all week! We were guests of the hotel and I wish we would have known how good everything was here, we would have come more often!

I was surprised that this place had such negative reviews.  We had breakfast here and we all liked it. The food was good, the prices were decent and the atmosphere was nice. Our server Shanna was very nice, personable and accommodating. Megan the hostess had great customer service on the phone too!

Food was great. Service was atrocious. Had to get up and get a waiter to come take our order after waiting 30 minutes. The coffee urn did. It have a top, they just put a syrup cup on top which would fall off every time you poured a cup. Luckily the food was fantastic. Need to management and waitstaff here. They don't do a very good job.

This place was just want I needed. Has a bit of everything to make everyone and any one happy.

Huge portions of food! Very good as we'll worth the price!

After drinking numerous shots of who knows what out of a leg-shaped chalice, I ended up here with my husband hungry as hell. Surprisingly it was open. It is actually one of the few restaurants on the strip that is open 24 hours a day. Thank goodness! I was told that no outside drinks were allowed, so I had to chug the last third of my drink on the spot. #Winning

Our server was smug and took our order quickly. We ordered a Stella (I had water, boooooo), fried calamari and home mustard buffalo wings. When our food arrived, it was more than enough for two people. The wings were juicy and flavorful. The bleu cheese dressing was creamy and not tangy like some cheap substitutes. Fried calamari wasn't greasy and we ended up scarfing that down first. All in all, a good experience. So why not 5 stars? Our server went M.I.A. after he dropped our food off and getting our food to us took longer than expected for two appetizers. Still, this is a place I'll be coming back to the next time I'm in Vegas.

Came here to get brunch with my friends and we had a great time. We had Stephanie helping us out. She was very sweet.  I got the Caesar salad and my friend got the lobster roll.  My salad was okay but the lobster roll was delicious. I took a picture of it.  Definitely will come back for the lobster roll.  I also had coffee which was standard.  This place is nicely decorated and there's seating outside-ish.  It wasn't really outside since you are still inside Mandaly Bay.  When we were leaving, my friend left his credit card and Stephanie ran after us to give it back to him.  4 stars for Stephanie for sure.

Seriously worst service ever.  The waiter didn't even acknowledge our table for about 10 minutes.  We put our food and drink order then.  We waited and waited and waited for our food.  We ordered a salad and grilled chicken sandwich.  It took over 45 minutes for our food and not once did our server come over.  We almost left drink money and left.  The food was good but the service was  ridiculous.

Citizens' menu features mostly comfort foods and is open 24 hours.  I ordered the French Dip with french fries and a side of macaroni and cheese, and it was extremely delicious!  However, there really isn't much else I would have ordered from this restaurant.  Our server was friendly, but nothing too spectacular.

THE FRENCH DIP WAS THE BEST FRENCH DIP I HAVE EVER HAD!  The meat was of high quality, the au jus was tasty, and the bread was delicious as well.  It all went together so perfectly, although a tad bit salty (which was to be expected).  The french fries were sliced thinly and crispy, with some kind of seasoning that was perfect!  The macaroni and cheese was extremely tasty with peas and ham inside.  The cheese was so creamy and flavorful and the breadcrumbs that topped the dish was perfectly sprinkled with herbs.  

Citizens is a very casual barstaurant with an interesting atmosphere.  My meal was served on a silver tray that was reminiscent of a elementary school cafeteria tray.  My friend's sandwich was served on a cutting board.  The "kitchen" theme here is very prevalent and unique in Las Vegas.

I would definitely go back to Citizens again.  I went for lunch, so I would be interesting in checking out their drinks one night as well.  Or perhaps to try their 24 sliders in 24 minutes challenge!

I was staying at Mandalay Bay for the first time this past weekend. A group of us wanted to get something quick and convenient. I ordered the Corn-beef Rueben, it was good  and goes perfectly well with the coleslaw I got. The price was decent comparing to other options in the hotel. 

The Corn-beef Rueben was delicious, slightly on the heavy taste, but the flavor wise was good. I personally think it would have goes well with some mustard on the side just get a little kick to it. We also ordered chicken-noodle soup which is perfect for a hangover remedy. Last but not least, the nacho with chicken that comes in double size is not bad but it would have been better to have little bit more cheese and pico de gallo. Overall, I would come back to visit if I'm in the area.

We ate here after a concert at Mandalay Bay beach. 
This was the only place that was open after the show. 

The food was ok and definitely tasted better because we were drinking. 

My issue isn't  the food. 

My bill was charged to my room and the following morning when I got ready to check out I noticed the  waitress increased the tip.  

It took on call to the front desk and two calls to the restaurant before the issue was fixed. 

Sadly the restaurant manager didn't seem supposed by the fraud that had occurred.

Excellent food! Great service! They're very quick with service, and very friendly. You can have a great meal and move along so you can explore the rest of Fabulous Las Vegas! 

Lobster roll, turkey sandwich, anything you get will be amazing! Lizzy is a great bartender also.

A nice late night alternative in Las Vegas. Delicious healthy kale salad and a nice selection of home town deliciacies. Open 24 hrs     A enormous brownie sundae seals the deal. Ask for Chris for real good service.very good pricing and value for Vegas standards

I ended up here after the Mandalay's unknowledgeable staff said this was the only cafe in the hotel and I was deeply disappointed.  We ordered the prime rib and meatloaf and a couple of crappy signature drinks that escape me right now.
