The red flag should have been when the food arrived in less than 10 minutes, but I was hoping they were just ridiculously efficient. I tasted the meatloaf and that was OK, good even, but worth $25+? Absolutely not. The prime rib was $31 and served with 3 onion rings. It was cold, chewy, and tasteless. On a positive, service was attentive so no issues there. I, for sure won't be planning to come back, its WAAAYYYY overpriced and just not that great.

Great if you want a quick bite and coffee. There's however a price for the convenience: Our two mediocre sandwich and lousy coffees cost almost $40!  I'll go to the Starbucks around the corner next time for food and coffee..! To top it off, the cashier was not that nice and friendly, as she was annoyed at customers in her presence. OK, moving on....

Every time I come to Vegas, I look forward to eating here! I absolutely love their juices and salads!! I used to always order the Greek salad, but they don't offer it anymore :( disappointed about that. But, they do have other yummy options to choose from... Been coming Here for 3 yrs and will continue.

Food was good, we just had the shrimp tempura and quesadilla appetizers, although it was rather overpriced. Along with a mimosa and ice tea, the bill came to $68, including tax and 15% gratuity. 

The servers were very polite, although when we went up to the counter beforehand the hostess was asleep and we stood there awkwardly until she woke up and noticed us. 

However the biggest blow was that we'd only gone for the Egg Benedict that was disingenuously advertised as a brunch menu item available all day. However, the waitress told us it was only a breakfast item that they stop serving around 10. In my opinion, brunch is usually something you expect in the afternoon as well.

So two stars for the food, one star for the politeness of the servers.

Such a delicious turkey avocado sandwich with cranberry+seed bread! Unfortunately the cashier missed half our order and left out our kale salad. He also didn't inform us that there were two options of the kitchen menu and the cold sandwich menu, which differs in one thing: toasted vs untoasted bread. $20 for a toasted sandwich, $13 for untoasted. Bottle of Fiji water is $9, service is inattentive, and getting the food was also very frustrating.
Probably the best chicken salad sandwich I've ever had.  And the Cole slaw was great also.  Definitely recommend
The food was good, the service was good, but it is grossly overpriced. $40 for one order of French toast and one order of eggs and bacon is a bit silly.

We came here as the only late night option that was available in the hotel, and we were very happy. The food was good, and we had wonderful service. Our waiter Steven was very attentive and offered honest suggestions about the menu and drinks.  I had the kale and brown rice salad and added salmon and my boyfriend had the rueben. My drink was peach iced tea with whiskey and it was excellent. 

One note we went into the restaurant and not just the counter.
Nice lunch here.  Soup and salad were good but way overpriced at $19, had a very good sandwich with chicken, bacon, avocado though.
Great decor. Chunky monkey drink was great!  Food was better than average. Service has been below average - poor the last two times we visited.

Never would have thought you could get such amazing customer service at 130am this Resturant has the looks and taste that we all deserve. The food was amazing and beer selection was just what I like the scenery of lovely ladies all around you that are just leaving club Light was a plus but not at good as my food lol Definitely coming back I recommend trying any of there burgers or steak or really anything on the menu. Awesome

We wound up eating here more than we meant to because of its location in Mandalay Bay and because it is open all night long. During our trip we ate here three times, once for breakfast, once for lunch and once at 4am..don't even know what you call that meal-- drunkfest? 

For lunch I had the turkey burger which was about $20. It was nothing special but not terrible either. The cocktails we had at lunch were pretty decent. 

Breakfast we had waffles and eggs... its hard to screw those up. 

At 4am I don't recall exactly what we were eating.. I think it was probably waffles and french fries. The point is, they were open at 4 am and serving the entire menu! We couldn't get room service at the Delano at that time so Citizens saved us. 

In sum, this place isn't fancy or all that great food-wise. It's basically like a diner (just more expensive than your average diner). I wouldn't eat dinner here but for a casual breakfast or lunch its just dandy.

Love this place. The service that Kiana and Daniel provided was excellent. And I am sure that it all comes from great management Joe(manager) was very kind and welcoming. The Mac and Cheese is unbelievably delicious.

Fantastic place to eat. We've been here a few times now and it's always been enjoyable. The atmosphere is casual and comfortable. Food is excellent, especially the brick  chicken and French onion soup. Breakfast is a good bet also with a wide range of offerings. Beer selection is very good as well.

Yes, we went on their opening day but still, 2 hours for a lunch that consisted of a couple of sandwiches and a salad is completely unacceptable.  Since this place was Red, White and Blue like 5 minutes ago, I'm 99% sure they just re-branded the place and didn't replace their entire staff.  Of course, I could be completely wrong about that.  Even so, for a restaurant that was less than half full, they should have it together enough to throw some sandwiches on a plate.

On the bright side, our server was nice and always had our drinks refilled.  The food, once we got it, was decent.  My Greek salad was huge, although, I'm not sure it was Greek so much as an Italian chopped salad like the kind you'd get at your favorite pizza joint.  The salmon that I ordered with it was, despite being heavily over seasoned, cooked very well and pretty good.  The portions are huge but for the $32 I spent on a salad and an iced tea, I still think it's pretty steep, although probably on par with the rest of the hotel outlets.

It does look like they've put some thought and effort into their beverage program, which I appreciate.  I've been dying to try the new Bombay Sapphire East, which they have here and nowhere else that I've seen in the hotel.  They've also come up with a cocktail menu that looks like they've tried to put twists on some of what seem to be Vegas' most popular drinks.  If I hadn't been working, I would have given them a go.

Honestly, I probably won't ever come back for lunch because I will most likely be fired for being gone so long again.  Since I basically live at the Mandalay Bay for work, I'm sure I'll be back at some point.  Hopefully with a lot of time on my hands.
Amazing food the giant meatball was such an awesome app. Great cocktail program. Good vibe.

This was just so so for me.  I would have expected it to be better since the look and feel of it is really nice.  The girl at the counter that helped us seemed to hate her job though.  She wasn't at all polite or interested, as if we were bother her.  

I ordered soup and a sandwich to go.  As soon as I left I realized there wasn't a spoon for the soup in the bag so I went back.  When I asked for a spoon she told me I'd have to wait for her to get more from the box.  She then spent the next 10 minutes messing around with making someone else food.  

In the end the "box" she needed was right next to her.  I waited until my soup was almost cold to get a spoon.  Seriously ?  This was by far the worst experience of my trip.

The food was good

I don't know how I should feel about this place.

Citizens Kitchen & Bar is located in the center of the restaurant row in Mandalay Bay, and as such, it ain't cheap. We had Kale Salad and Chicken Sandwich, while both were pretty good, they charged $5 each for the water bottle. We just asked for water and they charged $10 automatically without asking. It might work for one-off tourists, but I don't think that's a sustainable business practice for locals.

The food quality was not bad, thus three stars.

This place was conveniently located at Mandalay bay . We ordered the Kobe beef fries which were fine, and the grilled Ruben sandwich: wasn't too impressed . Pretty standard . Nothing bad. But I think I expect a little more out food In Las Vegas ....
Great place to come in the 3am hour when you're locked out of your room over a misunderstood comment with your lover while gambling at the local greenways.
Open 24 hours, perfect for late night munchies. I've tried most items on the menu and so far I've been pretty happy with them. Will keep on coming for sure!

Food was alright. I ordered the corned beef skillet and the eggs were great as well as the corned beef hash. My only large complaint for the food was the temperature. The food was under warm and that's concerning only because poached eggs and meat should not be near cool. The service was fine. We had three different people tend to us and that made it confusing for the tip amount. The food was high priced for the portion as well. I usually never finish a meal and today I ate all of my food because there was barely any on my plate. So if you do go here expect to pay more for less. Another person with me ordered the ultimate breakfast and their meal was a large size for a good price. So be mindful for that!

Excellent brunch option in the Mandalay Bay, however, the service is hit or miss.  On one weekend we had fantastic service followed by invisible service the next day.   The food was great on our first visit and the server accommodating to dietary needs and requests making us fall in love with the place.   The second visit, our server was totally slammed and he was very much absent minded, leaving us to wait over 20 minutes for a Mimosa from the clearly empty bar next to us.   He also wasn't really down with the hospitality and wouldn't let my guest order the exact same thing she enjoyed the day before which struck me as a little odd.   Had we not been in a hurry, we would have probably asked to see a Manager but it was so busy we just sucked up and left.   What a difference a day makes......

First time here. As a Vegas local, I usually try to avoid the Strip places, as from what I've seen they're usually overpriced tourist traps. I'm glad to say I was pleasantly surprised by Citizens. I had been considering Citizens as an after-concert choice (Neil Diamond!), since it's open 24 hours. We arrived at Mandalay Bay early and had an hour and a half to kill, so we decided to eat before the show instead.

After checking out the menu board outside and getting on the list, we waited about 3 minutes and we were seated in the outer "patio" area. Our server, Nick, greeted us very shortly thereafter and brought us our drinks, offering to answer any questions we had about the menu sections. I decided against spending $40 on a 14 oz NY sirloin steak and went with the bacon burger (medium done, add cheese, hold the onions) & fries. My wife chose the NY-style pastrami sandwich. Being that it was 5:45 pm, I expected to wait a bit for my order to come out. After 15 minutes or so Nick came back to the table and apologized for the wait, explaining that they were very busy and that he would see to our orders ASAP. I thought that was really cool of him, because I cannot tell how many times I have been sitting in a restaurant, getting aggravated looking at my watch over and over, while the wait staff hangs around chatting or walks by us over and over like we haven't been sitting there sipping our drinks for over a half hour. The food arrived a few minutes later and it was time to dig in.

My burger platter, served on what looked like a cookie sheet, was the perfect size for the $20 price tag: a good-size, nicely stacked burger with tomato and shredded lettuce, cooked and prepared exactly as I had requested and skewered through the top bun with a large pepperoncini that would make Papa John cry, a decently-sized "bucket" of shoestring fries and a half pickle slice. My wife's equally-priced sandwich was huge (the half she couldn't finish wound up in the car in a to-go box before we went to the show), stuffed with perfectly lean pastrami, along with a side bowl of potato salad (or fries or cole slaw) and also sporting that pepperoncini and pickle slice. Both orders were delicious and appropriately priced for the portions we received. When it came time to settle the bill, I jokingly asked if they do employee discounts for fellow MGM employees, to which Nick said he would go check. He returned a couple of minutes later with, to my surprise, a new bill reflecting a 20% discount (which I kicked back to Nick on top of the original tip for his great service) - a definite high-five to Citizens for that!

All in all, I still generally think Strip dining establishments are tourist traps, but I also think they have not yet seen the last of me at Citizens - it seemed to be, at least to me, one of the few exceptions to the rule.

Good food for great prices compared to other restaurants in Mandalay Bay. The staff is so friendly we dined here two nights in a row. I recommend the carrot cake! Ask to be served by Junior or Mandi and theyll take care of you.

Got here at 10:45pm on a Saturday and got seated right away.  I had the fish tacos that are good but better for lunch. My hubby had the French dip that was a real winner. I'm coming back for that next time.

Disappointed with the food and service. Stay away from the patio seating. It has the most uncomfortable chairs. Our server was slow and disinterested in providing us service. We had to ask twice for our coffee to be refilled. The server did attempt to make amends by offering a coffee to go. The corned beef hash was mediocre and overpriced.

This place is amazing located inside of mandalay bay it has the best brunch in vegas on sat and sun, known as the hangover brunch . If u have a late night in vegas and want to get back on track i definitely recommend there hang over brunch

Last night we had dinner and drinks at Citizens for the first time. We have walked by several times and decided to give it a try.  I need to share with you our experience.  Lizzy was soooo friendly and provided excellent customer service!! The food and service was so wonderful we came back tonight.  Thank you Lizzy!  We will be back soon!!!!!

omg lets start off by saying I actually love this place whenever I'm in town I stop by more than once , I must say COURTNEY are waitress  was the worst knowing you deal with a many people everyday all day , you should be having the Best customer service EVER , I just might never come back again

When in town for the usual conventions, I usually stop in for the killer turkey avocado sandwich. I also make it a point to sit at the bar - bartender Raquel is super cool, funny and always makes me feel welcome  - Thank you!

Service was awful, no hostess at the door. We sat ourselves and a rude server told us we needed to be seated, and to wait for this imaginary hostess to appear. We ordered queso, and Kobe fries. Food was over priced, but okay not great.  They didn't ask how anything was! Our server was Robert, I had a beer served in a dirty glass, there was no apology. Then Robert lost our debt card upon trying to pay... We won't be going back. And good luck to anyone who goes there.

I wanted to update my review to A-OK. The reason? The owner reached out to me and invited me back into the restaurant for a different experience, which really says something. I was impressed by this action. Thanks, Jara.  I'm going to say that the menu sounds really good. I'm hoping that the service has changed since my last visit. Best of luck to this restaurant. Keep listening to your customers and I think you will do A-OK.


Review from Feb 2, 2013.

The scene:

Citizens Kitchen & Bar
Hotel: Mandalay Bay
Date: Saturday, February 2, 2013
Time: 12:00 pm
There was a UFC fight the same day. Picture lots of men on steroids with tons of testosterone, pent up rage and Affliction t-shirts.  HA
Food: 1 Turkey Sandwich, 2 Iced Teas and Chicken Soup= $66.00

I was craving some comfort food to help revitalize my energy levels. I had a giant sandwich on my mind, so I walked through the Casino in hopes of eating at the Red, White and Blue Restaurant. I come to find out that my favorite sandwich spot is closed and Citizen's Kitchen & Bar has replaced my go-to sandwich spot. Citizens prides itself on non fancy, REAL comfort food. The vibe is new American mixed with old fashioned comfort.  The environment was great, the service and food..not so much. When we arrived for lunch, there was one other group at the bar. We were told by our server that we were the first lunch customers EVER. 

Since we were the first lunch customers, I didn't come with ridiculously high standards. I was here with the most relaxed group of foodies. I grew up in a restaurant, so I'm always pretty calm and understanding when things go wrong, however there were so many mistakes and unkept promises, I was embarrassed for the restaurant. Charles Barkley showed up 1 hour after us and still got served before us. Haha  It took us 2 hours to get a cup of chicken noodle soup and a hot turkey sandwich. We were told 6 times that our food would be out soon. The hot turkey sandwich with gravy was COLD. One turkey sandwich, one cup of soup and 2 iced teas cost us $66.00, no joke. 

The manager did not listen to us and acted as if we were an inconvenience.  We didn't get a discount, but they offered us free pastries. We  were not interested. We won't be coming back here. 

Tip of the day: You are better off going to Subway or a food court for lunch.  Take your $66.00 to STK, getting a mouthwatering steak + the mac and cheese and enjoy ridiculously superb service.

Build your own omelette ($14). Everything else is an extra .50 or .75 for meats. I will note, they ended up getting the cheeses mixed up when our food was brought out. (Not a big deal, but thought I'd mention it, and they did remove the cheese from our bill.) 

When the food finally did arrive, the omelette from the looks of it - was a little thin. It looked like it was made with egg substitute rather than real eggs. 

Round it off with 2 (maybe) 8oz orange juices and 1 coffee the bill came out to over $40.

Conclusion:
The place is okay, but a little pricey. Dimly lite like the rest of the places we've been to in Vegas so far.

Arrived mid-afternoon and not willing to brave the heat of the Strip quite yet. A lot of the restaurants were closed, so we went with this one being open 24 hours. Pricey, but it's Vegas (thus the 4 stars).  Was pleasantly surprised at how good the food was. Sandwiches & fries done perfectly~ hot, crispy, good flavor. Had the Frisco Melt, a Reuben, Open faced roast beef with mashed potatoes. Gravy on the potatoes was a tad too salty, but the bun was garlicky delish, meats were tender & yummy. Went a couple times during our stay, and probably because of the off-hour it wasn't busy, and service was fine and attentive. Not impressed with the spinach dip & (abundance of) chips. I'd stick to the sandwiches.

Love the location inside the Mandalay Bay. They have inside and outside seating, we chose the outside (still in the hotel) and ordered breakfast. Their food is really tasty and made with quality. Our server was very sweet and I can see why people chose to dine here. Will definitely be coming again the next time
I'm staying at this hotel.

Ate here while staying at TheHotel @ Mandalay Bay.  Our meal was very simple: Cobb salad, patty melt, 2 beers.  The burger was indulgent- it's basically 2 grilled cheese sandwiches (very thin bread) with a burger in the middle.  Came with fries and was pretty good, but nothing special by any means.  Given that it's Vegas, I forgive the $20/entree, but the food was just alright.  Next time I'll make the short walk to the burger bar.
Can't give it a zero damn got seated with 2 other tables full and could not get service after 15 minutes and there were plenty of employees and servers working really wanted to try the food.
Stopped in for a quick dinner before my flight after a long week in Vegas. Glen made the perfect drink and good conversation! Will stop in next time!

Came here a couple days ago for breakfast. We loved the atmosphere. The food was alright but we kind of had higher expectations. We sat at the bar and the bartender wasn't friendly at all. Kinda ruined the experience for me.

Ugh. Absent service and super rude when he did come by. When we finally stopped someone else to ask for more water and our check, our waiter came over with attitude and excuses. As we ignored him and stood to leave he yelled sarcastically at our backs about whatever he had been doing. Food was 24-hour Vegas food. Blah.

Mediocre at best.  The salad was generously sized but boring. My friend had a decent burger with OK fries. Two of us got a $15 glass of wine that was minuscule. They should cut back on the portions of their bland food and pour an average glass of wine.

Staying at the Mandalay Bay for the weekend and have already been here twice! A lot to choose from for breakfast as well as lunch/ dinner. We did not have the chance to dine in but still received great service from the to go side. For breakfast we tried the steak and eggs as well as the creme brûlée French toast. Also tried the green and mean juice- kale, spinach, avocado, banana, and apple. For dinner we tried the bacon burger and cheese quesadilla, both were great! Wouldn't mind eating here again

The hostess is so nice. I love the healthy Ginger snap smoothie drink and I love that I was able to get a fresh ceasar salad quickly to go. Convenient and open 24 hours with great friendly service at the counter.
Overpriced,  mediocre food. Should have walked over to Luxor's 24 hr. cafe instead.

Probably the best value for the price of the places I ate in Las Vegas. Huge portions for comfort food in a clean and friendly atmosphere. I ended up eating here twice. The first time, got the French Onion Soup which literally was in a "cup" the size of my head. Really great flavors and hit the spot for something light, yet filling for lunch. The second time, I had the potato skins. The pico de gallo as a topping choice was great. You are still paying the Vegas premium prices, but not to the extent of other places when it comes to a hearty and filling lunch, particularly when you don't want to go to a food court.

Service was horrible. Plenty if tables open yet they made us wait to sit down. Right side of restaurant is so loud you can't hsve a conversation. Different menus for self service and the sit down restaurant. Very confusing. Michael seemed to be the only person with any sense of customer service. Sandwich didn't live up to its price.

Ordered a breakfast burrito at 3:03am. No one around. $16. Insane already. Waited until 3:25am. Checked in and the manager was rude about the "kitchen being backed up." Asked to cancel the order. As they were refunding the charge at 3:28am, the burrito came out. They asked if I still wanted a refund. I did. No apology. Told kitchen to take burrito back. Insane. Learn customer service.

I was in Las Vegas on the weekend of September 7 and stopped in to this restaurant on a Sunday around 11 AM. The place is pretty big and I went to the bar since I was alone, as a friend I was with could not handle Las Vegas :-)

I was served by the bartender Lizzy. I had just come off a pretty wild night so I was not looking for an all booze drink, but something tasty and classy for breakfast. Lizzie made me a double chocolate espresso martini. She used a rye based vodka which was very good. 

For breakfast food, I ordered off of their Sunday brunch menu and had a French Toast Crème Brulé.it was pretty good tasting and I would recommend it if you are here for a breakfast item.

I had a second drink which is also very good. The bartender was extremely attentive and professional and fun! The atmosphere is also very fun there with seating options in a dining room or the bar. There appears to be a 24 hour café as well located in the restaurant.

I highly recommend the place and do suggest you visit the bar when you are in Las Vegas.

Stay away from this place. I gave it a generous two stars only because the manager offered us a free desert by commenting on the food (which we passed). I thought the place would carry on the same quality as its former self ( RED WHITE & BLUE RESTAURANT). Had the mahi mahi fish tacos from the servers recommendation. I couldn't figure out if I was eating coleslaw or fish tacos. Very runny tacos. Wifey had the quinoa and kale salad. Terribel. The quinoa was not cooked all the way thru. Pricey and lame.

I had lunch here with my husband during a business trip.  I had the best grilled chicken sandwich of my entire life here.  My husband, however, had a spoiled grilled chicken caesar salad, and subsequently spent the next two days in the bathroom between conferences. :( I hate to give a 2 star review, especially when the service was so good, but spoiled food is not okay with me.  If it were not for that, I would revisit.

Just Tore Up Some FISH (Shark) & Chips.. And A French Dip!! This Place Had Great Service.. Thanks Nick!! Very Cool and Made Great Recommendations!  This Spot Has Music, Full Bar & Even A Deli To the Front For To Go Items.. Will Def Come Back!! Great Decor.. Really Cool Laid Back Spot!!

Great. Tried fish tacos, their specialty, and they were awesome. Since I'm new to fish tacos I have no baseline but I do know a new fave. Others in my party ordered anything from fish and chips to quinoa salad. All were equally fantastic.  Service friendly and a nice touch is the manager comes around to ask how everything was.

I would have given this place 3 stars but the service was horrible. Anthony, "our server" took our order than never returned to the table to check in on us or refill our drinks. Food was decent and prices were standard for Vegas.

Conveniently located in Mandalay Bay, always a warm welcome from the staff. Raika was the hostess at the front as I observed the menu from outside, she sold me with a simple welcome and smile. When I'm hungry I don't like the process of going somewhere and sitting down for an hour before I get my food. Citizens is an excellent "fast food" choice with quality food and several healthy options. Open 24 hours have a seat or grab a sandwich to go. Competitive prices and outstanding good an staff. I just may take a ride down there now.

Not sure what all the other hater comments are about but I liked this place so much I went twice during my stay at Mandalay Bay. The first time I was looking for some breakfast food in the hotel to bring back to the wife who was still sleeping in the room. This place was perfect!  They had a great breakfast menu that you can get to-go to include espresso drinks. The wait for the food isn't too bad. The price is reasonable considering you are at a Vegas resort. They have several smoothie options and their sandwiches are stuffed with lots of meat. Check this place out if you are staying at Mandalay Bay and don't feel like going to one of the pricier restaurants.

I had breakfast 2 days in a row here at Citizens during my work trade show at Mandalay Bay. My food was good, and I was able to order a special omelette with spinach. Our waitress was super nice and we even saw her the next day. They also have a nice outdoor dining as well as pastries and coffee to go. 

Until then, be kind to one another and Cheers! ~ :p

Was wandering around Mandalay Bay with friends after a night out clubbing looking for some late night drunchies and we were directed here by the staff.

Despite it being 3am there was a 10-minute wait, which we spent pondering the menu. We ended up choosing the tater tots, penne prosciutto, and kobe chili cheese fries. Maybe it was the alcohol, but we thought everything was delicious and devoured it all. Service was pretty decent too, and the prices were quite reasonable.
Good food, cool place to hang out and chill after losing your ass at the tables.  I would give this place 4 Stars but the service sucks.

Great place to get a good burger. Chicken sandwich or Wings.  The mashed potatoes are great.  I have ate here a few times and have never been disappointed.  Everything that comes out of the kitchen has been delicious!!   Highly recommend it to everyone!!

We stayed at the Mandalay Bay and ate at Citizens twice; one for a rather late dinner on the night of our arrival, and then again for a more reasonably timed dinner.

Yes, the prices are a bit high, but it's Vegas and compared to other places, this really wasn't so bad.  Plus, the portions are large, which always helps with the sticker shock.

In our visits we had the chicken club, turkey burger, tots, onion soup, calamari, and bacon burger.  Everything was good, no complaints.

The onion soup comes in a HUGE mug, so note that it's not really an appetizer type soup.  Thankfully I saw someone eating it otherwise I likely would have ordered way too much food!

The hours were great as it was the only food option that was open when we arrived.
Lovely place..Came here 3 days in a row and never disappointed..Loved the way Glen and Chris served..Amazing food..Good quantity..do recommend

This place is inside Mandalay Bay. Came here for dinner last night with a couple of work colleagues. I was a little unsure when we walked in because I couldn't tell the style of food based on the look, but I was pleasantly surprised. I had a Frisco melt style burger with fries and a cocktail. All tasted very good. The prices are typical of Vegas strip. They had a bakery style establishment next door connected that had pastry, cheesecake, etc which looked good. I would go back!

03/02/18  5pm-ish- We like to try new areas we haven't been to so it was time to check out Mandalay Bay.  Beautiful! (of what we saw) We went from the self-park garage followed the casino signs and ended up in a large beautiful foyer and restaurant row. Started to check out some of the menus that they post outside the restaurants. While we were reading, two young girl hostesses were obviously making fun of people as they people watched from their podium. They spotted me catching them, turned their backs,  then I WAS THEIR VICTIM! Really girls!! Don't be so obvious. Well it should go without saying we didn't end up eating there. (next to KUMI) They must not teach hospitality anymore, you just need to be young and pretty. 
Sad.

Have to say Raquel was awesome, was helpful courtesy and definitely fun to be around. We really appreciate the time and service not to mention the foid was outstanding .Will definitely be coming back!

Las Vegas home of great service, NOT this place was a kick in the teeth for the MGM group, service was terrible server number 1 said we can't sit our selfs and to wait for the hostess (who was not there) then I asked to sit on a certain side and she said NO we are closed that side ( there was 3 family's sat over there eating) then our server shows up instantly hears my accent, thinks we are tourists so thinks I don't know how to tip ( so he didn't give a shit) little did he know we are Las Vegas residents!!! My wife got served a beer is a dirty glass, nothing got recommended, we did not get checked back up on ( servers who can't handle 3 tables need to get out of the game and move states) the food was ok but services from step 1 was the worst ever so would not go back and will be making sure I let every1 know this!!! O and I tried to contact the manger 3 times to give her some feedback  but she hung up my call 3 times and left a VM but nothing, I hope the owner of the company reads this and really thinks about the staff he has working for them!!!

We stopped in here yesterday for a quick smoothie while shopping at LUSH cosmetics. First, it wasn't quick at all ! Second, it was 10 bucks for a tiny cup! That is not OK even if we were in Madalay Bay. Then when my wife had her cup up, I saw a date 4-8 written with a sharpie on the bottom. This smoothie lacked flavor completely and was very chunky. I hope the date on the bottoms doesn't mean it was prepped ahead of time!?!?! 

Needless to say, we ended up throwing the thing away! I literally feel like a threw a ten dollar bill in the trash ! What a waste of time and money !! We will not go back here EVER!

I could see this place being like a regular breakfast place, the food is good, the portions are okay, and the prices are a little high but nothing more than you would expect in a tourist area. Not the greatest breakfast place I've even been to but about 5th or 6th on the list.

How does this place get 3 stars?!  My experience here was quite good. I mean, look at my sandwich!  Others have said that the service here is poor. I admit, it wasn't great...and that's with a near empty restaurant...but it wasn't horrible.  

My only regret is not seeing the free cheesecake that came with my check-in :(

The food is very bland. Very very bland. It's all fresh, but not a whole lot of flavor. I added some salt and thought that is maybe what was missing. Then it was just salty and bland.
Sat at the bar this most recent time. A friend joined me about halfway through. I finished eating and was given my check so I paid it. That must have meant "beat it" because then I was ignored when I asked for a refill on my coffee and a refill on my water. Given the breakfast options that were available, this seemed like a good idea, and it still may be the only decent option.

This could have easily been a 3 Star review if the manager came to apologize. My husbands espresso was literally cold, my daughters pancakes raw, my over medium eggs were sooooo overcooked. They gave us 7.80 off the bill, should have been more. For being in the Mandalay Bay, they should step-up their game. If I ever come here again and the service improves, I'll update my review.

In between several more upscale restaurants lies Citizens, which has a little bit of everything to satisfy the general American palette.

We showed up as they were transitioning from breakfast to lunch, but no worries, they still sat us down and gave us some chips and pico de gallo to munch on while we waited for the kitchen to shift. The pico was basic, but this isn't the type of restaurant to serve something more elaborate. We ate it all up without complaint. 

For lunch, we both ordered a reuben with corned beef and fries.  Service was prompt at this point. Our sandwiches had nicely toasted bread, an inch or so of juicy corned beef, melty cheese, and a nice layer of sauerkraut.  No complaints from other of us.  We both enjoyed our meals and ate up most of the fries.  

My only complaint on this otherwise standard satisfactory establishment is that it is a bit pricy. It's Vegas though, so expect to pay a bit more for everything.

First off, the hostesses offer you the option of sitting down to eat or getting the same food at the counter. They don't tell you that the people working the counter have no idea what is going on and you could probably finish two meals sitting while you wait in that ridiculous line. We opted for the line though b/c we didn't know. There were like 10 employees working behind this counter and they could barely pour a cup of coffee. Three of them were working on one person's order b/c she must have had a comp meal or something but really there were at least 20 people in line while we listened to this. Once we made it to order, I just got the yogurt b/c I knew the wait for eggs might take until lunch. My friends got the banana pancakes and eggs benedict. The pancakes were huge, doughy and honestly just gross. There was nothing redeeming about them. The eggs benedict was okay but nothing too great. I highly recommend the breakfast at Raffles as a good alternative in Mandalay Bay. The outside of Citizens looks great but it's really not work the $15 yogurt and coffee breakfast.

I've never been here before and it's not clear that there is a walk up (take out) and dine in(sit down). 
I walked up and asked for a sandwich. My daughter and I sat down to eat and when my sandwich was ready they asked me to leave because I didn't get seated by a hostess?? There were literally only 2 tables being used and they asked me to leave? Why? 
Also- the gal at the register doesn't make it clear that everything is a la cart. So if you order a sandwich please don't expect to get chips or even a pickle with it. LOL.
Ordered the prime rib special with the "mule with wings".. great food and great service!!! Tony wowed us with his amazing knowledge of the menu and service.

Loved the Mac and cheese w/ham hocks. Wife had Chicken Noodles which had more chicken than Noodles but still good. This place is better than average for 24 hour service. It was a little pricey, even for Vegas fare. However, the service was decent and it was a good spot to eat and watch a band play in the casino.

This place is amazing! Much better than in room dining- just thinking about it makes me wanna  the food was seasoned to perfection.. and down from the customer service to the presentation it was awesome.. next time I'll go there instead!

This restaurant is so Vegas. What do I mean by that? I mean this place embodies the whole high/low theme that is Vegas. This place is set up like a diner but the menu items have high-end prices. Any entrée cost anywhere from between $40-$60. It's located conveniently next to the club Light so you go at 4AM you will see a lot of drunk, post-clubbers (like me). 

I ordered a filet mignon and fries which was around $58 (another high/low thing). The steak fries were delicious! Nothing better than some comfort food after drinking! The filet mignon was very tender and juicy too, but for some reason I filled up on the fries. I found it a bit hilarious that the filet mignon came with fries instead of mashed potatoes or creamed corn like traditional steakhouses, but, hey, that's Vegas for ya. 

Overall the environment of the restaurant was not that memorable, but the food was pretty decent. I did find it rather funny that this place looked so casual but the menu items would be something that an upscale (okay, at least business casual) restaurant would serve. I would probably end up here again if I went to Light, but not something I would go out of my way for. Plus, it's also rather pricey considering what you get, but that's Vegas *shrugs*.

The service was pretty good too. I don't have any memorable stories, but my other friends actually came here as well and saw me eating with someone and told the waitress that they were going to leave because they saw someone they knew. The waitress replied, "Don't worry, I'll hide you."  That's top notch service right there!

Yelp should really do half stars. I would give this place 3.5 stars but I rounded down to 3 because I was less than impressed with the decor.

Have eaten here two nights in a row for dinner and two of the best meals I've had in Vegas.  Impeccable service.  Apaca and Joe were our servers for our dinners and Robert served us breakfast.  All three servers recommended excellent dinners and Joe recommended a great breakfast choice.  It's a hidden gem in Vegas. Staff is friendly, restaurant was very clean.  I recommend the Reuben, Meatloaf, Gumbo and for breakfast sandwich or Eggs Benedict.  

I have traveled to Vegas 5 times in the last 90 days and stayed at high end to average resorts and this is my new favorite restaurant.

What can be said about Digiorno Pizza that hasn't already been said? Maybe that I've never paid $16 for it, in the past. I wonder if this place has worked out a bulk deal with a distributor to save them even more money. Vegas is an expensive place. I guess I would probably serve overpriced garbage too if I had to run a business in this hell hole.

Ordered the muffalata, bread was hard as a rock, had no flavor, which is amazing for something literally covered in marinated,chopped up olives. Boyfriend ordered the burger, it was burnt on one side. He ordered it medium rare....This place has got to go. Based on the other reviews, I think it should close down and be replaced.

Ate at this place a couple of times during our stay in Vegas.  Food at the sit down restaurant was good but it took forever to come out.  The Bar was ok.  The bakery items did not taste too fresh.  The good thing about the Bar is it is open 24 hours so it is nice to be able to eat at any time.

Excellent food, great atmosphere. Emily the hostess was very sweet - not stuffy.  She was accommodating to me with my electric wheelchair and made sure i felt comfortable - Which is a big deal to hubby and I. Waiter Chris H. was outstanding - very attentive & made us feel like we were his only customers - my drink never ran low and he told us what to expect with our choices. Think french brasserie. No idea why this place is rated 3. Hubby and I enjoyed our food. I had a huge plate of fish and chips (best I've had) white fish was not fishy and breading was super light, flaky and out of this world. Hubby had prime rib special. Very large piece of meat and was tender - delicious. We will be back for sure. Pleasantly surprised. Eat here!

My party and I are currently staying at the Mandalay Bay and we were pleasantly surprised to find a deli-style restaurant on premises, that is reasonably priced and open 24 hours. The food is excellent, we have eaten at least one meal a day at Citizens for the last week and plan on continuing the streak until we leave next week. The staff is incredibly helpful, personable and professional. In particular, we've had exemplary service from Cory, Cady, Justin and especially Brianda, they have all gone above and beyond in being helpful and attentive. (I know I've forgotten some names that also deserve a mention.... sorry).
Favorites: Corned beef reuben, French onion soup, open-face Prime Rib sandwich, Carrot cake
So-so: Pastrami sandwich - too crisp for my taste (management promptly took it off our bill and offered a replacement free of charge.)
Outside patio is loud at night with a music venue nearby but hey, you're in Vegas not a library!

The only thing I would recommend from here is the Cafe Au Lait. That and the service is the only reason I am giving this place two stars. I ordered from the take out area and got the Turkey Avocado sandwich, but had them hold on the avocado spread because of an allergy. They honored my request without a problem, and the sandwich had a good amount of meat, however the bread was stale as all hell. The edges were hard and dry almost an inch in. I also ordered a chocolate chip cookie which was also stale. I can't speak for the sit down restaurant area and that food, but I would stay away from the to-go counter unless you're getting a cafe au lait, that was good and made fresh to order. I was not a late night order either, I place my order just before 7pm.

Well.. Vegas came n went.  No response from this management group who "reached out" but didn't follow through.

this management group is horrible and the service reflects poor management.  Lip service is all you really get.

I will NEVER eat at this place again.

Do not make the mistake I did by giving this place a chance.

Stopped by at 7:38am asking for a travel for three at a restaurant that seats about 250. There are 37 total people here and the won't seat me even through my colleagues will arrive at 8:00. After reasonable requests to two indifferent hostesses, Shawn the manager was asked to stop by. After explaining a late arrival and the desire to start on a report, and asking Shawn to use his discretion and he was really offended when I asked him to use his judgement. No idea about the food, but considering the initial impression if service I'll make sure I repeat this interaction at least 10 times today.
Great breakfast!  The banana pancakes were delicious and the coffee cups are cappuchino sized.  I would definitely return.

Stopped in to grab breakfast in this place since it was in the Mandalay where we were staying and it was pretty good. It sits in the back of the casino and it has a ful menu including take out sandwiches which looked delicious and breakfast items. 

We ate some eggs and toast etc, but the best was the crumbled tater tots mixed with red peppers, best I have tasted. It gets pretty crowded and you may end up waiting but it was worth it. Prices were right and service was fast and friendly! Place is decorated like a kitchen and it was pretty cool inside. Not sure what the dinner menu looks like but it might be good!
Don't order any steaks but the breakfast food and ultimate Bloody Mary was awesome. I would recommend just visiting the bar and doing appetizers. Entrees weren't much to speak of.

Really pricey for the quality. However, it is a go-to for a quick bite for breakfast. The warm sandwiches may be a little too greasy for the health conscious. They also have Krispie Kreme donuts for a ridic price. Freshly made juices may be your best deal.

My wife and I stopped in here after a night of fun, and arrived with a slight hangover...

At the suggestion of our waitress - I ordered their meatball sub. The meatballs were pretty flavorful and had a nice consistency. They proclaim on the menu that their sauce is a "12 hour" sauce, but I couldn't really tell because there wasn't enough of it on the sub... The best part though was definitely the sub bun, which was slightly toasted and had the perfect balance of crispy on the outside and soft on inside. My wife order the BBQ pork sandwich, which she enjoyed. Her only knock on it was that it was supposed to have jalapeño's incorporated into the BBQ pork, but she did not seem to taste them in her sandwich. Aside from that, the pork was good. Once again - the shining star of the sandwich was the bread. For our side, we both ordered the seasoned waffle fries, and they were excellent.

I stopped in Sunday morning before leaving Mandalay Bay. The food was good- I decided on the crème brûlée French toast ($16), and a classic mimosa($13)... however, the staff wasn't very friendly/attentive. I think the waitress spoke to me once the hour I was there- and that was to take my initial order. I would definitely try it again, but I think the next time- I would opt for the to-go service.

Why can't I just give zero stars? The guy with glasses and earrings that takes the Togo orders was unbelievable.This happened on Sunday at 2:00am 4/29. There was a fridge that displayed sandwiches and other variety of treats. When we tried to order the food, the guy told us they don't have sandwiches and that we needed to order from the menu. We apologized and said we didn't see a sign so we weren't aware. He snapped at us and said "I AM YOUR SIGN." That's cute, haven't heard that one before. Is this the kind of customer service a restaurant at the Mandalay Bay should have? Sucks that I'm staying at the hotel and had to be treated like this. Maybe he didn't want to be there or he was having a bad day, doesn't matter though... you can't let that show when you're working. It's just not professional.
The eggs Benedict are very good.  Neat atmosphere sitting on the "patio" inside the hotel/casino.  Service is good and staff is polite.  Great breakfast joint to get you going in the morning.

Located in the Madalay Bay which was perfect after partying.  I had the Chicken Quesadilla which was really good.  My friend had the Turkey Burger which she loved and other friend had Potatoe Skins.  We all liked what we ordered.  Great spot to go to after hanging out in Madalay.
Just tried to get coffee and desserts and they wouldn't let us sit in the dining room. I found them very rude and unaccommodating. Not impressed.

7/9: Located inside of Mandalay Bay casino. I'd rate the food a 3; good, but a bit pricey if paying without comps. The awesome service made up for it! 

I had the Baconator Beef Burger and some of the Turkey Burger. 

My beautiful waitress Miranda was top notch, even though the place was a bit busy for a Tuesday evening. Refills kept coming. Management had an issue with my poker room comp (I guess because Citizens is a new addition to the places that allow usage of comps). She kept checking up on the issue. While they couldn't really get it resolved, she kindly offered to take a discount off for the time being, and said that they would entirely fix the issue before closing time. A class act. THIS is customer service at its finest. Thank you Miranda! Just for the amazing service, I would definitely come back!

Got a snack to go here. The smoothie was just ok and WAY overpriced, even for Vegas. They forgot my pretzel and banana, I didn't get them until I asked 15 minutes later. Barely got an apology. Not a big fan.

I don't know about others, but my meal was awesome. Killer Reuben. Dad had a fab turkey burger. Great coffee and the server Robert was very attentive. We were here for lunch on a Monday so it wasn't too busy. Highly recommended!

This place is perfect for a nice meal, without having to get dressed up or pay high prices.  I had the mahi mahi tacos. And the rest of my party all ordered the patty melt and fries. Everything was delicious. They had an issue with their soda machine so we all had water and the water wasn't too delicious. But the food was perfect.  
I recommend this place for a meal, snack, or both!

We went there for breakfast when we were at the Mandalay Bay on March 1st.  Tim was our waiter.  We were seated fairly quickly by a nice hostess.  The waiter was not the most friendly person, but was polite.  We placed our order, pancakes and eggs for my hubby and I got a Denver Omlette both with hash-browns and we split a side of bacon.  Tim comes by twice in the next 30 minutes to apologize for the order taking so long.  When it finally comes out, everything is cold. I'm diabetic and my blood sugar is so low that I HAVE to eat.  So, we ate it.  I don't mean it wasn't hot.  I mean the little balls of butter wouldn't melt on anything.  Not my hubby's pancakes, not my toast, not the hash-browns!  Also, know how I am when I was hungry so I didn't say anything, not that I was even asked how things were. Tim ignored us until he brought the check.  So, I waited two weeks to post this, cuz when I think about it I'm still mad.  Go ANYWHERE else!!

Good, large portions of food. Ate here twice, since it's the only 24 hour restaurant open in the Mandalay. Service is a bit slow, not enough servers both times we ate here, and had to send back our food twice. Hamburgers were extremely undercooked, RAW, not medium well, and fries were just overly salted. My turkey Reuben and slaw were pretty good, as were the Mahi Mahi fish tacos.

This is my go-to breakfast place when I'm at the Mandalay Bay each year for a conference that my company exhibits at. I like Citizen's because it's quick and casual, and the food is good. 

I had a great waiter this past week. He was attentive, cheerful, and remembered me after the first day. 

Mostly I grab breakfasts here, but they have some great sandwiches that you can have made up and take to the room. I am pretty sure that ordering a half-sandwich is an option. And the salted caramel pudding cup is a favorite indulgence of mine after a long day in the exhibit hall.
The Ruben was to die for. The ultimate Bloody Mary was decadent and came with a crab leg!

Glad this place is 24/7... Came here straight from Light Nightclub ;p in dire need of something to eat. I got the turkey avocado. Such a good choice! It was soooo good! The sandwich consists of: turkey & avocado (duh! Lol), muenster cheese, sprouts, lemon aioli, and cranberry walnut bread. Everything went so well together... One of the best sandwiches I've ever tasted! And I really don't think it was because I was a bit tipsy lol. I also got the chunky monkey smoothie. Forgot what's it in... Chocolate, banana, and other stuff I think. But it's worth trying!!

I was attracted by the idea of comfort food in a casino 24 hrs a day. The staff were very friendly and greeted me upon walking in. The atmosphere was nice and the decor was just right. Portion size was large enough to eat family style following the spinach artichoke app which was very good. The Mac and cheese was solid and the skinny fries had great flavor. I also added a grilled cheese just to try it which was solid. I didn't try the pastries but they looked very tasty. The hangover brunch with bottomless mimosas for $25 was a nice touch. Def check it out if you're in Mandalay Bay.

If you're looking for juicing alternatives and something close, fast, healthy & convenient to the hotel convention, try the Green & Mean juice here. Juices seem to have a lil pulp included and are prepared like a light smoothie, but more juice. Includes Kale, Spinach, Green Apples and Banana just to name a few. Super delish! There are a few other juices to choose from, but this is the best among them. For to-go orders, they recommend placing your order at the deli area vs from the bar. Workers seem to be friendly & accommodating, yet understaffed. So, bring your patience then enjoy your juice. ;D
Happy to visit Raquel at Citizens again. Thanks for being the little ray of sunshine on my Vegas trips Raquelita. And your Bloody Mary's are the best!  A great place for breakfast.

Went to Citizens for breakfast and had a wonderful waiter at the bar named Steven! He was awesome great customer service and conversation.  Made me the most fabulous Mimosa! Thanks Steven you were awesome!

The chicken club sandwich was really good but I think it was missing some avocado. It has chicken breast, bacon, lettuce, and tomato on sourdough bread. The turkey avocado on a cranberry bread was really good but it was missing some bacon flavor. I would give this place a 5 but it was missing just a little twist in both sandwiches. Besides that, everything was really good. The fries were all crunchy just the way I like it. For two sandwiches and a drink, I don't think the price was worth it. It was definitely overpriced. I spent about $45....but I guess that's what you get for visiting Vegas, spend big or go home.
Love Citizens. It's a reasonably priced place to eat at Mandalay Bay if you just want food and aren't looking for a particular vibe. Good food and decent service. Worth checking out.

Visited both in the evening and in the morning. I love that they make fresh juices here. Well that is where the love ends. Slower than molasses running up hill and would it kill the staff to smile? I did not see one person working there who appeared to be happy they where employed. Such a promising place but dreadful.

Two breakfasts, two utter disappointments. Breakfast burrito was basically potatoes in a tortilla. A smattering of eggs and sausage, but mostly just potatoes. Fool that I am, I went back out of convenience and had the single worst "basic, 2-egg breakfast" I've ever had. The potatoes, eggs and toast were colder than room temperature. (I'm not sure how that was accomplished without a refrigerator.) Given the expense of a Vegas restaurant, one would expect--well, hope for--something better. On the outside, Citizens has the look of a Vegas take on a classic brasserie. On the inside, it's not even a greasy-spoon.

Like much in Vegas, pretty on the outside, but no substance.

Ate here twice on a recent business trip. The space, redecorated from its previous goofy pseudo-diner style, is quite nice, masculine and casual yet well-appointed, with a classy bar and the now-ubiquitious but still pretty old style light bulbs. Sat at the bar and had friendly and attentive service. 

The breakfast was standard - eggs/toast/sausage/potatoes were like "diner plus" with a flavorful pepper mixed in with the potatoes and thick texas style toast. Fine. The major disappointment was dinner. I went in craving something just barely healthy (after a few days in Vegas I was desperate for a vegetable) and the main recommended entree at Citizens is a chicken/brocolli/potato plate that looked great. Unfortunately the execution was inexcusably poor, especially for a "signature" dish. The chicken was flavorless and dry, even with the skin left on. Broccoli rabe was undercooked and also flavorless, and the potato quarters were the least cooked of all, with a full half of them too hard to even cut with a fork, and inedible. Everything sat in a plate full of broth, perhaps that's in an attempt to disguize the dryness and blandless of the food, but even the broth doesn't help. Chow in San Francisco does this chicken/brussel sprouts/mashed potato dish that's just bursting with flavor and juiciness, and it's like 12 bucks. This $25 plate was just sad and pointless. Again, like so much in Vegas in general, it's an opportunity to spend twice as much on something half as good.

Good, bad or otherwise this place has northern comfort food. Pastrami and beef short ribs amongst other things.  (I don't know how good) For us southerners.. They don't change out their old grease often enough.  The fried food we had was greasy and not good quality. I could barely eat half of my shrimp tempura. Wife had chicken tenders (better at kfc) we split order of fries. Service was rushed and not good at all.  I'm from Houston and go out to eat all the time.
RECOMMEND toffee crunch blondie and mocha latte to go!  Sit at Kumi in the morning before it's open in their great lounge area and enjoy!

Went to Citizens in July. Juice bar has good flavors, chunky monkey in particular! We started w/ calamari (yum) and buffalo wings (way to spicy for my taste) I ordered the steak quesadillas for my main entree and lets just say I wouldn't order them again. 

Service is great though
AMAZING food! Very fast too. Marlise was our waitress and she was so sweet and on top of everything. Would definitely recommend!
This was the worst customer service I had in my life.  I don't know if it as racist but they refused to seat met girlfriend and I.   And they were freely sitting other Caucasian people.

A quick, friendly, breakfast at the bar before our conference was almost everything I expected. My breakfast potatoes and English muffin under my eggs Benedict were both extremely dry, but the flavor was good. 

Bartender was excellent and the service was relatively fast for the area and time. I'd recommend it!

Meh. Food was okay and this is a convenient location for being near the Mandalay Bay convention center; but, the eggs Benedict was severely lacking hollandaise sauce and the egg was over cooked. Hot cocoa not hot. Wouldn't mind so much if it hadn't been as pricey as it was for what I got.

We stayed in the Mandalay Bay and ate breakfast here every morning.  The food is reasonably priced for Vegas and they offer a large variety of choices.

The servers can sometimes be a little slow to get to your table (happened two out of the three times we ate there) but they are all friendly.  I did like the atmosphere, it was simplistic upper-scale decor.  

We didn't eat breakfast here but it looked like they had a lot of tasty sandwiches.  If you do not feel like sitting there and eating they do have a display case with pre-made food.

Just a tip if you are doing Paleo or low carb they do offer a protein box!

The food here is awesome!!!! We got the meatball app, the mahi mahi tacos, and the balboa steak sandwich. They were all amazing! I can't rave enough about the fish tacos!!! They were on point! Our waiter, Robert, was very kind and very helpful! He gave us a ton of suggestions, all of which were great! We will go back for sure!

We come from Philadelphia for Thanksgiving every year.  We always make a stop at this restaurant for some healthy and delicious food!  It is a little pricey but worth the price for the delicious breakfast!

This is one of the more affordable places to eat at in Mandalay Bay.  I think the food here is really better than 3, more 3.5, but I rounded down because while our server was friendly and French (which for some reason always makes it feel more special), we had to flag him down a few times to get something and even to get our check.  
We went in during an odd time and ordered calamari, wings, and meatball appetizers.  The first two was good, but not very memorable except for how big the servings were.  The meatball however, was gigantic and quite tasty!  I wanted to just have that the entire time I was in Vegas.
Sandwiches are gross, it's expensive, and was a really long wait. It sucks it was the only place open late in MB. It sucked.

Being an M Life member, I was looking for a place that I could get a quick snack that would also help me keep my status. I ended up here and to my surprise, I have no regrets. The husband and I ordered a Chunky monkey drink and carrot cake. The carrot cake portion was HUGE!! That was way more than I was expecting to get but for the cost of $9, it def was a humongous heavy piece of late night cake. Was it worth $9 bucks?? Most likely not. It was moist and it was delicious but for a slice of cake, it was a little dent in my pocket for it. That cake served me as a snack and a part of my breakfast in the morning of the next day. As for the drink, it was good but also $9! The serving size for that was actually small, not worth the $9 even though the flavors were great. Peanut butter and dark chocolate flavors blended with bananas, soy and flax seeds. Tasty food but way too over priced. I get that we are in Vegas but for that price and the longggg wait for just my two items,  I am sure I can still find something  with more bang for my buck.

It's a good place to go for quick food early morning and late night for sure. 

But I have to say the best part was meeting Chris Stanton.

He is a phenomenal server that our server from last night to shame. Mind you last night we went to Prime Steak house and had almost a thousand dollar bill.

Chris is the man.
The fish and chips is some of the best I've ever had. The French dip was also super delicious. Our waiter was great!

Saw a long line at this place and assumed that it would be good. However, we were tricked since those people in line are business people here for conference and they were just grabbing quick lunch.

It's Vegas price, not Vegas quality. I got Chicken Cesar salad, the meat was very plain, and they forgot to give me dressing.

There is a Starbucks next to the corner - even Starbucks would have been a much better choice.

Pros: Citizen's is open 24/7 so it was really convenient when we arrived to Vegas at 5 am when most places are closed. We've dined in before and have ordered take out multiple as well.. both of which was a decent experience. The staff is friendly and helpful. 

Con: They did not provide Au Jus or Horseradish for our prime rib order so it wasn't really enjoyable plain. 

What we've ordered here: 

Appetizers:
*Shrimp Tempura $20 (approx 7 pcs) 
*Potato Skins $16 
*Buffalo Wings $18 (12 pc) 
*Chicken Tenders $16 (4 pc) 
*Disco Fries $16 "Waffle Fries, cheddar, mozzarella, bacon, gravy" 

Signature Entrées: 
*Citizens Prime Rib Dinner $39 "Slow Roasted, Loaded Baked Potato, Steamed Broccoli" 
*Steak Frites $36 "14 oz NY Strip, Crispy Steak Fries"
*Lasagna $29 "Short Rib Bolognese, Three Cheese Blend, Tomato Gravy, Garlic Bread"
*BBQ Ribs $26 "Full Rack, Slaw, Onion Rings" 

Sides: 
*Mac & Cheese $8 "Bacon, white cheddar, & scallion"

Soup: 
*Chili $16 "Kobe Sirloin, Kidney Beans, Cheddar, Sour Cream, Cornbread Muffin" 

Salad: 
*Caesar Salad $16 

Dessert: 
*Cheesecake- I do not recall the price per slice. 
*Carrot Cake $9/ slice 

Late Night Menu: 
*Classic Hamburger with Lettuce, Tomato, Onion, Cheese $20 ($18 + $2 to add a slice of cheese)

The decor and signage is quite inviting.  I was about exhausted when we stumbled in around 11p and didn't really care where we ate, I had a $40 per diem to use and hadn't eaten since lunch.  The menu looked good enough, there was immediate seating and it was easy access to the elevators....Sold!

I ordered the Lobster roll with potato salad and if I could go back in time I might choose differently.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't what I expected either.  The roll is more like a piece of bread with a slit in the middle to stuff the lobster mix into.  Good flavor on the bread and plenty of lobster but that is no roll.  Now the potato salad must not be their claim to fame, it was boring and limited in quantity.  I mean, I get it, it's potato salad but come on let's make it taste good.  This was chunks of potato with mayo, and if it wasn't that is what it tasted like.  Good thing is there is a ton of stuff on the menu, they are open 24 hours, (I think) and it's super convenient if you're staying at the bay.

Two regrettable experiences at this restaurant earns them one star in my book. The food was average and the service was spectacularly surly, and sour. The staff acted like they were doing us a favor by even addressing us. With all of the fine dining options and high caliber service in Vegas, this seems to me like a very poor choice. New management, please!

It's 2 am after standing around in the club for hours you're telling me I have to wait 15 mins to be seated for a restaurant that is empty ??? Someone please explain to me why. Food took forever. The waiter spilled water on me and didn't even know it. Was he high or something cause he was messing up all night from spilling beers and I overheard him apologizing to another table. Luckily the chicken club was good or maybe I was just hungry.

Since we were in Vegas again and had the opportunity we made sure to eat here again. This trip the Wife and I shared the Nachos, then split the Ruben with the cole slaw on the side. Again I am not sure why all the low stars for this place. Our waiter was awesome, Greg, there when we needed him and let us chill when we needed to. We had a great dinner with great service. If that is what you are looking for then give this place a chance. And about the prices, your in Vegas, in a casino, you are not going to get prices like your eating at Denny's. Note: most meals are large enough to be shared. That can help you save some money.

A last night minute resort after Kevin Hart show. 
A couple of friends and myself forced ourselves to get over the fact chicken wings were priced at $18 and a small cup of soup $10 the food was horrible. The wings had some sort of sauce sloped over it and the soup was blah! The pastrami sandwich was dry and the bread stale. Eat at your own risk LV.,,

Roast beef sandwich to go was just what I was looking for after walking all morning and heading back to the room. The sandwich had just the right amount of Horshradish on it and the roast beef was sliced thin and piled up.
Just a meh.  chicken avocado BLT who is you're so so late night snack you'll be okay nothing spectacular just made me a chocolate milk which is badly needed

Went with a group here for lunch and it was DELISH. Majority of us got the club. I'd highly recommend that Service wasn't the quickest but we weren't in a hurry so it wasn't really an issue for us. Definitely wanting to check out there breakfast. Will be going again for sure

Zero stars if possible. Staff was rude - refused to seat us with a drink - while she's carrying a cup of coffee the whole time. 

Served 20year olds alcohol. Not a place to spend your money. Try any of the other 30 restaurants in the building. 

Management should be fired for lack of awareness.

Food was good and the service was even better on the night shift with Steven.  He makes the experience  worth the visit and the blonde handlebar mustache is a must see.   He is amazing, accommodating, personable, and charismatic.  Truly a pleasure spending your evening dining with Steven.

Nichelle and Monica, New Jersey and Maryland

Stopped by the cafe part of Citizens to get sandwiches for lunch after DAYLIGHT and could not have been more grateful! The sandwiches were absolutely delicious and pretty inexpensive for how large they are! Definitely a clutch spot to hit after the pool or for a quick lunch!

We were the very first customers.  We're willing to cut them some slack because of that but everything was excellent.  We had blueberry waffles, crispy bacon, Denver omelette & tater tots.  The tots were Incredible and the food & service was top notch.  Will definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas.

Citizens Kitchen & Bar has been probably one of the WORST Vegas dine-in experiences that I have ever had off the strip. Not only was the food sub par, but the service was god awful atrocious. It took me 20 minutes to get a refill of water, and 30 minutes to put in a drink order. To make matters even worse, my credit card was charged 4 times the value of the food, and wasn't even voided. When I've tried to get a call back from the staff to rectify the situation, they just tell me they'd call me back but never do. Horrible restaurant, horrible service, horrible rating. HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT from the Light Group.

Kevin, our server was very helpful, friendly and attentive.  Emily, and Jessica both were very accommodating and sat us on the outer section where we could watch passers by.  The appetizer was very good and filling.  The entree of the fish and chips were bountiful and delicious, and teriyaki rice bowl with chicken was very, very good.

I just ate here with a friend and our server, Erick, was phenomenal! Best customer service and very attentive! Erick is the perfect example of Vegas hospitality. I'll definitely be returning to sit in his section. Thanks again for a wonderful meal, Erick!

BRUNCH TIME! Love the French Toast and Turkey Club! So chill, music playing, love the rustic old school style and service!

Thanks Tony!
average at best. breakfast was bland. service a bit sloppy.not a good breakfast place.

Not sure about the bad reviews but we really enjoyed the place. Open 24 hours and serving comfort foods. We had the Mahi fish tacos which was very nice portion of 3 tacos. The veg had a nice Kale salad with goat cheese and a wonderful dressing. The food at the Mandalay bay was outstanding overall and made staying there a real plus. They also have a nice grab and go area in the lobby of the restaurant that had a nice selection.

We spent New Years Eve/20th anniversary at Mandalay this year. We ate 4 out of 6 meals here!! Wonderful food and service, whether it was 10:00 am or 3:00 am we totally enjoyed every bite!

We are both dying for the Crab Benedict and BEST prime rib in Vegas! Hats off to the whole team!

I was staying at the Mandalay Bay for a conference so I came here quite a few times during the week. It was one of the closest food spots next to the conference rooms. It also was one of the few full menu places in Mandalay that stayed open late. Surprisingly most of the food spots shut down at around midnight. 

Citizens was a bit of a hit and miss. Two of the four times I came it was great. The other two were just ok. I liked that they had 3 sections (bar, restaurant and counter). The counter was a quick line that basically had sandwich, salad, coffee and other quick items available for immediate purchase. This was convenient for conference breaks as I was able to just run over, grab some pre-made foods and coffee before heading back. The restaurant and bar were nice for late night dinners. We came here twice to eat at the restaurant portion. The food was ok. The only thing I ordered here that I hated was the mixed green salad. The leaves were very bitter and the dressing was sub-par. Most of the other dishes we ordered were good, but nothing stood out as extraordinary. 

Everything here was overpriced. As I mentioned it's a convenient spot and it's open late so they're able to get away with the prices... But don't expect the quality to match the price.

The service was on and off. We had one server who was great. The barista and employees behind the counter were also good. But we also had a server who was terrible. But overall it had decent service.  

The number one thing this place has going for them is the convenience of location and hours.

Vegas Strip..... The streets where tourists wander and pay for overpriced EVERYTHING!

At Citizens Kitchen and Bar, you can either order and pick up at the cashier OR sit at a table and get waited on by a server. If you want to order yourself, you can only sit outside at one of the two patio areas (~7-8 small tables / 6-10% of the restaurant). 

I got a tuna melt.... cheese was solid................ BLAH! Saddest looking tuna melt I've ever seen.

Host wasn't friendly either. Oh, and there was only one table getting waited on inside and the other patio for patrons who want servers was empty..... 

#notenoughtables #wedontwantyourservers #saddesttunameltever

We stopped in for snacks at this casual Mandalay Bay restaurant since we weren't in the mood for another casino buffet just yet, and the wait time for a table here was zero. 

The "Ultimate Sliders Challenge" (24 Sliders in 24 Minutes) looked interesting. Seems like a whole lotta mini-burgers to choke down in not a lotta time. Impossible for many and conquered by few. $40 Challenge declined.

Hearty plates. We tried a couple dishes which were decent to share or sample. Rather pricey, though, for mostly standard fare IMO. Relatively spendy menu prices aren't exactly budget friendly because Vegas, but the food should fill nicely whether before or after your bender. There are bargains to be found if you're motivated to pinch pennies elsewhere.

-$21 Fish tacos. Nicely battered fish and not oily/greasy. Fresh veggie mix and soft tortillas. Good, but not so much 21 dollars great. Southern California is still tops for best fish tacos and value priced to match.
-$18 Corned beef pastrami sandwich. A nice stack of toasty, melty, meaty, deli goodness that even a New Yorker might appreciate. The consensus winner from our table. The cole slaw side was ok, but probably should've gone with the fries.
-$18 Bacon cheeseburger. Three slices of fine bacon makes for a tasty cheeseburger and the fries were served hot and crispy. Now we need some luck at the tables to recoup the steeply marked up lunch tab.

Service was friendly and efficient. Drinks were refilled regularly. All good there.

There are several restaurant options conveniently located within the Mandalay labyrinth to keep you intrigued, and Citizens Kitchen & Bar is a 24hr accessible spot with familiar fare to satisfy.

Stopped by citizens for a quick lunch. My waiters name was Kevin and he was fantastic. He recommended the French dip, promising I wouldn't be disappointed! Kevin was right! Food was great, service was even better! Thanks Kevin!
Dakota is AMAZING!  Highly recommended! He did such a great job on recommending drinks and food. He also told us tips and fun things to do next. Super personable.

We tried the pre-show special for $29.  It came with either salad or onion soup,  prime rib,  and chocolate cake.   Salad was pretty decent but the prime rib tasted very dry.  Definitely not worth $29.  :(

I dined here three times during my recent stay at Mandalay Bay, twice for breakfast and once for dinner. Breakfast is good, not great. Dinner is much better. Service is okay. Overall a three star experience. Highlights... Breakfast service is very quick and there's a good variety on the menu. The omelette I had was very good. The breakfast potatoes were very bland. The dinner menu accommodates almost anyone - vegetarians, pescetarians, and carnivores alike. I had a fabulous shrimp and pasta dinner while my friend had the prime rib. The portions here are huge and you get a good value for your dollar.

The important thing is they have breakfast food 24/7. It's an alternative to riding to Denny's 20 miles away. The other alternative to this place within a similar distance is Raffles... With a crazy hangover, though, guess where we didn't end up. Solid breakfast food and fast service is the solution to any Vegas ailment except maybe losing your dignity to a stripper. Also, coffee. Lots of coffee is the answer. The question? I forgot.

What do you do when you're jet-lagged to within an inch of your life and know that if you don't eat soon you're going to Hulk out and make the news?

The Hublet and I checked into Mandalay Bay for the 2013 IT Expo, threw our suitcases on the bed and dragged ourselves downstairs to try to bolt down some food before falling into an exhaustion coma.

We chose Citizens as it was the first non-formal place to eat that our tired feet brought us to.

The staff are polite and efficient, but the restaurant has a quick turnover feel to it and you do feel a scoosh rushed, however looking at the sea of people passing by you understand their desire to capitalize on the moneymaking potential.

We ended up visiting Citizens twice during our stay in Vegas and tried the following:

* Calamari appetizer: excellent.  I usually hate Marinara sauce with my calamari, preferred the gentle kiss of lemon juice, but their spicy sauce was a nice accompaniment.
* BBQ Chicken Salad: basic but well done, although the chicken had a dry 'cooked earlier in the day & added at the last minute' feel.  Pretty to look at, well sized and filling.
* Mushroom Blue Burger: this was a messy, messy meal that I enjoyed every second of.  Towering high, barely held together by a skewer, this rapidly fell apart and more napkins gave their lives here than for any other meal in Vegas.  Their sacrifice was not in vain.
* Chicken Club Sandwich: the sourdough bread was the champion here, besides that it was a Club that wasn't any more or less tasty than any other Club sandwich, and the accompanying side of fries were delicious.

Prices are higher than you'd expect for somewhere that feels like a lunch place, however I rapidly learned that everything is a little pricier in Vegas, so this is a good average priced choice by Vegas standards.  

The food is tasty but not life changing, however by Vegas standards this is a great low-key place for grabbing a quick bite to eat.
Going to citizens for my birthday dinner, not sure if I'm going to get the Frisco or the spaghetti both are delish! GreAt spot to meet and eat.

The prices are pretty comparable to most places in Vegas. The employees are fairly nice. I ordered their caramel macchiato and a chocolate muffin. The macchiato is probably the worst I've ever had and the muffin didn't really taste like anything. I wouldn't suggest stopping in for a quick breakfast here. Go to the Starbucks around the corner.
This place rocks! Awesome staff and totally worth a 10 minute wait to get food at 1:30 in the morning!

Great breakfast fresh smoothie! Ordered a fruit bowl. At these prices I'd expect organic produce - no such luck. Also there was such a huge line of convention attendees (myself included) trying to get to our booths on time and only one staff member taking orders in their take away line and only one person actually fulfilling the orders. A needlessly long wait ensued!!! Smoothie was great though.

Took my children to Citizen's to have a Christmas Eve breakfast. Dion was our server and he was great! He was very helpful and attentive with a great attitude. We love Citizen's for their great service and awesome foodThx again!
Low quality food, I've had salads and their burgers, while not being terrible, it's not good.  Typical strip prices (relatively high) and quality comparable to a cheap grocery store deli.
