This is my go to place to eat when at Mandalay Bay.  Unique style, always great service and awesome food 24 hours a day!  Honestly, this place is as good as any of the "high end" restaurants at Mandalay.  The have great ribs, sandwiches, a lobster roll that is amazing.  I give it 4 stars because it is the only place that gets 4 stars at Mandalay and because they do every meal, and do it better than any restaurant on the property.
If rude hostess, and mediocre overpriced food is your thing then go here. Otherwise save your money and your time and go somewhere else. I've been here twice, had 2 bad meals and won't be back.

The ultimate mary was pretty neat, stacked with all the fixings.  Tasted pretty good as well.  We waited half an hour (no joke, had already finished my bloody mary + all the food on it) before the turkey burger would arrive.  When it came, the burger was luke warm at best, but the buns ontop and under were COLD.  It was as if they just came out of the freezer without being heated.  Disappointed.

Citizens breakfast was average. The eggs were made over medium as requested, but the bacon was not hot and the Tator tots with bell peppers and onions weren't my favorite. I had sourdough toast and it wasn't sliced or buttered. Could have had better at Denny's for a lot less.

Citizens is very convenient if you are staying at The Mandalay Bay.  Two of the best dishes are the 
Chicken Noodle Soup and the Fish Tacos.

O my goodness gratuitous I am and was incredibly disappointed by the way this place is managed and run. Never have I had such terrible service but what makes it worst is that it was from multiple people (including the manager) WOW!! Only reason this place has 2 stars and not 1 is becasue it is located in a cool hotel. No way no how will not ever stop by at this place again. Incredibly rude and unhelpful people. I was appalled at the way the manager or supervisor lady we spoke to runs this place. We walked by on the weekend of my birthday before heading back to LA around 11:30am on a Sunday and was told by the hostess that they were currently not seating anyone and to check back in about 20 minutes. We tried to ask if we can just sit at a table and have a drink but again she was persistant with more or less the same answer but in a much more rude way.  So we took a walk around Mandalay for a bit then upon our return around 12 we were told the same thing. At this point we were a bit frustrated and mad so we asked to speak to their manager. The lady came out and explained to us that they were changing cooks so could not seat anyone. But not only that in a very rude and snarky type of way, almost as if speaking and explainng was painful. We just wanted to sit out by the patio area and have a few drinks and people watch. But apperantly thats way to much to ask for these people. We finally ended up getting a table after somewhat of a heated confrontation from the bitter clueless manager. We had a few drinks and bought a few bread items/pastries from inside but could definitely feel the unpleasent welcome. How difficult is it to say sorry the kitchen is currently closed but if you wish to sit outside and enjoy some drinks go ahead. I mean geez it is freaking VEGAS how can you deny people drinks, she was very clear and did not want to let us sit in the patio table area she said we could sit at the bar but I guess customer service and making money is not exactly their first priority here... If I were the owner or person in charge I would seriously think about training the employees better. I know the hostess was just following directions but one would expect a person such as the female manager/supervisor to be a bit more competent with customer service as apposed to chasing money away. Will definitley tell everyone I know that is going to Vegas (specificly Mandalay Bay) to avoid this place like the plague.

Yesterday stopped by for quick light dinner.  Ordered turkey sandwich with  avocado, tomato, and greens.  Also ordered kale salad that include goat cheese and grains mixed in.  Sandwich was dry hard and salty so it was hard to consume.  The salad was hard and flavorless.  Sad...paid $49 for these food and didn't really the food.

Sorry, sometimes you got to be honest on a review.  The waiter was great, very attentive and at one point seemed like he was going to sit down with us to tell us about every item on the menu - maybe he was new.  The first hint was during a conference with 30,000 people this place had tons of open tables.  Food was not so great at dinner - ribs were not great, wings were not great, rice bowl was not great, fries were not great, get the picture?  I guess it's better for breakfast in the AM but there isn't much else open either at that time of day.  Bar looked well stocked, I will give them that.  Pricey for what it was, I think the hotel should tear this out and make a bigger Starbucks, they would have happier customers.  Sorry, go in for a drink or coffee and you'll be fine - avoid the food.
Fun place loved the decor and the food was very yummy! Tony had great recommendations!

Horrible experience.  Took 25 minutes from order to get my cold (expected) sandwich, an Italian Muffeleta, when the place was maybe 1/3 full.  Got the sandwich, and the bun was so stale I could have built a house with them.

I would have stayed and complained, but was already late for a conference by then.
We had a yelp promotion for a free cheesecake with entree and we were told that it was too late for entrees. We had over 200.00 for dinner.!really?? Ridiculous!

Great spot for a quick bite to eat inside Mandalay Bay. The menu has lots of variety with offerings to please most everyone in the family. Waiters and waitresses are accommodating and efficient. It's nice that this place has takeout too. If you don't want to sit in the restaurant you can order and take your food back to your room. Also, there is a separate to go area for picking up items on the go.

Located in the Mandalay Ba, my and my 6 friends walked around to find something substantial to eat. After looking at the outrageous prices at some of the other restaurants we decided on eating here as it wasn't crowded at 1pm on Saturday afternoon. Average price of a meal was somewhere between $10-16 and they had a very quick moving to go line. 
Came here on a sat around 1:30 with 6 people, 5 min wait to be seated. The food was a different story. Ray was our server. He was so sweet but we waited over 30min for our food even though the restaurant was less than 1/2 full. 
As my friend said: "this is the quintessential restaurant that needs to serve bread or chips." The waiting time was horrible as everyone in the restaurant can see the kitchen and see the food being lined up and just waiting to come to the table. 
We ordered fish tacos, loco moco and frisco melt.
1)Fish tacos came with 3 tacos and all the fixings: gauc, salsa and sour cream
2)Locomoco was a substantial size but pretty pricey for 17$ and IT IS NOT A BURGER. it is literally rice served with a hamburger patty and gravy and an egg overeasy. Really not sure why it is listed under the burger section
3) 2 of us order the FRISCO MELT: totally bomb and the price of 16$ on the strip was great. Melty melty cheese with sourdough bread and fried onions served with mayo and ketchup and French fries on the side. 
Mouth already watering even just thinking about it. Great meal for a pre-drinking night on the strip.
Would come here again. Price was reasonably and food was good. Service a totally different story. 

The funniest part of this place is that the atmosphere music was that CD "That what I call music" circa 1999

We started off with the shredded chicken noodle soup with buttered saltine crackers like when we were kids, then ordered the grilled Mahi Mahi fish tacos and there were 3 with guacamole, salsa and sour cream.  We also ordered the grilled shrimp on a bed of quinoa with yogurt sauce and steamed green beans.  All were delish and enjoyable and our waiter was attentive.
Best spot for a latte in Mandalay bay. Great sandwiches, French fries, etc. always a friendly staff. I recommend giving this a try if you're near by!!

2 egg breakfast and the ultimate breakfast (don't remember what it was called but it was basically 2 egg bfast + pancakes). Service was very prompt as we were in a hurry - EXCELLENT mimosa cocktails 
Bit pricey for bfast but with it -

I stopped in one morning during my conference and ordered the Bellylicious juice.  It was fresh, tasty and filling enough to carry me through my morning.  The grab and go counter is pretty busy, but the line moves fast.  The pastry case wasn't overly appealing, but honestly I really only needed/wanted the juice.
Awesome place when you don't want to eat a huge expensive buffet! Homemade food with a cool vibe. Love this place and glad it's near the Mandalay Bay casino!

I heard they changed up their menu so I had to go back! They still have my favorite queso dip but what I tried and enjoyed was the teriyaki, chicken & veggie bowl. The portions weren't overwhelmingly large but just right. My next trip I'll have to try the brunch. Enjoy?

I enjoyed the steak but was overwhelmed by the steak fries they served with my steak. 
Do they need to give me so much fries?

Was a little disappointed that they didn't have any beers on tap, but was glad to have the Stone Arrogant Bastard from the bottle.

Got the 18 hour prime rib, and was pleasantly surprised.  The steak was very thick, and yet tender and flavorful.

Husband and I went there for brunch I ordered the benedict with salmon and my husband got the chicken and waffles. We waited at least 30 min for our food and while my husbands food was nice and hot mine was not and my eggs were hard boiled. When the waiter came by and asked us about our food I told him I was not very happy with getting hard boiled eggs. He offered to get me more eggs but I declined he also said that he would talk to the manager. My husband loved his chicken and waffles and I thought my food was not good but at least the manager apologized for the wait and the eggs so we got the meal for free.

I enjoyed breakfast at Citizens during my recent visit to Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas. A Thursday morning, I was seated right away and promptly greeted by my server. My coffee came quickly, but unfortunately I had to ask several times for a refill - a huge pet peeve.

I selected the corned beef hash served with two poached eggs and hollandaise sauce, sans the sauce. I prefer Tobasco. The hash was quite good and the eggs were perfectly prepared. The portion was just right and I left feeling full and satisfied, albeit a tad under-caffienated.

All-in-all I enjoyed my breakfast and would dine here again, but I wish the service had been more attentive.

Now what is it about Vegas that makes you feel like you're constantly looking at a rear-view mirror? "Objects in the mirror appear closer than they are." Everything's bigger when I'm there, including my appetite once Jamie W. and I settled into a comfortable junior suite at Mandalay Bay. After a long drive and just before Jamie arrived, I was feeling mighty peckish but recognized dining options at a pricey resort are not so inclusive of solitary cheapskates like me. As I strolled among the restaurants and the hostesses in their strapless gowns, I came upon Citizens which turned out to be a slightly upscale 24-hour diner and bar. It's about three years old, so I wasn't familiar with the place.

I took a look at the menu and noticed it was all-American comfort food with Vegas prices. I have to say I was starving since I had not eaten since an early morning breakfast at SFO airport. The $15 Caesar sounded good to me, but I didn't want to use up room in my belly reserved for meat. The server offered a small version for $5, which was frankly quite abundant by itself with plenty of romaine drenched in a lemon garlic dressing topped with a Parmesan crisp (photo: http://bit.ly/21GGabO). It wasn't an artful plate but it certainly hit the spot. Now back to the size thing I was alluding to before. I decided to throw caution to the wind and ordered the $36 Citizens Prime Rib Dinner, oh yes, by far the most expensive thing on the menu.

What came out was a sizable cut of beef on the rare side but slow roasted apparently for 18 hours. It was satisfying enough with a nice crust though not as juicy or laden with au jus as I was hoping. There was a bit of sour cream on the side though surprisingly no horseradish. I should have asked for it, but the place was starting to hop at that hour. It came with a loaded baked potato heavy with a molten cheddar though the spud itself was a tad on the lukewarm side, while the steamed broccoli turned out to be one chewy stalk that required a sawing motion to get it into digestible portions (photo: http://bit.ly/1pnnNuG). I couldn't finish the meat, so I took the rest back to the room where there was serious gnawing throughout the weekend.

FOOD - 3 stars...hits the spot when you're hungry and portions are abundant (consider the prices) but nothing really transcended
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...spacious enough for a resort restaurant
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...servers buzz around a lot but pay attention when it matters
TOTAL - 3 stars...definitely a more reasonably priced option anytime you want it at Mandalay Bay

Frank the server was very inappropriate in his attitude. We ate a quick breakfast here and paid with a credit card. The others in the group were paying the tip with cash. They quickly left for a conference and forgot to place the tip on the table. The server Frank came outside of the restaurant and chased us down. He then proceeded to scold us in public saying that he lost $6 on our table (although our bill was more than $100 and we would have tipped at least $15). He yelled at us "Is this how to do this" as if we purposely and routinely  dine without tipping. Very tacky and humiliating ....

Great play to stop by and eat. We went around lunch time. We ordered the artichoke spinach dip which was amazing! Definitely recommend trying! Also tried the balboa steak sandwich , fancy for a French dip. Very good! Service was great too.  Overall an enjoyable place to sit and eat good food.

Very bad customer service and then the management comes over and tries to explain and fix the problem but he only makes the problem worse I literally said outside watch or older guy gets seated very fast straight to a table I then proceeded to watch everything and see what's going on and then management comes over to me and tells us that we can't sit there because the table hasn't been cleaned but the service attended who was there at the front desk was very rude nasty attitude will never come here again and I eat everywhere all over the world

Writing for take-out only.

The staff was friendly and remembered me after I came back the next day to order again.  

The first night we ordered the BBQ Ribs, the Truffle Cream Prosciutto Penne Pasta w/ Chicken, and Mac N Cheese.   

The BBQ ribs came at a full rack, there was so much food that it's hard to complain about but the BBQ sauce was just overwhelming with hotness and spice that I had to take some of it off the meat.  

The truffle pasta was REALLY good.  The really strong truffle scent could be smelled through the carryout tray and bag.  Each bite was so delicious.  This was really good that I had to get it again the next day.  What I found though was the consistency of the ingredients was off.  The second time I ordered this, there was far less prosciutto in the dish.  The chicken was  fine though and there were also peas which gave the pasta some color.  

The Mac N Cheese was pretty good too.  Mixed w/ ham and peas and crunchy bread crumbs on top, it was a good side dish.

While the food was not bad, the price was astronomical.  The pasta, for example, was $30 w/ chicken.   While it was enough pasta to probably feed two people, I can't help but feel bad afterwards for spending that much on one pasta in a place that's not really 'fancy'.  Of course, this is the Strip we're talking about.  So while staying at the Mandalay Bay, I suppose I'd go here again.  Otherwise, not making my way through the parking lot and crowd for this.
The food was horrible! It was so bland I asked for hot sauce and it still didn't help the flavor. Avoid this place if possible!

The french toast was okay.
There are better food options in this hotel and it's not like this is so much cheaper to warrant the okay food when there are so many better options.
Best part of citizen's in Mandalay Bay was our waiter Jason!!  Made great suggestions on the menu.  Dinner was great! We will defiantly be back.

Oh my gosh is all I can say about the grilled cheese patty melt that we got.I was only able to eat half of it. It was too full grilled cheese sandwiches with a great beef patty and caramelized grilled onions in it. Oh the grilled cheese sandwiches also had great slices of tomato inside of them and a patty melt itself had lettuce shreds inside of it. My wife had the same thing and we both knew this flavor from something else. Then all of a sudden it hit us - - please anybody doublecheck this going forward, but this grilled cheese patty melt taste almost exactly like an In-and-Out Burger Double Double. The service was good and attentive. Oh, I almost forgot we had the fried calamari as an appetizer and it was ok. The only real complaint was that the sandwich was extremely messy to eat and hard to control. With the size this thing there's no way around it. My wife's pickle spear was huge compared to the anorexic pickle spear that I got, just sayin'.

Call me crazy, but when I order a $23 dollar Crab Cake Benedict there better damn well be an English muffin otherwise you don't call this a Benedict. 

A Crab Cake Benedict without the English muffin is just crab cake with a poached egg and hollandaise. What the hell kinda place serves a Benedict WITHOUT the English muffin?? 

smh. 

2 stars is being generous.

Food here was ok. Kinda of on the expensive side even for vegas. Service is where there was lacking. Never received  drink  refills and once we asked for a check it took 45 minutes to get it when there was barely anyone in the resturant. Their walk up  coffee  area was good though and had great cappuccinos.

The wait was a bit long but it was after a music event so it is to be expected. The staff were super nice and the food was surprisingly delicious for such a late night eat! We got the Mac and cheese which was excellent, the French onion soup w 3 cheeses which is pretty big portions and the chicken quesadilla. All were great! Highly recommend this place! Outside seating is perfect for people watching! :)

Good place to grab a quick breakfast before heading out to the pool. My protein omelet was good but the potatoes served with it were old and cold. 

Good service though and probably one of the cheaper breakfast places at Mandalay Bay.

Long wait.  Kitchen needs a ton of help. Food was terrible.   Had an 18 dollar burger and tasted like a hamburger at an elementary school.   Dry.  Came out not hot.   
Fries came out warm and fresh tho.   Fries were just decent for an expensive cafe in Vegas.  

The only saving grace was the service from the waiter.  He was on top of it.

The food was amazing. It was the best quesadilla I'd ever had. 
The wait staff was good. However it was all together a little slow, maybe the kitchen was slammed or something.

Citizens is the only 24 hour joint in MB. So while they may not offer the best service and are overpriced, sometimes you have to bite the bullet.

I visited here twice during my stay, both times only using the counter service. The first time was late night for dessert. It took about 20 minutes for them to box up 2 pieces of cake and deliver them from the kitchen. That seems a little excessive to me. Good thing they quickly made me a tasty decaf mocha to sip on while waiting.

The second time for breakfast. It is nice to have healthy options, so I indulged in a fresh made juice and a breakfast sandwich. Juice was good (I would hope so for $9!) and the sandwich was just ok as it was warmed in the microwave. We waited again about 20 minutes for the juice and the sandwich.

On a previous stay, we have had sit down service. The food was pretty good, nothing stellar. 

I will be back because it is the only place to grab and go with decent food any time of the day you are ready to nosh without wanting to leave the hotel.

Came here late on a weekend night needing to grub. No other restaurants seemed to be open in the MB so we were directed here. Found a late night menu that was a bit pricey but whatevs...we wanted fries, wings, sandwiches...they seemed to have all the things even tho late night menu was limited. Overall not a bad place. Food was decent but nothing out of the normal fare ( wings, fries etc) just had an issue with service as server seemed hurried and made a snarky comment when
My friend was trying to pick a beer...mos def not my first choice...but if you're in MB late night not a bad option...

Vegetarian and gluten-free with a penchant for light, fresh, healthy fare makes for tough dining in Vegas. 
The to-go counter saved me with their kale salad, it was fresh and delicious. Too much dressing - really wish they could have the salads w/dressing on the side or ease up! But yummy anyway. Also nabbed the crudite veggies and tossed the ranch dressing. Pricey, but I was happy for some fresh veggies!
The sit-down side got me through breakfast with a tasty CA omelette. I got the eggs fried (and requested them cooked in butter not oil) with avocado, sour cream and pico de gallo on top. A little pile of tatertot hash came with. Was it mind blowing? No. Was it tasty, fresh and satisfying? You bet. The hash was "meh" but I could see folks liking it for that salty kick back to grade school. 
Coffee (iced americano w/soy) was quite good. 
Service was attentive and friendly, no complaints. 
All in all I am grateful this place is here and will gladly come back knowing I can get a fresh tasty meal. Expensive? No more so than the rest of Vegas.
Thanks, Citizens! (I'd actually give them 3.5 stars, 4 if the menu were a little more inspired, but all in all the food is reliable, good, and fresh.)

This restaurant says it's opened 24x7. We went there after reading good reviews. They would not seat us. Or anyone coming up to each lunch. I asked if they were "closed". She said they were transitioning from brunch to lunch and we'd have to wait about 1 hour. This place advertises 24x7, but it's not 24x7 hours in a row I guess. We Ate somewhere else instead.

The phrase "premium mediocre" was invented for this place. The bacon on the BLT and the Cobb was cold and congealed, the salad dressing was basically vinegar with no flavor, and the service was non-existent. We had to chase down our waiter for our drinks. We had to chase down our waiter for the check. We had to chase down our waiter for a pen to sign. We won't be chasing down anything to come back.
This was the perfect venue for my meetings during the Black Hat conference.  I received outstanding service from my waitress, Chelsea, and I will definitely keep this place in mind next year.

Althought the chicken soup wsa seriously amazing...that is all I can really say I liked about this place

Pros:
1) Great Chicken soup
2) Good bread (if you ask for it)

Cons:
1) Right next to a live band that is CRAZY LOUD...you cannot talk with a friend, or hear even your self think. I had to ask for my food to be wrapped up  to go eat in my room, as it gave me a headache
2) Stiff, not terribly friendly and inattentive service.
3) You should not have to ask for bread and butter when sitting down for dinner
4) A spoon and napkin should probably be included when you order your soup to go
5) Did I mention that the service was stiff, unfriendly and attentive? When my bill came, she dropped it ...literally...on my table, without eye contact or even a 'thanks'. There was only one other table with people in the whole restaurant...so it isn't like she was busy, either

The coffee is here is terrible. They don't know how to make it. I asked for a macchiato with soy milk and they told me "There's no milk, it's just foam." Um, so what is the foam made out of? And then I got a mocha the next day and there was no coffee in it. So I paid $7 for a hot chocolate.

This place was whatever. Nothing too special about this place. Was staying at Mandalay Bay and decided to check this place out. 

The food. It was honestly whatever. Given that it was Vegas, everything was overpriced. That is fine if the food was somewhat good but it wasn't. The food was mediocre at best, and nothing that I would rant or rave about. I was hoping and expecting better given that it was inside Mandalay Bay but that was wishful thinking on my end. 

When we walked in, it was pretty empty and only a few seats were taken. It took an awful long time for our waiter to get to us. For what reasons I do not know. Still, he took his sweet time, and once he took our order disappeared until it was time for our food to come out. Still no drinks and still no silverware. We had to remind the waiter when our food came out at which time he went and got it. It would be hard to understand a place like this inside a huge casino would have service like this when busy but when not busy blows my mind. 

It was good that my buddy and I tried this place. But many of the other restaurants we ate at Mandalay Bay were much better. 

Good place to try but nothing so special I would want or recommend coming back to.

$22 mediocre roastbeef sandwich
$18 slightly above average burger
$4 gatorade!!!
$4 mountain dew!!!
21 minute wait for to-go order

Shoulda gone with the Johnny rockets down the corridor.  A perfect storm of hunger, procrastination  and indecisiveness led us to settle for this 3 star joint on our way back through the hotel after visiting the shark reef.  Yelp don't lie.  Trust what you read and dine elsewhere.

Went in around 2 am, to just the cafe part of citzens...not the sit down restaurant part. & IT.WAS.AWFUL, terrible, quite shitty in fact.

Ordered a small size of the kale salad which was inedible and pretty sure against FDA regulations as it seemed it was kept unrefrigerated. Then I ordered a $10 "juice" that  was actually a smoothie. I'll give them points for using actual free fruits, but being from LA, I am very particular on my freshly PRESSED juice. 

NEVER AGAIN. Go to the little mini mart near the elevator and buy some cup of noodles there to satisfy your late night drunk munchies. Although there's no coffeemaker in the rooms at Mandalay, so ask for a cup of hot water from starbucks or citizens (they'll charge you $1)

Sometimes I wonder how people can be so insensitive to other people. I Ask if the chef could please make a salad that was nut free for my daughter, who is extremely allergic to tree nuts and he said "No" he was to busy and suggested she eat somewhere else!!!

The restaurant was very cute and pleasing to the eye. The service was good but the food was subpar. For how expensive it was, it was not worth the money. There was also live music next door while we ate which was obnoxiously loud and annoying.

Very cute decor. We ate here for breakfast on NYE day. Take it or leave it. Food was not that great, it was a bit blan. But when your hungover and there aren't that many breakie spots open yet it will do the job. I got the breakfast burrito, it was small but fine. My BF has the eggs Benedict, it was also okay. The benny bread was hard and they could done a better job on the poached eggs. We just needed some fuel and it did the job.

Just finished eating naked chicken wings and Caesar salad and it was delicious! Junior was our server and he is amazing! Not sure if he remembers us from a time in the past but he is awesome. I love coming here for the late night snacks and good staff makes the experience even better!
Art was great. He brought us everything we needed. Everyone enjoyed their entrees. The prime rib and salmon quinoa salad was great. Thanks for getting us out in time for our show.

Ate 2 meals and a late night dessert here during our stay at Mandalay Bay

The service is extremely lacking - inattentive , slow and overall a negative . We  will not be back

I visit Mandalay and Venetian convention center for week long business conferences and trade shows through out the year. This is one of the more reasonable places to eat inside the Mandalay Bay casino located near the convention center entrance.

We found ourselves coming back to this restaurant during a 5 day conference. The menu is so varied, and we were never disappointed in the quality of the food, whether breakfast, lunch, or dinner. The portions are huge so consider sharing. The kale salad with fresh egg whites and avocado was wonderful. Same for the pancakes for breakfast. They also offer large range of burgers, sandwiches, salads and breakfast 24/7.  

They have a take- out counter with some popular items if you are in a hurry. Expect a wait, especially when the hotel hosts large conferences.

Tony our waiter was quick friendly and his knowledge of the food was superb.  He took a great photo of the group next to us without hesitation!  
The French Onion Soup we split was excellent, very cheesy, and large portions...even split between the two of us.  I had a Tommykbocker Butthead Boch, and my GF had the Midori sour, both excellent even if the sour is a bit overpriced.  We then split the NY steak and it was very juicy, and well cooked to our medium order.  Came with fries on the plate, and if it wasn't juicy enough, the A-1 butter was really good.  A really good meal on the Strip for a high-priced seventy bucks, given the atmosphere, but not as pricy as other places in the Mandalay Bay.
Well recommended, and we split on whether we would come back again.  We like variety, after all....

Truly outstanding customer service!  I mean, really impressive.

In the middle of my meal I needed something and turned around to see if our waitress was around.  I thought I spotted her way back in the kitchen and I waved.  Then I realized that wasn't my waitress.  

I turned around and got back to my meal.  But before I could take a bite, the waitress that I had waved to was at my table asking if I needed anything.  Dang, she wasn't even my waitress but she dropped what she was doing and hustled over to see what she could do for me.  

That's just one example.  I could cite more.   All the waitstaff are like that.  Efficient, accommodating and super friendly. 

This wasn't our first visit.  We've been eating here since the restaurant was called Red, White and Blue.  The name changed, but the food is still great, and the service is exemplary.

The food is a little more expensive here than the coffee shop.  Breakfasts are $17-$20.  I always get the Eggs Benedict, which is always prepared perfectly.  The Hollandaise has a subtle herb flavor that sets it apart from the typical version.  The breakfast potatoes are simple, yet delicious.  If you order anything with breakfast potatoes be sure to get a side of their sausage gravy.  It's outstanding and absolutely loaded with sausage.

My wife typically gets some sort of fresh fruit bowl.   I can verify the berries were fresh and delicious.  My nephew had the french toast, which comes topped with those same fresh berries, and it looked really good.  

They serve Lavazza for their house coffee here.  They use it for their espresso beverages, too.  Good stuff!

Mikey C says: Liberte, Egalite, Fraternite yo!

Turkey burger 18.00 too big for one appetite.
Fries are spiced perfectly.
Mac n Cheese tastes like old recipe. Really good.
Happy hour well drink was less than 6 ounces vodka n orange juice. 5.00
I will come back with more Freind to share with.

24/7! One of the better 24/7 restaurants on the strip that's reasonable priced!

My group and I visited Citizens one late night after a night of drinking in the Foundation Room. Our server was so excited at first to greet us because we had a party of 6. He thought we were going to be a high value table, but his demeanor all changed when we told him we were only ordering a couple orders of those crispy piping hot waffle fries and the wonderful delectable sliders along with only waters. We only saw him once more after he brought us our food. I thought it was rude of our waiter to treat us differently only because we weren't spending as much $$$ as most tables would. It was am, we just wanted some snacks!

Despite the service snafu, the appetizers (sliders and waffle fries) were quite good. Even though we didn't order any main entrees, everything was reasonable priced. I will definitely come back to Citizens Kitchen & Bar to give their entrees a try!

Only ordered at this place from the walk up counter for breakfast and lunches. In a sea of super expensive mediocre spots, I found Citizens to be a good place for a sammy and salad. Was the the food pricey for what it was? This is The Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas, so yes and yes.


I gave it 5 stars though because of all of the restaurants in the hotel, this seems to be the only one that deserves to have a line.

We met with our out of town friend after her day at a convention yesterday and decided to try out Citizens Kitchen & Bar.  My husband and I split the Fish & Chips and my friend got a cheeseburger with no bun.  We all had fries.  Not the healthiest of meals but we were all hungry and looking forward to a quiet place to sit and catch up.  My husband is a fast eater and got through his food fast and within 1/2 an hour, was in the bathroom.  We left earlier then planned as he was not feeling well.  My friend managed to get back to her room before her stomach started bothering her and I made it home.  All night & morning, we all had diahhrea and stomach issues.  I called them in the morning and asked to speak to a manager to let them know what happened so maybe others wouldn't get sick.  I got a snotty, arogant manager who told me they hadn't had any other complaints and since we didn't all eat the same food, it couldn't possibly be food poisoning.  I told her we all had something fried so maybe there was an issue with their fryers and they should look into it.  She said OK - and hung up on me.  What great customer service!  

We spend $70 on 2 meals & 2 sodas and ended up sick as dogs and we basically got - nope, didn't happen, don't care - see you.  Mind you I know their mentality - these people won't be back and we won't have to worry about it again although I did start the conversation letting her know we were locals but that didn't even seem to matter - and it shouldn't - bad food or service should not be for anyone, local or tourists.  But we will definately not be going there again and I will let everyone know what happened so they don't have to experience it themselves.  All of this could have been resolved with a little bit of compasion - it wasn't like I was asking for a free meal or anything - just for them to acknowledge and do something so no one else would get sick.  It might have been a one off but I won't recommend it to anyone - if management doesn't care, why should their employees?

Basic bacon, egg, and cheese on a kaiser used to be simple and delish now it's served in a plastic container with very crispy potato hash and much more expensive. Fruit bowl is huge. Wish things at this great grab and go would go back to paring it down. They do have lemon for tea unlike Starbucks around the corner.

The food was fresh and vibrant, the service was attentive and the atmosphere was modern and whimsical.  I had the Greek omelette for breakfast and my man had the salmon omelette- both were fabulous and we are going back tomorrow.  Our server was Laura.  Thank you!!

After getting in on a super-delayed flight, standing in line at 2 am for check-in, and making our way to the room, the ONLY place with food that was open was Citizens.

The very comfortable comfort food did the trick, and the price was pretty super.  Also of note was the service.  It was hoping, as you would expect, and the servers were high energy.  Citizens hit the spot!

This place is conveniently located in the Mandalay Bay basement shopping area. We came here specifically looking for healthier options, so we tried their fruit salad, Caesar salad, mixed green salad, and quinoa salad with seasonable vegetables. The salads have extremely fresh ingredients, which is great. But what I love about this place is that each piece of lettuce and ingredient is generously drizzled with the dressing, yet the taste is quite balanced and not overpowering. The decor of the restaurant is also nice and clean, which helps with the appetite for certain. For those that want to easily bring food to go, Citizens offers many easy to-go options right at entrance, which you can just pay, go, and enjoy!

- - FOOD POISON - - BAD SERVICE - - AWFUL MANAGEMENT - - 
We stayed at Mandalay Bay for our Vegas trip and decided to get something to eat late night, unfortunately the only place open was Citizens Kitchen. We walked in and got seated, the server had problems taking our orders and since he thought he could remember everything without writing it down he then brought out some of the food wrong. It took them 30-35minutes to bring out the food. No one wants to wait that long for food at 2am. Five out of  six people ordered the same food and it was the Burger and let me tell you that the vacation ended right there! Every single person had the worst stomach pain and you can imagine the rest!  I asked for a refund  the following day,  the managers told me that I should send an email with my experience so they could look it over, Nick one of the managers actually tried to help and he told us that they were very embarrassed over this and would do anything to fix it so he asked for the receipt and that he would refund the money, until today I only received $45 out of almost $180, they couldn't even track our bill and refund the rest being that they have an advanced POS system. It took them 3 weeks to refund the $45 while I had to text and call everyday.  Two of the five  people that had food poisoning  actually went to the doctors the day after and were told that it was 100% food poisoning.  Save yourself some time  and pain, do not  go to this place. It has awful food and service. I will never go back to this place and will never ever recommended this place to anyone! 
- - - FOOD POISONING IN VEGAS ON YOUR 1st DAY OF VACATION, HOW MUCH FUN IS THAT - - - 
 
Manadalay Bay should seriously think about renting to this place since they are inside of this hotel and getting so many bad reviews...........

My wife and I spent the week in Vegas to attend the Keller Williams Real Estate conference. It was our first time in Vegas. We had breakfast here and Shanna served us. She was so joyful, accommodating (my wife has a gluten allergy), and prompt! Talk about service with a smile! She got us in and out quickly and was so pleasant. The juice was awesome! Definitely go see Shanna at Citizen!

Quick seating.  Great food.  My husband is a wing man; he loved the buffalo wings.  The BBQ ribs were great as well, but my favorite were the onion rings that came with the ribs.  Finished the meal off with a nice piece of cheesecake, which was excellent. I will definitely be back.

Service was good, but the food was not (at least for me it wasn't).  Tried the meatloaf and the macaroni and cheese... *sigh*.  My friend had the double patty melt and he liked it.

Maybe next time we go back to Mandalay Bay, I'll give them another try (but a different menu item for sure).
The food was great, I had the bisquits and gravy skillet, I was so full I couldn't even finish it, my bf had the ultimate breakfast he loved it, the pancakes are supper fluffy

Lovvvvvvve citizens!!! The sweet chili Thai wings, smothered tots, and their specialty cocktails are to die for! The atmosphere is amazing with a contemporary spin on American food.  Most importantly, the customer service is above par! Joe, my waiter provided a very awesome experience for me! He persistently checked in on my table and his personality was the icing on the cake! Definitely coming back again very soon

My review is not really for Dinner at Citizens, we sat on the 'patio' with a bunch of friends and had coffee and dessert....which was delicious! 

The staff was really fun and friendly. Service was fast, and we all enjoyed our choices!

What more can you ask for while sitting in a casino with friends?

I don't know why this place only has 3 stars but it's been a lifesaver for me! If you're staying at the Mandalay Bay and Looking to eat semi-healthy, not spend too much money and not looking to travel far, this place is perfect. The café is open 24 hours and they offer salads, sandwiches, wraps and smoothies. A much better alternative to late night French fries or the $19 room service Cobb salad before service charge and gratuity. The staff was friendly except when I asked for some hot sauce to go, one chick said not a word to me and slammed a bottle of Tabasco sauce on the counter in front of me without giving me a Togo Ramekin. I was tempted to walk away with the bottle. But I didn't. My tuna salad wrap was $11 and some change and pretty hearty. I saved the other half for later.

If not for the friendliness of the help, I'd give one star. The line was long and moved terribly slow. Seemed sufficiently staffed, although staff wasn't very organized or efficient. Food represented at the counter isn't necessarily available. Food is also pretty over-priced for what you're getting. Seems like a lot of it is pre-fab, like employees are opening a plastic case and serving to you. My daughter's $6 cupcake was gross, tons of preservatives. 

The only positive is that the staff was nice. We won't be back though. For over-priced, pre-fab food, even Starbucks is a better option.

Overall, the experience at Citizens was pleasant and had a fun atmosphere with great food.  Unfortunately, our waiter (also was the bar person) was what prevented me from providing a 5 star review.  Food, which I had a chicken Caesar salad and pretzel bites, came in great portions and had a great quality to it.  Salad had a perfect amount of dressing too I must add.  My friend had the nachos and we would never have guessed they would be a mountain of nachos.  Leftovers were taken home.

Our waiter who was the bar person did move with urgency, but after we had ordered, his attention seemed to grow less patient with us and he engaged with us much less than everyone else around us. This was most noticeable when asking to box up the leftovers. He made a comment to boxing the nachos that seemed to imply he didn't want to waste his time if we were not going to take it home.  His facial expression and tone made it seem like we were going to waste his time by asking to box the nachos.  Even the gentleman sitting next to us caught wind of it and was slightly put off by the remark.  Do not get me wrong, this bartender was incredibly nice and respectful everywhere else, it was just this interaction that really left a lasting impression.  Perhaps next time I'll just stick to the regular dining experience with the waiters and waitresses.

5 stars on the food, 3 stars on service leads to an outcome of 4 stars. I can't say enough about the food here. We come here often because we can't get enough of the calamari and bloody Mary's. 
My girl sticks to the fish tacos, (mahi or Ono) can't remember. But they were delicious. I'm not crazy about fish tacos but they're fantastic here. For me, the calamari really hits the spot. The breading isn't too much and the calamari inside is perfectly chewy and firm. For dinner, I got the burger. Which was solid, classic American. 

Don't miss this spot, drinks/calamari appetizer/Tacos/burger, won't disappoint!!
Awesome. We just drove in from LA and wanted a quick bite. This restaurant is great, the portions are just right and service reminded me of old Vegas. Our server was Eric and he was awesome

I will start off by saying that I am a local. I could have went to any sandwich joint/cafe off the strip and paid a LOT less, HOWEVER, I knew I was on the Strip. If you are on the Strip, you're going to pay twice any amount for that sandwich. Get over it. I ordered the tarragon chicken sandwich and my boyfriend ordered the turkey and avocado on wheat instead of whichever roll they had listed on the menu. The staff was happy to accommodate to our requests and were more than friendly. My sandwich was out of this world delicious. The bread was so surprisingly delightful. Crusty, but with a soft pillowy center. One sandwich was nearly more than enough for me. The boyfriend and I usually order two things and trade halves. His turkey/avocado sandwich was exactly what he was looking for and made to satisfaction. It wasn't anything that lifted my eyebrows but there was absolutely nothing wrong with it. All good here if you're just looking for a quick sandwich.

I had a string of business meetings at the Black Hat conference this week, and received outstanding service from the staff, particularly two waiters: Chelsea and Kevin. Management was very understanding of my two days' worth of meetings there, and has been extraordinarily accommodating. I will be sure to come back for next year's conference!

The set up of this restaurant is pretty cool. It's very casual with like sandwiches, salads and things as their food. My cousin and I just really wanted some fries, and we were really disappointed. We ordered just a side of fries, and when it came out we could tell that the fries were old and re-fried. We wanted to make a comment but we were in too much of a rush to tell the cashier. I will come back again and give this restaurant another shot. However, I may not order their fries this time. ENJOY!

Came during the breakfast rush. Waited a short 15 mins to be seated. We ordered the corned beef (4/5 stars), crab Benedict (4/5 stars) potatoes were bomb! Creme brûlée French toast (1/5 stars). Everything was great except the French toast. It tasted like regular French toast with an orange cool whip topped with greasy berries. Our server was awesome, super friendly and sweet!

I came in for breakfast and sat a the bar. The food was good  HOWEVER,  my bartender/waitress Raquel's customer service was horrible... borderline racist! Good news...she had no idea who she was serving. She soon found out!

This is a place for some comfort food. I had the meatloaf and mashed potatoes which were both on point and my husband had the prime rib with onion rings and a side of mash potatoes. It was all good but DAMN...too expensive. Cost us $85 and change. 

The only thing other than the cost that I didn't like was the waiter picking up our receipt while we were still sitting at the table. All waiters and waitresses know that this is a NO, NO!

The seats were a little uncomfortable too.

We just came out of LIGHT club and wanted some late night grub. This was delicious!!! We ordered the French dip and lobster roll with potato salad and coleslaw. The coleslaw was great, and I'm sure the potato salad would be to someone else (big cut pieces of potato), but I love my mother-in-laws the best. This was a breath of fresh air from the food at LVH hotel. Bill was $45 we ordered waters ;) they need to work on better service though, it took mustache forever.
The absolute best chicken wings I have had in years.  Other than that, pretty pedestrian.  Considering the price, I cannot give it more than 3 stars; and even that is sketchy.

I always have an amazing meal when I come here! The food is delicious the staff is friendly and fun and very attentive! Today I went for their delicious brunch and had an amazing server named Tim! Not only was my eggs Benedict to die for! But he made sure we were constantly okay and restocked fresh coffee, water and drinks without us having to ask! It is always a good time there! I recommend brunch and Tim for sure! :) cheers!

Terrible service, terrible food , terrible music... The food did't have any flavor, the meat was all fat, the quinoa wrap had no dressing or flavor.. The server didn'pay ANY attention to us.. What a bad experience!
Late night snack in Mandalay. Lots of pastries to choose from. They even have salads, donuts, cookies, pies and more.

Good and filling food at a reasonable Las Vegas price. Service was friendly and delivered food in a reasonable amount of time. Sufficient enough choices to meet almost any taste buds. 

I recommend you sit outside and eat as that will allow you the entertainment of people watching as you enjoy your food.
The turkey avocado sandwich is the best turkey sandwich I've ever had. The bloody Mary's are delicious as well. Beautiful dinning area and accommodations wait staff.

THE PORTIONS ARE HUGE!  just an FYI. Service here was great. Unfortunately I can't remember our waiters name but he was soo helpful and cheery. The hostess was helpful as well we had a show to catch and she made sure we were seated quickly.   The reasons for only 4 stars is the price. It's a bit over priced. I don't mind paying for food, especially when it's a large portion, but the drinks here are really expensive.

I probably suffered hearing loss at this establishment. After waiting for fifteen minutes, my boyfriend and I were seated in the main dining room. The music was so loud that we literally could not be heard by each other or the manager - who stopped by the table to check on us. He asked how our experience was and if he could do anything to improve it. We asked for them to lower the volume of the music. He replied "What?" because he literally couldn't hear us shouting. 

During dinner, in which we both donned earplugs and entertained ourselves with our phones, my boyfriend downloaded a decibel meter onto his phone, and found that the ambient sound level peaked at 97db.  I honestly feel so sorry for the staff who's forced to endure the noise in this establishment. 

The food was fine. The service was minimal. Our server had two huge tables in addition to a number of four tops, and was super overworked. She was doing her best, but it was clear we were on our own. We saw her twice during the whole meal. 

Avoid, unless you want to hurt your ears.

I got the breakfast burrito. It was good and very filling.  The guacamole tasted fresh. The salsa was warm,  and I prefer mine cold; however, it did have a nice bite to it.  The service was friendly and attentive.

Came here late night with my best friend and her co worker! It was literally not the first choice of dining but at 3:30-4 AM there isn't much of a choice in Mandalay Bay. The menu of course is going to be expensive because it's a hotel chain restaurant/deli or whatever. The down fall is that with it being so late they have a very selective menu to choose from so you don't really have many options! Our waiter was an airhead and we had to keep asking him for the necessary things that should've already came automatically such as napkins and water.. After spending over $60 for some basic ass meal I was completely over it because there's no way no breakfast burrito that small should've costed $13 and then the potatoes were basic with no seasoning.. My bf liked the food probably only because he was drunk but other than that I can't see myself eating here again unless I had a food and beverage credit from the hotel, but wait even then idk I would probably choose somewhere else...

Over-priced for what it is, but I have to give props to any place which has Hot Browns on their menu.  That alone is worth the price of admission as getting that dish made decently outside of Louisville is a dicey proposition at best.  But, true to its reputation, the Hot Brown at Citizens more than lived up to expectations.  And that's coming from an honest-to-gods native of the 'Ville.  Just like you wouldn't question the judgment of a true-to-life Quebecois when it comes to poutine, when somebody's from that region known as Kentuckiana their word is law when it comes to hot browns.

Frankly, you can skip everything else since it's what you can find in any half-decent all-night coffee shot/diner.

Loved this place! Justin, our waiter was so professional, best server in LV.
Food was hot and delicious.
My son loved his maui maui tacos, and my beef dip was yummy. 
Thank you!

Another example of subpar service at a Mandalay Bay restaurant. 

I stopped by for lunch with a friend, and we found seats at the bar. The bartender barely even tried to fake friendliness, and proceeded to mess up an order that consisted of 2 salads. Luckily, the server who actually brought food to us was accommodating and fixed the order.

The salad was on par with what you would get at a Chili's, but cost twice as much. Nothing special to see here, folks.

We ordered an avocado turkey sandwich and a chicken soup to go at the express bar since we had a commitment and we didn't have much time. When we received the small little soup which we paid $9 for it, it was only 80% filled. We went back to ask the lady to filled it to the top,  and she just  said it is just the way it is and she made me feel really bad like I'm begging for food. I would think that such a nice restaurant in a expensive hotel mandaley bay will accommodate such a reasonable request. Maybe you should Train your staffs better.

Food here is decent, despite some of the reviews. My issues here are the service, which is usually by totally over it servers who have no real interest in being there. My server this past Sunday was openly telling tables how he hadn't slept the night prior, so his possible lack of attention to detail should be forgiven. Having said that, the turkey sandwich was really great. 

My second visit, at about midnight, was about the same service wise. However, they severely limit the menu past 11pm which is really annoying. While I understand the need to do that, the menu they use is almost exclusively appetizers, two pizzas and a burger. They need a bit more variety to make it an actual 24 hour cafe. The nachos were pretty good though.

I stay at MandalayBay/Delano about 2-3 times a year. I always walked past this place and told myself one day I would try it. That day came. I will probably keep walking by in the future. We arrived and there was a 5 minute wait, not bad, we did get seated within that 5 minutes. Once seated it was about another 10 minutes before our waitress, who was very nice, came over and asked us what we wanted to drink, by then we were also ready to order. I got the bacon egg and cheese sandwich and my husband eggs over medium, sausage, potatoes and sourdough.  We got our food on about 20 minutes. Mine was ok, just your basic breakfast sandwich. Their potatoes though wow, it's like the cap was loose on the paprika bottle and someone dropped it in the frying pan. I like paprika, but this was overkill. My husband on the other hand. Well let's just say I felt really bad because I picked the place. His eggs were not over medium they looked like hard frisbees with brown crispy outer edges like someone forgot them on the grill. You know what else they forgot was cooking? The toast? Yeah it came out served burnt. I am shocked they would send that out to a table. His sausage came in the form of bacon.  They left our plates so quickly it took a while fir him to get someone's attention to let them know he had ordered sausage. When he finally did, they brought him a side of sausage. He should have kept his mouth shut, because unlike the eggs and toast these were not over cooked. He cut them open and they were mushy and pink. So maybe breakfast isn't their thing here, maybe they need to hire more people, maybe it was just an off day. Anyhow, I don't think I will be back after that experience.

Their bbq chicken salad was the best salad ive ever had in my life!! The servers were really nice, too. Also we asked for plates to share and they gave us separate dishes!! How smart was that. However, their spaghetti bolonese was below average considering the price. ($25) i think i can cook better spaghetti at home
Like almost every restaurant in Vegas the food is good. Price wise they are fairly reasonable for the location. The sandwiches are always a good choice.

I am writing this review factoring cost out; food in Vegas is really expensive if you are in or near the strip. Expect to pay $17 for an omelette consisting of chicken and egg whites. With that being said, the service and food here is pretty good and is one of the better places to dine if you are in Mandalay Bay attending a conference, a conference where apples were sold for $5 each. The seating inside is ample and service here is friendly. They have a variety of options and their coffee is pretty good. You can check in to get a free cheesecake. We checked in one day, and redeemed our cheesecake to go as a side along with our breakfast (we are savages). I recommend the omelettes here or the skillets.

Generous portions.  Friendly staff. Food was excellent.   One of the best Carrot cakes we had, big enough for two-maybe more!    We had potato skins for an app and while it was four skins, they were big and came with plenty of sides to dress.  I had the french dip with a mac salad.  The mac salad was new the waiter said, and we unique as it had corn in it which offered a nice bite.  My wife has the BLTA and they do not short you on the B.  I was able to enjoy some bacon and leave plenty for the sandwich.  The coffee was the best coffee I have had.

A few of my co-workers decided to have some breakfast before our Zappos Company All Hands meeting and this was our choice.

None of us have ever been here and we love trying out new places to eat. Breakfast was on our minds and we were happy to have chosen this place.

I'll be honest, the food was amazing but I felt that it is just shy of being unique. The menu had some really great ideas but I feel like some items could be easily found in other restaurants. I think I may have to come back in the future and see if they've found their true character and add new items that would showcase the true essence of what this restaurant could be.

For that reason, I gave 4 stars.

But, let me share what I did love. The customer  experience. From the hostesses who greeted us and our waitress Jenna who was the most gracious host, was very attentive and made sure we were doing well throughout the whole time we were there.

The food was delicious. My cheesecake and creme brûlée French toast was delicious. Huge in portion with fresh fruit and a nice orange creme was really good. I think to take this dish up a notch would be maybe add the brûlée experience. 

My coworkers ordered the Ham and eggs plate, bagels lox, & the crab cake Benedict (great idea).

The pastry counter wasn't really impressive, many of the items resemble pastries I could purchase at a commercial cafe chain.

The food and experience though, was just right for myself and my colleagues.

If you're looking for some breakfast, this could be your go to choice. 

If Jenna is your waitress, you'll be in good hands!

:)

My favorite late night spot. The Ultimate Nachos as just that, huge portion. Bring a friend to eat here. A lot of items are big enough to share. Also, get the Carrot Cake, it's 4 big layers and requires 2 friends to help you eat it. Mmm. If you decide to try this place, tell them BATMAN sent you. I have to put an alias, since I don't like being called Michael. Lol. My name is always mispronounced. Enjoy.

Pricey but convenient, and a good business tactic for them being the closest to Light Nightclub.  Grubbers appear to veer toward this eatery after clubbing, as I observed.  The workers look tired but seem to maintain their patience.

Loco Moco for $17 is expensive and should be served without gravy spilled on the side of the bowl if I'm gonna be giving you my money for this high priced dish.  Quality issue guys.

I'll give them raves for their Reuben sandwich with crispy seasoned fries though.  Really delish!  Reminds me of Junior's in New York!  But not the cost; even in the east coast it's less and you get more meat.

I like them enough.

I gave Citizens two tries while in Vegas, mostly at the urging of a coworker who wanted to return to try breakfast, but I wouldn't have been back after my first meal, which was a lunch.

The first time we went, we stopped for lunch and sat on the patio. My coworker ordered a burger and asked for no onions on it. I ordered the fish tacos. We waited a good 25 minutes for our food, which is an eternity in lunch hour time, and the restaurant wasn't even close to full. When our food arrived, my coworkers burger had onions on it. He stated this to the waitress and she just gave him a dead stare and then walked off. He picked them off, and said the rest of the burger was ok. 

The fish tacos were itty bitty. I was confused and wondered if I had accidentally ordered off the appetizer menu, but nope....they were listed as one of the lunch specialities of the place. The three tiniest fish tacos of my life were not worth the $24 price tag attached to them, especially since my only "sides" were tiny cups of pico de gallo, sour cream and guacamole to put on the tiny tacos. If, after spending $24 on three tacos I have to stop somewhere else to get something to eat so I don't pass out from hunger by 2:00, we have a problem. Our waitress ignored us, and we had to ask for every single drink refill we got. 

I was ready to boycott the place for life, but my coworker is a more kind and forgiving soul than I am (or a glutton for punishment), so we went back for breakfast a couple of days later. We each ordered an omelet. My coworker asked for no guacamole on his....and they messed up his order.....again. I ordered a denver omelet and washed it down with some of the worst coffee of my life (which was $4...yes, for a cup of black coffee.....yes, you read that right). 

My coworker bought both of these meals, and I can't say I would ever come back, even if the food was being paid for by someone else. I am giving the place two stars because the decor inside is nice and the fish tacos (all six bites of 'em) were tasty. Otherwise, this place would be a solid one star.

Best French Dip I've ever had! Totally worth the $20. Can't believe we stumbled upon this gem after looking for a place to eat at 2am. This place is 24/7 and if you're in the Mandalay looking for a late night spot to eat look no further.

I was in town for a few days for a conference and wandered in to Citizens for lunch on the first day.  The food was pretty good, had the cobb salad, which isn't going to be a mind blowing experience no matter where you go, lol.  But because the bartender - Raquel - was super cool, I actually ended up going back two more times the following days.  I got the mahi tacos - bomb - and the chicken wings - good chicken, but a tad over sauced.  

I give this place a solid 5 just because I like chatting with Raquel.  But the mahi tacos are definitely worth it too.  

if you are looking for some decent food and cool people, definitely give this place try.
Food was pretty good, but nothing special. I think it's a bit overpriced, but it's Vegas. Great place for a late night snack or meal. Only restaurant in Mandalay Bay that's open late.

I have been here multiples times and I've become more and more disappointed every time I decide to come here.  I always order over the phone so that the food would be ready. Over the phone would be great if they answered their phones.  I've tried three times to place phone orders, the first time after 43 min of calling and getting the hotel involved they would not answer their phone, I ended up driving down there to place my order.  Second time I came here I decided to try calling again. Yayyyy they picked up the phone...then put me on hold... an hour and 38 min later I drove down still being on hold to show them that no one is answering and that I was on hold for an hour and 38 min.  I spoke with the manager (Shawn) and  he apologized and said there must be something wrong with the phones.  I called as he was standing there and voila they worked fine.  Weird.  Today a month later, I decided to try my luck one more time.  Driving past state line I called and someone answered the phone yayyyyy... NOPE. Again placed on hold and drove all the way to the Mandalay again to show the same manager that I've been on hold 38 min.    He apologized and again gave me there must be something wrong with the phone schpeal.  Tried calling while standing there and holy cow the phones worked.   When I was on hold all of these times I tried calling on three way to see if they would pick up and the phone just rang and rang. 

Back to today, I placed my order to be told they are all out of the bread that my 5 sandwiches come on..  I asked for a croissant instead and a girl named  Heather said you need to pay extra for that.  Super condescending and rude.  The only one that handled this professionally was Sarah.  Jessica decided to come to me and directly  say you need to move your bags(the food) they just brought out to me off the counter.  She argued in front of the customers and two other customers stated that the customer service is horrible.  Was this girl for real??? After everything I've been put through she is raising her voice in front of other guest and telling me to move my food bags in a condescending voice.  Ughhh.  So sad the food is really good here but they need to clean house and hire staff that knows how to work with guests.  Thanks Sarah for your help!   Shawn the manager just kind of looked at me glossy eyed  both times I spoke to him so I'm not sure he's going to address the issues at hand.  Some how the staff acted as if I was in the wrong here.  Please citizens get it together. Mandalay is an amazing place this restaurant should be ran with the same customer service as the place it's in.   So sad
Waited 20 mins for a microwaved burrito we had to ask the manager to check on...yes I said microwaved. Awful....don't eat here, go somewhere else. $9 for a microwaved breakfast burro is shameful.

Late night Christmas eats in Vegas! Citizens is the only place open beyond 10pm tonight. But...mmm...this is still a great choice.

I had the fried calamari, French onion soup, Caesar salad, and steak frites -- to go. It was packed perfectly for me to take back to my room.

The calamari was tasty and lightly beaded. It was great even without the two sauces it comes with - cocktail and Thai chili. The salad was crisp and as fresh as you'd expect with a couple of large croutons. The French onion soup was savory with shredded onions and a layer of gooey cheese. No croutons in the soup and it was on the slightly sweeter side. The steak itself was good. I ordered it medium and it was a full 16oz steak. The fruit bowl was a nice way to finish it all off.

Service was fast but the wait for the food was over 20 minutes. *sigh* Pricey too but what else are you going to eat at this hour on Christmas day?

This place is right smackdab in the middle of Mandalay Bay and it has tremendous comfort food for you to enjoy.  The portions are really formidable and the food is quite satisfying.  The staff is pretty funny and they really do take their time to make sure you are having a great meal.  Sometimes the place can get a little noisy from when the crowds come through, but if you can catch it during a lull, its a real nice place to grab some top-notch food that won't break your bank while in Vegas.

We got there right before lunch so we avoided a wait time but on our way out the line looked quite long. Not bad for the price! The food itself was nothing remarkable. The drinks were great! 
I must say, I was a big fan of the decor as well.

I wasnt that impressed with Citizens. The service was really slow and the food was eh. The restaurant is located in the Mandalay Bay right across from Light. The decor is nice and casual with a pretty open floor plan. There are big windows that allow you to people watch while you eat. We went there twice because they are the only place open 24 hrs. Before the club I had the chicken penne. The penne was cooked perfectly but the sauce to pasta ratio was way off, the penne was swimming. After the club I had the fish and chips. The cod is nice and large but its the breading that killed the dish for me. The cod was beer battered but there was so much beer in the batter, it made my fish taste like fried bud light. Way too over powering to finish not even hot sauce could save it. Id go back if in Vegas again but I would just try my luck with other items.

Honestly, how do you screw up breakfast.... Food was horrid.. Cold no taste.. 
Had a conversation with Manger Keith he was receptive & accommodating.  
After, the bad food the the server screwed up our bill.  Took another 10-15 to complete task to get the Hell out of there.  Pass on this place... Spent almost two hours in Citzens.. Two hours of my life I'll never get back. :((
My boyfriend and I went for a late night drink and snack. We ordered nachos and they're so good. Big enough to share among 3 people! The Cadillac Margaritas were good too. Their service is amazing!

What a great find. We went for lunch last Saturday after arriving in Vegas and glad we picked this place. We ordered the French Dip and it was delicious. My only complaint would be a lighter side like fruit as an option. But the sandwich was flavorful, the au jus delicious and really a great meal. I'd recommend asking for horseradish on the side for an extra kick but either way it's good.

I was very pleased with my meal after giving this restaurant a shot. It's conveniently across from The Light Nightclub which is the whole reason why we even ate there in the first place.

For starters, the service is grand! I had a great time cracking jokes with our waiter as well as for some of the other staff. They're extremely helpful and always try to guide you in the right direction. The food was averagely priced and not bad at all. The wait time wasn't that bad either but that was probably because we were there an hr before closing time.

I enjoyed the salad I chose as well as the drinks they stirred up for me. The rest of my group really enjoyed their burgers here too. I think knowing that this restaurant exists will better my future stays at the Mandalay Bay.  I'm looking forward to see what other tasty meals I'll have here.

Stopped in after a concert. It was pretty late so it is all that was open. 

Now that I have been there, I would for sure go back. 
Got on the wait list and waited about 15 minutes. We sat on the patio, if it's a patio, since it's inside the building, but outside the restaurant. Got it? It was good because we could people watch. 

I ordered the Loco Moco. Great choice to absorb any alcohol. lol

The meat was cooked just right and had quality taste to it. I liked the stickiness to the rice. I think the gravy could have had a little more flavor to it, but it wasn't bad at all. 
Give it a try.

I was staying at Mandalay Bay for a work conference and this spot was one of restaurants downstairs among the many others.  Walked around checking all the restaurants out and this one seemed totally casual and a good place to grab a beer, plus it had the shortest wait time.  
They don't do reservations, so it's first come, first eat.  

Nice décor inside, relaxing, place felt comfy and welcoming for all. Menu looked pretty good with burgers, sandwiches, salads, some signature entrees and a bonus that they serve breakfast all day. My coworkers and I ordered a round of drinks first, they too have a nice beer list, cocktails and wine list to get you going.  

We decided to get some potato skins as an appetizer and it was pretty good, thick cut potato wedge with some bacon sprinkled on top and of course melty cheese on top with green onions. 
You get 4 per order with guac, sour cream and pico.  We were quite hungry so we devoured it in minutes.  

As for my main, I got the Mahi Tacos, 3 grilled Mahi pieces with all the normal fixin's such as pico de gallo, cabbage and avocado slices. Served with their usual friends of guac, sour cream and more pico. Fish was nicely cooked and good sized pieces and flavorful.  Anything with avocado or guacamole makes it that much better.  

Forgot what my coworkers ordered but they enjoyed their first Vegas meal very much. Stayed a bit longer to have a few more drinks so no room for dessert.  

Staff was fine, quite friendly, attentive and quick and helpful with making suggestions. No issues with our dining experience. If you don't want to sit in the dining room, there is a counter/walk up area where you can order to go. They are open 24/7 so this may be a good late night option before going back to your room to pass out.

This place is a joke. They basically force you to eat here late night out of lack of options. We called ahead to place a late night to go order and waited the 25-30 minutes that we were told, when we got down to pick up the order, we were told that they couldn't make a quesadilla because the menu changed a few minutes prior. First, I thought this was absolutely ridiculous to not be able to make a quesadilla and secondly I felt they should have called to inform us before we waited and walked down, because after 30 minutes we had to reorder and wait again. The man appearing to be the manager didn't speak to us at all and appeared very unfriendly to the guests and not helpful to the 2 young girls working behind the counter. The only reason I gave 2 stars is because the chocolate cake was phenomenal but the pizza was discussing and the service is a joke.

The "Ulitmate Mary" was unbelievable! Wow - what a cocktail. We had the organic granola & fruit parfait and the citizens famous bacon egg & cheese. The potatoes we dry and odd flavoring though.  Other than that good experience.
Just grabbed a bagel and hot chocolate. Delicious. The croissant dish was had by a fellow guest...looked out of this world. Easy, quaint place to grab a bite.

Nevertheless I must stress that this restaurant is remarkably forgettable. In fact, I busted out this phone piece just to write this in hopes that the next time I come to Vegas, the most meaningless city on the planet, I won't make the same mistake. I paid $20 for what was most definitely a DiGiorno's veggie pizza, complete with the world's most self-loathing olives and a crust that could cut through a human neck of equal or lesser girth to that of Penn Jillette (if thrown passionately). To make matters weaker, me and the crew had to mange that gange while getting blasted by a Bruno Mars stunt double.

I know there were some touch reviews but due to the good service and mega portion sizes, we will give them a four stars! Now the seating during a conference took a long time and the outside chairs are a little uncomfortable, however the short rib lasagna and fish and chips were stellar!

We came here for the late night menu. Ummmm, let's see $22 burger, $20 shrimp tempura and $14 pizza. This is the most overpriced restaurant I've ever been to in my life. Save yourself from less than average food and go elsewhere. This place is an absolute rip off. Our waiter was very nice though.

Horrible service, and we got food poisoning from here so will definitely not be back in the future. We came in around 9pm and the place was pretty much empty, but the staff (two females) wasn't very friendly, and it didn't seem like they wanted to take our order. My friend decided she wanted the Steak & Cheese Panini ($12, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/citizens-kitchen-and-bar-las-vegas?select=dgefLD8z6Vz861HvOIt6oA#dgefLD8z6Vz861HvOIt6oA), which was ready in 5-10 minutes. We tried to sit at the tables inside, but the staff said that area was closed, and forced us to side outside in the "patio" area, where the seats were not very comfortable, and where it was colder (even though we were still inside the casino). Some of the meat in the panini was still cold when we got it, since it wasn't heated evenly. However, since it looked like pre-cooked meat, we figured it would be ok, which was a terrible mistake since we all got food poisoning the next day. 

DO NOT EAT HERE if you can avoid it. If it's the only place that's open, make sure that your food is cooked thoroughly. However, if you see two females behind the counter, expect some crappy service.
Easy access for good all American food when you're at a Vegas convention at Mandalay Bay.  Staff is nice and they also have a convenient to go deli section.  Overall, I would recommend.

We only came here because they were open very late. They are incredibly expensive. BUT the food was very good. I had the Carnivore Pizza that was cooked very well and very tasty. My brother had Toasted Reuben with corned beef and mac and cheese as a side. I didn't taste the sandwich but did have a taste of the mac and cheese and it was delicious. They sat us "outside" and we enjoyed the band that was playing inside the casino while we dined.

Normally I receive great service here. But not today. Ingrid is too young (or acts too immature) for the position behind the register. I walked up, no one else in line and Ingrid and her co-worker didn't say one word at first. Not a "hello" or "welcome", just glared at me. Then after she finally decided to ask if I needed anything, I said "I just have a question, do you have chicken fingers?"  She seemed so bothered that she had to help me. This girl had no personality whatsoever. So I ordered two more things, and I was done with my order. I explained that I worked at Mandalay, to get my discount and she seemed even more annoyed about that. My tab was super cheap, and I asked if she got my order right, as I always spend at least $20 or more, because it was only $10. I was happy about the price, but wanted to make sure it was correct, because I had no faith in this person because of the lack of service to begin with. 
So I had her repeat what I ordered, she seemed annoyed.  Wow, I can't believe that it's so inexpensive, I told her. I also told I always spend a lot more. She just didn't get it, didn't get that I was being friendly and making small talk. She said "I gave you your discount, it's $2". I got that I explained and was just surprised it was so cheap. She said "I'm sorry ..."   Why is she sorry?  No idea. It was a weird experience. I was excited about the price and that it was much lower. "Well, it is from the kids menu". Oh okay, got it. 

Lmao. Get a personality Ingrid. And then don't continue to stair at people as they wait for their food. Then a manager with blonde hair came out and he stared at me. Did they think I was a celebrity or were they really just assholes?  Lol. Bad customer service no matter how you slice it  

The food here is good, but the chicken fingers tasted either like dish soap or freezer burn. Don't get them, even for your kids. The chicken noodle is amazing.

OK so I'm a sucker for good shrimp cocktail. I may have had the best shrimp cocktail I have had in about five years. I recommend great service and everybody smiling my fatness beer. Clean good for families good for fun

Citizen in Mandalay bay is my favorite lunch spot. So many options. You can grab a bite from the counter and take it to go in under minutes or you can choose to sit down at the bar/dinning room.
