Super friendly staff. I had a shaved steak sand which  served with fries on the side. Very delicious and the fries come in a super cute mini fryer basket. So much food to try here that I will def be back. This is my favorite lunch spot on the strip.

Came here after a night out with the boys.

I don't recall much but I did order a reuben sandwich.  Let's just say she would be disappointed if she saw it!  Yep the sandwich itself was massive and for sure I wasn't able to finish it....or was it!?  Needless to say, I ended up downing the whole thing while chatting away about the night.  The toast was crunchy from the outside and soft towards the middle, giving it a nice crunch while you sink your teeth into the warm cornbeef.  Add a little zing and sting from the sauce and we're all good.  

The place itself was packing quick from the late-nighters.  Loud as it should be while some of the unlucky one continue to work their magic for one last hurrah at a one-nighter! - Enjoy!
This place was just what we needed. Great food, great service from Tony, and great serving sizes. Fish tacos were unreal, and so was the French dip.

Two stars for the server but this place is way overpriced. I don't even get why it's so expensive. I know Mandalay Bay is a really nice hotel but still, this place has ridiculously priced items on their menu. My boyfriend and I just wanted a quick bite and since this was the only place open at 12:30am, we tried it. We got the quesadilla with steak. It was alright. Not bad but not great either. $35 for a cocktail and Taco Bell Style quesadilla is just dumb. I might go back if it comes to that again, but it's not on my list of places to rush back to!

My sister and I ate there on Saturday Feb 13 2016.
Food is overpriced for the quality.

About twenty minutes after eating there  - had to pull over in a parking lot - and we both vomited.

So this place was just ok.  

Pros:  Really bright clean atmosphere which is welcoming. Open 24 hours which is huge. Teriyaki rice bowl was very good, but in all honestly, it's probably hard to screw up. My husband really liked his pastrami sandwich. 

Cons: server was just ok. They messed up my husbands sandwich initially by sending it with no mustard and on the wrong bread which delayed our meal because I didn't want to eat without him. 

Overall, not bad, not great. I didn't advocate to return during our trip because it was meh.

$4 iced tea. Unflavored. 
Food is overpriced for the quality. Not worth wasting your money. 
Ordered the turkey burger which had no flavor.
Horrible place, I was waiting in line for 5 minutes and place was empty.  That is unacceptable service and manager should really evaluate their process.  Four people on staff at the time.
Great food affordabke for Vegas most try onion soup giantnormous.

"Every time I come in the kitchen, you in the kitchen." -- Friday (1995)

So disappointing. After an amazing show at House of Blues, my friends and I were starving. We wandered through our hotel looking to see what was open and had a menu of lighter fare and found Citizens. They could seat us right away so we went for it.

The service was horrific. Slow, and when our waiter did show up he was so quiet you could barely hear him and anything we did understand, he was a but rude. We ordered our sandwiches, soups, pastas, etc. and he disappeared. Drinks were barely filled and it took ages to get our food.

Once we actually got our food, it was nothing to write home about - although my club-like sandwich was huge. However, it was so dry it was very hard to get through. My pasta salad was pretty decent, but not really what you want to be excited about when you order a sandwich. 

This is definitely on my list to avoid in the future - I'd probably have to be desperate to eat here again.  Pretty disappointing since it seemed like it should have been a good experience.
Lotus is best waitress in Mandalay Bay - efficient, personable and served great food to our party! Best meal today.

We kind of happened upon this place.  We only sat at the bar~ but it is one of the great memories of the trip.  We had the best bartender we have interacted with to date in Vegas. Personable and friendly and makes mean drinks!!! Cheers to you Eric!  Your the best. They are lucky to have you.

Sadly this is a bad experience , since Mandalay bay is my favorite casino.
Poor service we sat at the bar , my friend order  a hamburger that came well done when we ask for medium.
Krick the bartender give me my beer and no glass so I have to ask for a glass  
Very poor service so sad that my favorite casino  has this service.

Citizen's Kitchen ( Formely known as Red, White, and Blue) is a little bit better than it's predecessor.  I ate here so much during my week stay that they morning crew almost knew what I was going to order as well as my name. The food was good even though you had to wait a little longer than expected even when it wasn't busy. They now have a juice/smoothie bar that I think everyone is still trying to get use to as it took quite some time to make a juice or a smoothie ( no matter if it was busy or empty).  Prices are a little steep but again luckily for me, I was not paying for it.  The portions are a decent size, even when you are just doing a quick takeout from the front. At least this place is now open 24 hours as it predecessor was not. Will I eat here on my own dime, in a pinch yes I would as the food was good even if it was a little pricey.

I never received such horrible customer service in my life.

It all started when my friend and I asked for 2 cups of water (tap).  They told us it cost $1.00 each, which really set me back because at least in California, charging for tap water is illegal.  I was raising that concern to my friend until the cashier barked at us "SINCE YOU GUYS ARE MAKING SUCH A BIG DEAL OUT OF THIS, JUST TAKE THE WATER AND DON'T PAY. IT'S FREE".  Incredibly rude.

I tried to not overreact and ignored her flagrant unprofessionalism, and proceeded to sit down to eat my sandwich.  As my friend was about to sit next to me, she yelled at us "YOU CAN'T SIT THERE, YOU HAVE TO SIT OUTSIDE AT THE PATIO".  I looked around to see if the indoor tables were closed or something, but there were a bunch of people sitting around us.  I then realized that this was some sort of punishment for complaining about the water surcharge.

What the hell.  If I wasn't so tired and hungry, I would've raised hell.  I guess that's what Yelp is for.

Chic but casual restaurant; service was incredibly fast for lunch, and the portions are huge, so super glad the husband and I split the caesar salad and tuna melt. Very fresh and hits the spot for a quick lunch.

What a treat this place was!  HIdden in the pancreas of the Mandalay Bay.  A great place for breakfast, lunch or a snack between drinks at 5 AM and dinner at 6 PM.  The chili was to DIE for.  Very mild with chunks of premium beef.  Tasted devine with sour cream.  The waffle cut fries were delicious and arrived in this cute little basket thing.  Which actually seem to be like the thing to do in Vegas now.  Must be a hipster chef thing.

The chicken wings were WAY spicy but my husband enjoyed them.

I really like this place for a quick treat.  Staff was great.

Be sure to take home a candy apple to eat while you watch a movie.
Good food only place really open late night at the hotel ....staff is nice food is fresh just a menu is small

Talk about a disappointment! 

I want to first say that our server was amazing and tried his best to give us the best service ever. Thank you!! 

My friend and I were hungry after a late night on the town, we were staying at MB and were craving burgers. We got there and were seated right away. My friend ordered the French Dip Steak and it was horrible! The meat was dryer than the Las Vegas heat, no taste! The soup that came with it was bland and the pasta was disgusting. Meanwhile I had the hamburger that had no taste to it. 

Now usually if we were paying a cheap price, you get what you pay for. But these orders were $20 bucks a piece. And I understand that it's late at night, but either lower the price or give us fresh food. We let our server know that we didn't like our food (we couldn't even finish it) and didn't want anything else. Then the manager came and basically told us that they did ask us if we wanted anything else and "apologized". Yeah, whatever dude. At the end of it all we did get a cut off our total, but the whole experience was a total let down. If you're going to be serving food, all I ask is for it to be GOOD. Avoiding this place from now on.
Tried Cobb salad for lunch.  Not bad.  Big enough to satisfy hungry appetite.  Service was decent.  I would go back.
Excellent food! Our best dinner in Las Vegas. We went to see Michael Jackson One to Mandalay Bay and a security guard in the casino recommended it. After dinner we went back to thank him.

Coming back to the hotel late the only place that was open was Citizens Kitchen and Bar. We were seated quickly and our orders were taken after our drink orders. The ultimate nachos with chicken had our names written all over it. Once the gigantic portion of the nachos arrived we could tell that their name was not a mistaken. There was a giant stack of nachos covered by sour cream, salsa, cheddar cheese, olives, beans, cheese wiz like cheese, jalapeños, and chicken. 4 of us split the order, with it being a meal for 2 of us and a side for the other 2. These nachos definitely hit the late night craving. There is plenty of nachos to share, and we even had some left at the end as they do get heavy with the cheese whiz on it. Most of the nachos retained their crispyness and crunch, except for the bunch on the bottom that were smothered in the cheese whiz. While at Citizens I did see giant and I mean giant pieces of cake that I will want to try on my next trip to Las Vegas.

Citizens is another solid spot by the Light Group. It's an upscale diner serving comfort food 24 hours a day in Mandalay Bay. Brunch might be the best time to go if you want to pig out on plenty of sweet and savory offerings like I did. The massive stack of red velvet pancakes may be one of the better versions in town. Just bring family or friends to make a dent in it. The creme brulee French toast is another exceptional rendition on a classic with bread dense enough to soak up and retain plenty of custard and a well crusted exterior that provides plenty of crunch. 

For savory options the kobe chili cheese fries were good -- particularly the light, crispy waffle fries that held up well under the meaty chili. They don't skimp with portion sizes on that dish or the big meatball parm, which is a single baseball sized hunk of beef and pork topped with a dollop of ricotta and sitting in a pool of sauce. A less than stellar dish is their ultimate tots -- standard tater tots covered in cheese and gravy. The chicken and waffles also proved to be decent, but far less memorable than the other dishes we tried.

Ending the meal was an excellent house-made carrot cake. It's moist and dense spice cake foundation with subtle hints of carrot were complimented by plenty of sweetness from a smooth and creamy cream cheese icing. 

It's clear that the Light Group knows who their target audience is and how to satisfy them. With Citizens, they deliver comfort food fit for a casual meal any time of day

This place is amazing!!! The bartender, Lizzy, is my fav! She had some wonderful menu & drink recommendations. I had the turkey avocado sandwich and the raging bull cocktail...both to die for. 

Also, to my girls and gays--there is a ton of gorgeous eye candy...you won't be disappointed!!!

Stopped here for lunch and was pleasantly surprised!  I would have given a higher rating but I felt our sever was unfriendly and slow. Tables around us got our food when they ordered after us. I got the quiche and it was good, not great. It seemed like more breading and less egg where I wish it was more egg. My husband got the chicken sandwich and loved it while by daughter got the blta sandwich and it had us all wishing we ordered that. She said it was AMAZING!  They are open 24 hrs so whether your looking for a nice lunch or late night snack Citizens its a great place at stop.
I got the chunky monkey shake and it had no flavor at all.. very disappointed & over priced think they forgot to put the banana inside.

Great for lunch. My husband and I shared the chili and mahi-mahi tacos. The waiter said the fish tacos are what "made the restaurant famous" and the did not disappoint. They were tasty and of good quality.   The chili was spicy and yummy. 

The atmosphere was that if an English dinner and the service was friendly and top notch. A great place for lunch.
Great grilled mahi mahi tacos.   Available to sit at bar even at busy time    Bartender was very helpful and informative.  Nice atmosphere in Mandalay Bay very relaxed vibe

It is mind numbing to realize that an operation like Mandalay Bay could invest so much into their Foodservice program yet deliver such an inferior product. There was really nothing good about this dining experience. Let's start with the waiter, "Erick".  Someone needs to explain to him that good customer service does not include a phony, smarmy attitude. Erick didn't seem to comprehend that when a customer has an issue, he needs to respond, not just give lip service. Citizen's Kitchen is supposed to offer comfort food. But it isn't comfortable on any level. After I was seated, it took Erick quite a while to approach. I ordered the potato skins appetizer and the BLT & A sandwich. It took forever for the appetizer to be brought to the table. The potato skins looked great, but were cut so thick that the potato remained raw and hard. Difficult to eat and cold and bland. To make matters worse, the sandwich came out within two minutes of the appetizer, forcing me to try and quickly eat the appetizers so I could get to the sandwich and fries before they turned cold. When I mentioned this to Erick, I got a blank stare and an apology. But no action. Sure enough, by the time I got done with the appetizer, the sandwich and fries were cold and hard. Again, Erick didn't seem able to comprehend why this was an issue. No action. Eventually the manager "PJ" came by and I asked him why they served appetizers and entrees together. He stated they didn't. I explained my situation. He apologized and offered to correct the situation. But by that time, it was too late. Raw potato skins and cold BLT aren't a great meal. In fairness, PJ did take 10% off my bill. But I'd rather have a good meal than a discount. If you like mediocre food, bad service and "Dirty Deeds Done Dirt Cheap" blasting in your face, then this is the place for you. Otherwise, avoid it if you can.
Omg so damn delicious ... awesome beer and Art our server was perfection! The atmosphere is great and eye candy too.... you have to try it you won't be disappointed!

Good, but not great. Large portions to make up for overpriced menu, but honestly I don't need extra food that I'm not going to eat anyway. 

Best thing on the menu: Mahi Mahi Fish Tacos! These in themselves deserve 4.5 stars (the -.5 because it was served with large serving of salsa, sour cream, and guac when each taco was already topped with pico, lime creme sauce, and an avocado slice. waste of good guac unless you want to bring me out some chips). So so so good.

Most "meh" thing on the menu: Mac & Cheese. I'm a huge mac and cheese fan, and I didn't have any desire to finish this one. Cheese sauce was lacking a cheese flavor. Ham is a good idea, but lets focus on the fundamentals first. 

Service was slow. Very nice people, but 80 minutes for lunch? I get it's busy but come on guys, get us out of there in a reasonable time.

Food is great but service here is terrible (Joseph) just makes excuses and has an attitude for not putting our apps in. Excuse after excuse just make the situation right just handled very poorly won't came back here because of Joseph
Delicious sandwiches! Great fresh juice selections. Convenient location for a quick bite.

I can only review the take-out togo spot centered between the Kitchen and the Bar.

This spot I believe is 24 hours, as I find myself wandering in here to get to my room at 4 AM.  Basic food that will help you get on your way, and isn't fastfoody and greasy.  If you are from Southern California, think of it as an expensive, upscale Corner Bakery.

The items I got here were the turkey and avocado sandwhich (Very good, even at $14) and the breakfast burrito (decent, at $14).

You pay top dollar for being in the lobby of a top-notch Casino/Hotel (Mandalay Bay), so if you're looking for a dollar menu, call a taxi and have them take you off the strip.  Food on the strip will always have twice the price tag.

The only thing more tired than the subway tile and faux shabby hip interior was their attempt to create a line by telling people there was a 20 minute wait when the restaurant was more than half empty. Was it incompetence or flawed marketing? No one will ever know, and perhaps we're better for that fact.

How was the food? I didn't wait to find out. If their front of house management is any indication then the food is inedible and will needlessly take 20 minutes to find your table. Honestly, it's Vegas. There are restaurants everywhere and most of them won't punish you the way Citizens does for attempting to give then your money.

Here's the thing: if the menu says the quesadilla has a three-cheese blend, salsa, sour cream and guacamole, then please ONLY have it come with the three cheese blend, salsa, sour cream and guacamole.  It's frustrating to be served a $16 quesadilla (over $20 with tax and tip) that comes with chipotle aioli slathered inside when it isn't listed.  I ate a whole slice hating it before I realized what it was.  Yuck!  (I guess if you like chipotle aioli, great, but if you don't, please list it on the menu. Chipotle aioli is kind of a big deal to people that don't like it.)  Not worth the money, but the service was sweet and understanding.  They credited me, but it's noted for next time.

AWESOME chips and fish! You get two HUGE pieces of fish and a good size portion of fries! The Mahi Mahi fish tacos are really good too! I was pleasantly surprised with the overall atmosphere and the service. Our server was super friendly and the prices were reasonable. Would recommend for a quick bite at Mandalay Bay!

This review is for the chocolate cake they have at the cafe counter only, I have not eaten anything else there.  But I've come multiple times just to get a piece of this cake!!  It is giant and so moist and delicious, the best cake in town that I've found.  Is it weird that I drive all the way to Mandalay Bay just to get a piece of cake?  Perhaps.

I ate at Citizens almost every day for breakfast during a work event. This place is fantastic and quick in the morning!

Their green tea is easily one of the best I ever had! Coffee is great too but I suggested buying it in the to go line as it is a few dollars less than the sit down menu. My favorite meal was the standard 2 egg, meat, toast and breakfast potatoes. PLENTY of food! All portions are pretty large. One day I had the pancakes with chocolate chips- 3 enormous pancakes!! I couldn't eat more than 1/4 of them. Their berry bowl is large and comes with raspberries and strawberries!

Their to go line moves pretty quickly- I usually would pick up a croissant and some fruit. 

The interior is quaint and beautiful! Very attractive from the outside looking in, the patio was fun to sit on and watch all the patrons go by.

The food was good but a little expensive for breakfast. It is conveniently located inside the casino so we were able to grab breakfast upon our earlier arrival. We were on a time crunch and the service was pretty slow.

Raquel the bartender is awesome!!!!
great food, great service. Great management, Marjorie always has made me feel welcome !!!

We had Gebriel as a server and he was so much fun! Great service, great food. We had the fish and chips, fish tacos, and chicken at his suggestion and all were delicious. Great flavor and good portion sizes given the price.

Food is very tasty here but avoid breakfast items. They tend to be bland.

The late night menu was amazing!!!

The French Dip Steak Sandwich was the best French dip I've ever had!!! It came with Thin Sliced Prime Rib, Caramelized Onions, Provolone, Au Jus, and Crispy Shoestring Fries
The au jus alone was very tasty on its own but i agree that towards the end things got a little too salty. 

I also ordered the potato salad on the side! It was really good as well. It came with red potatoes and dill :)

Ask for Chris. He gives you that genuine feeling that you would expect from this concept. Not only does he give sincere, efficient service, he is happy to do it. MORE SERVERS SHOULD BE LIKE CHRIS. Fine diner my whole life, this guy has got what it takes.

I met up with some friends for lunch at Citizens when at Mandalay Bay for a conference. The first things I noticed were how trendy the restaurant was and how friendly the wait staff was! Our waitress went above and beyond to make sure we had a good experience and genuinely seems to enjoy her job. I ordered a reuben and potato salad, which I definitely enjoyed. The Reuben was particularly good and was large enough quantity for me, even when I was really hungry. Unfortunately I checked in too late to enjoy the free cheesecake, but I'll get it next time lol. The food was priced about the same as the other restaurants in Mandalay, which was not too expensive. Overall, I enjoyed my experience.

Over all good.

Pro:
We took 2 Ultimate Breakfast which comes with, 3 pancakes, 2eggs, sausage and potato, and 3 lemonade.  Slightly Pricy for Breakfast $70, but does have a Good Portion, Tasty and Filling.  


Con:
I also took One Single Order - Over Easy Egg, and was charged $4 for 1 egg.  What???
Do not order additional items, go with an extra regular breakfast item on the menu.

I love Citizens. They have a delicious breakfast and great coffee. For dinner, the meatloaf is so, so good! Great beer choices. I eat here multiple times every time I stay or have an event at Mandalay Bay. A+!

This places wasn't on our agenda, but my fiance and I were hungry so before we got that cranky feeling, we decided to find food FAST! 

There was no wait so we were immediately seated. The waitress was nice at first. She tended to us, answered all our questions, and took our order. It took a long while to get our food, but we didn't want to make a big deal because the Olympian Soccer player, Mia Hamm was sitting right next to us. 

I ordered the Mac and Cheese which the cheese was so runny, it looked like clam chowder. The cheese wasn't orange, but it was white. I also had the Smothered Tator Tots which was good. My fiance had the Tuna Melt and Corn on the Cob, He enjoyed the corn, but said he had better Tuna Melts. 

After we got our food, we noticed the waitress so involved with Mia Hamm and her guest. We finally made eye contact and asked for our bill. When I gave her my credit card, the waitress came back with my reciepts to be signed. I was writing a tip and calculating my total when the waitress came back. She apologized and said she accidentally put Mia Hamm's table on my credit card. She said, since they didn't close the bill, my credit card will not be charged. WRONG! I went on my bank statement that day and I seen two charges for Citizen's. One charge finally dropped off two days later. 

I wouldn't come back again. There food is ridicously over priced for what it is. There are a ton of other great restaurants in Vegas.
Loved their brunch! Crab cake Benedict was awesome. Tried the Lox and Bagels and really enjoyed it! Always have fabulous customer service as well!

Definitely one of the better (and slightly more affordable) restaurants in Mandalay!

I shared the Tarragon Chicken Salad Sandwich (with a side of potato salad) and the Kobe Beef Fries with a friend. The sandwich was really good! It comes on toasted bread which works well with the texture of the chicken salad. It's a good size too. The potato salad was ok, but nothing special. 

The fries were actually really good, but I don't know if they are worth the price. I think you lose some of the kobe flavor when you mix it with chili. Still, really tasty!

Service was really great too. Our waiter was on top of his stuff, and he was straightforward about everything in the menu and his suggestions (which I have grown to appreciate in a waiter).

My friend and I were staying at the Delano and by night three of the trip, we were exhausted from all of our fun. It was around 9pm and we hadn't had dinner so we decided on Citizens because it was close and easy. It was by far the worst meal we had all weekend.

Pros: The service was excellent. Our waitress was really friendly and checked in throughout the meal. The food was brought out quickly. We split a salad and they were nice enough to portion it onto two plates in the kitchen.

Cons: The food was bad and expensive. The mixed greens salad was as described on the menu, lettuce with carrots, cucumbers and tomatoes, but like 95% lettuce. To be fair, it was a very large portion. The dressing could've been better. The Teriyaki Bowl was literally a bowl of brown rice with maybe a half a cup of vegetables on top, for $22. It felt like something a student would make to save money. The nachos were the worst. They were basically inedible, but again, huge portion. How do you mess up nachos?? I think most of it came from using cheese sauce rather than real cheese.

Overall, I was let down by the quality. Our bill came to around $100 for two (2 glasses of wine, 1 salad, 2 mains + tip) We ate next door at Lupo the night before for about the same amount and the food was SO much better. I would suggest going there instead.
If you are craving a Bloody Mary, this is the place to be. Best I have ever had! If you happen to have Lotus as your sever, you are indeed lucky in Vegas!   Great evening.

Food was great. But service not so much. Also when it came time to paying our bill the prices were a few bucks higher on the bill than the prices listed on the menu. Took forever to get checks adjusted and it was honestly a waste of 30 minutes. Don't come here.
French dip and shrimp cocktail were awesome. George Q. Was a great waiter. Ask for him if you get a chance. Coming back for sure!

Server was horrible!! My friend ordered waffle fries with his Classic Burger and received regular fries. When questioned where his waffle fries were, the server explained that they were out. Would have been nice to learn that earlier!

I ordered potato salad with my Baconator Burger. I requested the burger to be cooked medium. The server explained that the Baconator was just like the Classic Burger except with "bacon, bacon, and more bacon." That sounded great to me, which is why I ordered it.

The burger was not at all what I expected. First, the server simply dropped our food off and scurried away quickly. He didn't check in on us until half of our food was gone.

Next, I never received my potato salad. Instead, I received plain fries like my friend did.

Third, the bacon was not thick or piled on like I expected. I received 4 thin slices, that's it!!

Last, my burger was overcooked! I ordered medium and was given a chewy charred burger.

This place has some major improvements to make before I ever go back!

The worst, pizza is great if you are missing all your teeth.  Best thing about this place is that they are open 24 hrs, didn't have any dessert. I wish I did because I'm sure you can mess up Rice Krispies as bad as those "honey mustard wings" they were soggy as hell. Spent 60 dollars on wings, a pizza and a tuna salad sandwich. Over priced and overrated. 3 Stars is too kind. I had to take 5 Imodium to keep from losing my colon once I got back to my room. Should have stopped at Sonic on the way back to the hotel instead. Would have been a better value and a better meal. They're tater tots are gourmet compared to this slop. Blech, don't do this to your stomach after all you only have one!
They stop serving breakfast at 11am. The turkey avocado sandwich was super good. Chili cheese waffle fries not so much.

The food was very good during dinner service in the main restaurant, and the service attendant was very prompt. The Deli area of Citizens was also very nice and convenient. During a few trips to Mandalay Bay at different hours, I would grab a quick sandwich and drink at the Citizens Deli. The deli food quality was high, and the girls working the deli counter were helpful and pleasant. I would recommend giving both the deli and the main restaurant a try.

With so many Las Vegas strip hotels and even (many) more eating establishments to choose from, how did I find myself eating at the counter of this casino deli on a Sunday afternoon watching a women's college softball game?
Don't ask!
But it did have one of the best BLT's I've ever had. Go figure? The service was slow, the place was noisy, my bar stool got bumped twenty times by patrons, buses and waiters but damn what a sandwich. Everything about it was so damn good! Portions, plating, sides (mine was slaw), pickles and peppers - wow everything - great!

If I found myself in that same predicament again I would definitely go back again minus the woman's college softball game.

While at CES 2015 stopped by to grab a quick lunch and ordered the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich and coleslaw. I will say one thing the amount of food you get for the price is decent as my sandwich was HUGE. The chicken was fried well and the buffalo sauce was pretty good. The Blue Cheese was a little strong personal preference wise (I like bleu cheese but not the amount I had on my sandwich). Even given the portion, taste and ambiance of the restaurant the one thing that stood out for me was the price sadly. Even with the amount of food you get, the taste really didn't wow me at all and I left thinking "I paid quite a bit..." Probably won't come back as this place wasn't that memorable for me.

While staying at The Mandalay Bay, we came here twice. And that was for there turkey avocado sandwich!  It was very delicious! Nice thick cut turkey meats. A deli style sandwich on a cranberry wheat bread. Yum. I would rate it 5 stars, but since the sandwich costs $13, I had to remove a star!
Their late night menu is IT!! So good and god sized portions ask for Erick super informative and so helpful! And FAST! Never had to ask for refills and such a great personality

Was at Citizens a couple of nights ago and had a fabulous experience. They primarily serve comfort food and do it extremely well. I had a corned beef Reuben with mashed potatoes. The Reuben was well made and the mashed potatoes were perfect. Neither were particularly special but they were executed perfectly which is exactly what you look for in this type of food.  I sat at the bar and was served by Steven, he was truly a pleasure to talk to. He was helpful about the menu and suggestions and I could tell he really enjoys what he does. He made this experience feel like home!

We ate here a few times during our last visit to the Mandalay property and as always the food was great. Most of the portions are large enough to split, so keep that in mind and ask your server if you are unsure. The sandwiches are tasty, we usually stop in and grab something to go to take to the pool but Thursday after we checked in we decided to eat at the restaurant. Honestly we've had way better service and the waitress had a bit of an attitude but I think she may have been a little overwhelmed with the amount of tables she was waiting on. Plus she had to deal with a few people who purchased food at the take out counter then decided it was ok to sit in the restaurant - I blame the hostess for this, neither seemed to know what they were doing. I can't remember what sandwich we ordered but we asked to split it and we each got our own fries - no split there! We also ordered the mixed green salad and the white balsamic dressing was fantastic. With the sandwich, salad and two drinks I think our bill was a little over $20. We also stopped in for breakfast one morning, the omelet was a disappointment so just skip that all together. No flavor, weird texture, not worth the $$$. My husband ordered the French Toast and that was amazing, it came with an orange flavored whip cream that was light, citrusy and paired well with the French Toast and berries. 

To sum this up:
1. make the walk back from the pool and get take out. trust me you'll be happier with this then ordering food from the pool. 
2. Most items can be split
3. Skip the omelet, order the French Toast

We had a late night craving for dessert during our staycation at the Mandalay Bay & found this place.  They're open 24/7 and serve up American cuisine.  It was very crowded but there was room at the bar & we took advantage of it. The bartender was very professional & fast on top of his game. We decided on the 7 Layer Chocolate cake a/k/a (BIG CAKE) !! It was huge & sinfully delicious- this could result in death by chocolate had I not shared it with my guy   The coffee was fresh brewed & great with the cake!

Great place to fuel up before you hit the clubs !!  

Portions are huge and delicious, FISH & CHIPS BOMB. Steak was lovely and tasty. Food great

Although Mandalay Bay already has a cafe(Raffles), the food here is very similar to Vegas cafes with exception of some specialty entrees. A little bit pricey for cafe food but pretty good quality. 

Came here for dinner on a Saturday night, not too busy and were immediately seated. The server was very friendly, took our order right away and frequently came back to check on our table. There wasn't a long wait for the food to come out as compared to the irritatingly slow food at Raffles.

The Tuna Melt I ordered was superb! I know it's a simple dish, but you can tell a huge difference between the sandwich here and a $5.99 melt somewhere else. The tuna had great quality while the bread and cheese were grilled to perfection. I love the crunchy softness.
My friend ordered the French Dip Steak which was very good as well.

This place is well-worth coming back to if it was comp'd again! haha
But I'd probably just stick to a cheaper cafe or grill if I were craving a sandwich.
Rude, slow, food is bland.  You could get a better meal faster by getting in your car and driving.

Me and my friend came here because Delano would not let us check in due to some issue on their end so we had time to kill and plus we were pretty much starving. This was a good choice and their food is very generously portioned. 

We started with a couple of their signature cocktails. Those were pretty weak and pricey for what you get, not really worth the price and not as delicious as the name and description made them out to be.

For food got the tots and mac n cheese and the french dip. The tots is a huge portion covered in cheese sauce. It was good but I think it could use a little more seasoning. The mac n cheese was flavorful but the crispy topping was bland and didn't add anything to the dish. My french dip was just OK, the saving grace was the dip which was super flavorful and delicious. I was dipping everything from the tots to the sandwich into it. 

We came at off hour so it was not busy and service was quick and prompt. Would come back for a quick bite next time we are at Mandalay.

Food was typical for restaurant in hotel chain.  Our service experience wasn't up to par with the experience we have had so far in vegas.  Our guy was jason. He was just regular. He seemed a bit rushed and doesnt even put on a smile .  Place wasnt that busy and didnt stay on top of filling up the water.

I love this place because it open late.  The food is not good though.  It's just enough when you're drunk to make you est but sober you would think twice.  The pretzel bites are fried for some reason.  The chips and salsa tastes store bought.  The quesadilla wasn't even satisfying.  If you need a quick bite it's great but dont expect to sit there and think "man I want to come back here tomorrow!"
Delicious breakfast.  We split the ultimate- tons of food and the hash browns were the best I have ever had.  Waitress was the nicest and best we have had in Vegas.  Definitely will come back.

Great place to grab breakfast and possibly lunch.  It is very casual so if you are rolling out of bed after a night of partying hard in Vegas this is your place.

I have to say if you like dark coffee you will love Citizens.  I do not like a dark brew but when you need coffee anything will do.

I like their yogurt parfaits and their bacon (maple) for a quick breakfast.  Hubby devoured their pancakes so they must have been yummy.  

The decor kind of reminds me of a diner with a more upscale feel (subway tile and wine bottles).  There is a dinner menu but to me there are so many other places in Mandalay to eat that this is not where I would choose to go.

Do not eat here. An order of nachos, you know chips, liquid cheese, olives black beans and cilantro takes 45 minutes to prepare. And when you stand at the counter looking for answers. "The kitchen was backed up." 
I could count the number customers on one hand!
Eat at your one risk!

Me and my family are here in Las Vegas for the SuperZoo convention and decided to stop and grab some lunch here at the Citizens Kitchen & Bar. That was a bad decision. It all started out alright, service was okay, server was nice enough. We came in and we're almost the only ones there.. As we sat they got busier and busier and that's when our service got worse and worse. Our food came and it was very bland, drinks very dry, and the service getting worse and worse. We would get the occasional how is everything, how are you guys doing followed by a dash off, not even to stop and hear the response to his question. My brother ordered a drink, to which he got a response that they don't have that drink, this was not the case. The actual waiter didn't know that they even had this drink on the menu.. Very disappointing service, very bland and tasteless food.. Definitely wouldn't recommend it if your here in Las Vegas..

Great food at a great price. Atmosphere is excellent with a great vibe. I'm at Mandalay Bay weekly and I get my latte here every time. Beer selection is great, and juice menu impressive. I'd give it 5 stars if the lady working at the register didn't have a melt down over a receipt not printing and swear up a storm in front of my toddler. Was pretty unbelievable.

I always come here when I am loaded since anything taste good when you are loaded. I order the same damn item, the Chicken Club Sandwich and Seasoned Fries. It's on point. If you are staying at Mandalay Bay or Delano, this would be your only late night spot to grub at. Unless you want diarehea cause you can run your fat ass across the street for Panda Express or Mc Donald's.

Room service always takes over an hour and it's overpriced. Believe it or not, the food from here and room service is the SAME S%$#. Service is pretty awsome considering the waiters always deal with annoying people that can't even sit up. 

They have what most American type eaterys offer, you know....Burger and Sandwiches. You can also pick up something togo quicly since there are pre made sandwiches located at the togo counter, duh. You will also fine a varity of random sweets and yogurts. 

You have the option of sitting outdoor or indoor. I prefer outdoor cause I like to make fun of others while eating. It is very entertaining actually, it's similar to that of a zoo.
Good restaurant with a great selection of items. Menu has items that are good at any time of the day, and they're also open late.

Editing review: my waiter comped my meal so I'm revising to 2 stars. 

I've eaten here before and am very disappointed with my breakfast experience. 

I ordered the Ultimate breakfast because I wanted pancakes badly and all the other breakfast staples. 

I sent the eggs back twice. I ordered over medium and both times they were less cooked than over easy. 

The breakfast potatoes were soggy when they should've been crisp. Definitely taken out of a warming tray. 

The pancakes which was the whole reason we came here were tough! I couldn't cut thru them with a fork and i had to stop eating after 1 bite because chewing the hard shell was too much for me. 

Coffee was only refilled once. For a breakfast that costs $30, I expect it to be fresh. And I got something less than that. 

I finally settled on eating the soggy potatoes after he took my eggs away. I gave the pancakes away to my fiancé. His omelet was bland at best.

Stopped by here because we needed a quick bite to eat before the Michael Jackson One show.  Thought it would be faster if we went to the bar. Took a while for the bartender to show up, but once she did service was fine. We had the chili cheese kobe beef fries, which hit the spot. Decent place to watch sports as well.

First off I don't understand why this place only has 3 stars, we really enjoyed it. Hubby and I came here for the hangover brunch on Sunday after an epic Vegas night. I had the chicken chilaquiles, super cheesy and a little spicy. The highlight for me was the most perfect Bloody Mary, they have the option of bottomless Bloody Marys but you have to hook them up yourself, I opted to have the bartender make mine and it was delish. My husband had the bacon burger and he loved it. The service was on point, everyone was asking how we were doing not just our server. Seriously loved this place!!

Ehhh....it was ok.  We had the eggs benedict and bacon and eggs for breakfast.  Service was pretty good.  The only thing was that the caramel macchiato was waaaay too sweet and the tatertot hash was a bit salty.  I would still go back and give it another try.

Update: Came back again...they were much busier and totally unprepared for the rush. It took 10 mins to get my coffee, 20 mins to get the first plate of food, and another 10 to get my breakfast.  I asked to speak to the manager and he took care of us. Our server tried her best as well.  Oh and the tatertot hash was much better today.

AMAZING! We stay at Mandela bay and Delano quite frequently and this is our go to breakfast, lunch and late night food spot! The Nachos, potato skins and frisco burger are some of our menu favorites.. great food for a good price! Your not going to pay "Vegas" prices here! Ejay is the best bartender and makes you feel like friend as soon as you sit down. Totally recommend CITIZENS!!

I'm a bit saddened to be writing this review and scoring Citizens a 2. We've been coming to Citizens now for quite some time. We visit Vegas about 3-4 times per year, most times staying at Delano. We've sometimes had breakfast, lunch, and dinner here in a single day just because we know we could always get a super solid meal no matter the time of day or night, even late late night since it's 24 hours. A few weekends ago we were here and were so incredibly disappointed with the Ruben. It tasted like minced meat. Like as if we got the last of the. corned beef shavings. The fries were tasteless and cold. Last weekend when we were here in Vegas, we passed. We are back again this weekend and thought we'd give it a go HOPING it was a "one-off" a few weeks ago. Nope. We were sadly disappointed.  Tonight we had a tuna melt and fries along with chicken noodle soup. The sandwich was decent. The chicken noodle soup is $11! Yep. It's a lot right? But in the past...SO worth the $11!! Tonight I just couldn't do it. I couldn't eat it. I suggested to our server that I was given some sort of beef broth type soup. She insisted it was chicken noodle. There's NO way what was served was chicken and chicken noodle soup at that. She said it was dark meat. If it was it had a beefy taste and the broth tasted like beef and the broth was brown. I couldn't pay $11 to not eat it. 

I guess we'll have to find a new fave. We're super sad about it. It's just too expensive for it not to be good. 

So why a 1 star rating? Decent size portions - but only matters if the food is good. Nice atmosphere. Can hear the live music from the bar. And hubs does love the $25 Bloody Mary.

This place is awesome! The juice bar is my favorite thing. I had the South Beach. I also had the turkey burger which was very yummy. My friend had the fish tacos. 
Went back for the Cobb salad for dinner. This is a must try.

Went here with few of the Santana band members after their Santana show over a month ago and we all ordered chicken noodle soup, I have to say it was really good and I think its the best chicken noodle soup I have had in a long time.  Our waiter was very attentive to our needs  as well.

Great for breafast, always a seat open at the bar with sports on for a quick bite. Its not too pricey and is easy to get in and out with some food and drinks. 

Service: Our bartender/waitress was awesome, the food took awhile though...
Love the bartender Steven! The Blt and French onion soup are amazing and so are the drinks!! Love the atmosphere too!!

Considering everywhere is disgustingly overpriced for mediocre food, this place was ok. I'm comparing it to a few other places that were very disappointing like cafe bellagio, and some gross cafe at the paris. 
We grabbed a fairly quick bite here before seeing santana down the hall. We were seated quickly but our server was busy and opportunistic thinking her tip from the larger groups was going to be better so we were overlooked often. We had to request multiple times for things like, another plate, silverware,  refills were really hard to come by. Service was a 2-3 star experience. 
I got the fish and chips and compared to my other meals this one was enjoyable and a ridiculously huge portion.

This is one of the better burgers I have had in recent memory!  Citizen's is located in the restaurant area near Mandalay Bay and is open all day.  They have a pretty extensive menu, but I came here famished and looking to try their burger.  It was pretty expensive at $18, but for Vegas I realize that is completely in line with other places.
The burger itself was wonderful.  The meat was flavorful and juicy with just the right amount of spice to it.   I am not sure if they add peppers or something but it had a nice kick.  The bun was soft and pillowy - the perfect complement to the rich burger.  I usually take off the wilted lettuce and unripe tomato, but both were fresh and delicious here!  The ketchup even tasted homemade!  I really enjoyed the fries and left the restaurant a happy camper!
This is a great bet if you crave top notch burger or are looking for a more casual meal on The Strip.

O.M.G. Everything was well seasoned, fresh and high quality! Pastrami sandwich on rye dayum! Fries delicious and Cesar salad was so fresh! I want to come back here so I can try everything on the menu. Menu is not large, which is smart of them because the food they offer is on point! Hands down best pastrami I've ever had, bread was perfect, no fat on the meat, even their spicy brown mustard was bomb. This place is a must try!

Food was good 4 stars, the hostess Dana was a witch and needed an attitude adjustment. When a customer asks for a booth and you have one open sit them there even if your server is being double sat. Don't give them crap for their request. They are your CUSTOMER. They make your job possible like my clients make my job possible.

Just want to say I had a great experience at this place. Sat at bar and was very busy. Got my drink and food fast. Bartender Raquel was super friendly and very professional. I would recommend this place to my friends and family and will definitely be back.

I needed decadent sweets for some of my clients and went to Citizens at Mandalay Bay and LOVED our server Shania who was professional, helpful and friendly when I ordered dessert after dessert that she carefully packed for me with skill and love. Oh, the dessert is so beautiful and there are so many choices! I needed a very large order and we were in and out very quickly thanks to Shania. My husband and I were so impressed that we asked for the Manager and met JP who came around the corner impeccably dressed and professional and he greeted me and my husband with a huge and engaging smile. What a charismatic man/manger. My husband and I were restaurant managers and oftentimes we find managers lacking in customer service - JP is so much better than 5 stars and he should be commended! How you care for customers and staff trickles down and Shania is a fine example of his excellent skill with managing a team who made us feel like part of the Citizen family! Management please give JP a raise and promote Shania.
We will be back!
Best French Dip I have ever had! Sit at the bar if you can, Steve the bartender will make your experience 10x!

Worst service ever!! I we ordered and decided to eat there. The waitress came over and told us we couldn't eat there that we had to move yet we had just paid there for food. Extremely upsetting I'll never be back'
Service was really slow and disinterested. My medium poached eggs came out hard as a rock. We had much better breakfasts at Bellagio and Wynn. Not a fan.

As someone who is super hungry and all the restaurants are closed, I'm super happy that this place is open 24 hours. Plus, they got the most delicious and decked out Bloody Mary called the Ultimate Mary.

Unfortunately, their computers are down and we've been waiting 30 minutes for our food. My date looks like he's about to kill someone out of hangriness. The food is delicious but the wait delayed our long drive back home to SoCal.
Quick service and the food was delicious. Had a huge breakfast and didn't have to break the bank to pay for it!

My husband and I went here to grab a late dinner after a concert. First the good... the mahi mahi fish tacos were amazing! The bad, which FAR outweighed the good... we went at 11pm and about two-thousand people were waiting directly in front to get into the club. Basically we just sat and ate while trying to avoid seeing women wearing dresses so short we could literally see butt cheeks! Also, the club is SO LOUD that we couldn't even talk during our meal. This place is probably great during the day when the area isn't full of BOOMING music and people trying too hard to look umm... not sure how to be P.C here. I'd be willing to go here again but only before the sun goes down!

I went to see For the Record: Baz before it leaves Mandalay Bay and I decided to try Citizens for something different.  I was rather pleased with my meal and service there.

My server, Tony, answered some questions I had about the menu and he told me about some specials.  I ordered a small Caesar salad for a starter.  For the main, he recommended the fish tacos and I went with that.  For dessert, I again took his recommendation and ordered the carrot cake.  It was good following his advice!

The Cesar salad was a normal one, nothing special.  They could have left the hard piece of bread with baked cheese on it.  The bread was indeed hard and there was no cheese flavor.  It looked better than it tasted.

I have only gotten fish tacos once before so this was almost a new entrée for me.  The tacos were filled to the brim.  The mahi mahi was tasty, there was some slaw, and each taco had a slice of avocado along with some chipotle aioli.  There were three side containers of sour cream, guacamole, and pico.  The tacos were juicy and messy eating, but worth it.  

The carrot cake was a gigantic slice of goodness.  It was rich cake with a good cream cheese icing and nuts sprinkled liberally on the icing.

You are paying Strip prices for tacos you could get from a street vendor for much less.  The restaurant was almost empty and the quiet was enjoyable.  Tony was a great server and I'm glad I gave Citizens a try.

$42 for a small take out lunch for two of two caprese sandwiches, a kale salad, and a water. They were out of the ingredients for the PB&j for the entire week of our stay, and the caprese took 10+ min to make because they had to "go downstairs to get the mozzarella." What? Why do you not have the ingredients on hand to make take out items? Food was mediocre too. Huge disappointment after getting excited about the menu. :(

Food was good. My wife ordered potato salad with her sandwich and got French fries ... We ordered the potato skin appetizer which came out well after we already received our main dishes. They were over cooked and dry. The chicken club sandwich was good... When we were ready, the waiter took forever to bring us our check... About 20 minutes we waited just to get out of there. Not bad food but not the best service.

The best option late at night in the Mandalay / Delano when room service has a 2 hr wait. It's not too much effort to come down here. Nachos were excellent, quesadilla was pretty good with lots of fresh guacamole, pizza not great. But if you need pizza then come here and just order it. Baked goods also looked delicious. 

Nothing on the day menu appealed to me - would not be interested in normal sober dining here.

We stopped in after seeing the Michael Jackson ONE show and everything was fantastic. The server was very attentive and the food off the charts good. I had a chicken Caesar salad and it was the best I've ever eaten. With a slight citrus spin, the salad was amazing.

Great experience at Citizens today, with I believe the best Bloody Mary I've ever had!

It was bodacious in volume and adorned with many accoutrements including a split crab leg, shrimp, cherry pepper, pearl onion, olive, celery, and a big honkin piece of beef jerky.  Great, great, great.

The pico served with the chips was very fresh and bright, and the kids had the disco fries.  I tried one and they were super 'potatoy' and tasty.

Nice work.

Super nice waiter, who actually cared and was not rushy like most people are in Vegas. He was really sweet and kept checking on us to see how we were doing. I had the meatball which was to die for, topped off with rich ricotta and hit the spot at 3am ! Delish ! I also had a few bites of the french dip and it was a tad soggy but packed with flavor. Again, I don't understand why these resorts only stock Pepsi so that would have definitley put the icing on the cake!
food was fantastic.  try the turkey sandwich! and oooooh, the mahi-mahi tacos!!!!

My wife, kids and I, all locals, ate here before the shark encounter last Saturday.  My wife had the quinoa salad with a Firestone beer, I had the lobster roll with Lagunitas ale.  The kids had a cheese quesadilla and grilled cheese.  Our sides were the coleslaw.

Every thing was really good; not a morsel left.  The service was really good too; the waitress recommended the beers and did a good job with her recommendations.  I would make a point to have lunch here again.

I would recommend reconsidering all the tile though; it is loud in this restaurant.

Unless you really have to eat (no other restaurant exist on earth), do your body and wallet a favor and avoid this place. It easily goes down as one of the worst restaurant on earth. 

A $35 steak ? Looks like they cook it in microwave, and it came with plastic utensil. You have to push, then they give you real utensil. $20 salad is probably as good as the $2 one at AmPm 

Customer service ? Just as good as the food ...
Everything was old not fresh sitting in the hot trays on the line! Very gross overpriced!
Even a hungry drunk person couldn't save this place. Seriously I am hungry and I am drunk but this place blows. I hate wasting food but I really don't want to take this burger home.

A good place for breakfast. I came here a few times during my stay at the Luxor and the food here is pretty good for a reasonable price. They have a decent selection of breakfast items if you dine in such as omelets, oatmeal, pancakes, and waffles. Or if you choose to take out they have quick sandwiches/ wraps. 

My first day here I got a kale salad to go. For $10 I got a huge salad that was enough for two meals. The kale was fresh and the pecans/ cranberries were good as well. The sweet citrus dressing a bit heavy.

The next day we dined in and I ordered the bodybuilder omelet (grilled chicken/veggie) made with egg whites. The omelet was a decent size and it came with a small serving of home fries. I also ordered the steel cut oats served with fresh fruit and brown sugar. Overall the meal was average and it's what you expect for breakfast.

If you're in Vegas and looking for a healthy non Buffett or crazy fancy this is the place. I'd go here over a lot of places in Vegas. It's fresh and the atmosphere is great. Their fresh juices are AMAZING

Sadly I used to love this place and I used to tell people about it all the time... sad that because "it's convention week" they aren't offering employees a discount at this time. Way to take care of other people who work there too. Sad bc their food was good but sadly they stopped caring about other people who work in Mandalay Bay as well.. it's ok there's plenty of other places I get amazing service! I'll send my business to them! And they didn't answer the phone when I tried to call in my order... and when I asked about why they don't answer I got the response of oh there must've been someone placing an order in the back because then it doesn't ring to ours. Cool I tried 3 different times and no answer at all. Absolutely sucks.
I was in love with this place. We ate here 3 times in our Vegas weekend and loved everything we tried. The bacon burger was my favorite. I will go back when I go back to Vegas.

Super expensive but the food wasn't bad. The French dip was surprisingly not terrible, but the expectations at 2 am are tempered by the choices available. The bacon and eggs were fine and the potatoes were pretty food. No butter or jam for the toast which was disappointing but the bread was nice and thick.

Decent food, casual. VERY noisy. I had the Teriyaki bowl with brown rice and chicken. It was good.  Like most teriyaki sauce it was a but sweet for my preference but luckily there wasn't a ton on it. The chicken comes on a wooden skewer, fire grilled so it has lots of delicious flavor. 

Had a side mixed green salad to start, which was nice and fresh. Tell them easy on the dressing tho. Otherwise the dressing overpowers the salad. 

The bar seating is fine if you are in a hurry.

Overpriced and mediocre- only went because I was staying at Mandalay Bay. 
3 stars for the amazing drink I had!! On the Beach 
I had fish and chips the batter was so thick that it was still raw under the top fried layer. It was huge though! 
I was pleasantly surprised by the free cheesecake with my yelp check in! It was delicious and covered with warm cherries!!!

YUM! my first time trying this place out! my colleague and i had a long day of working at the trade show and didn't have anything to eat except for mini appetizers and lots of drinks. we ended up eating here at 9:30/10PM. 

we were seated right away even though they were really busy. we sat on the outside of the restaurant. I kind of wish we sat somewhere quiet because we were shouting at each other when were were talking. 

i got the mahi mahi fish tacos. and i highly recommend that! it comes with 3 crunchy tacos. sauce was good. 

service was great. our water and wine glass was always filled. 

i like how we can charge the bill to our rooms!

The food was okay. The service was slow, definitely do not go if you are in a hurry. For the prices and the lack of speed I was expecting something a little bit better. The food did it's job though. The restaurant is cute and we had a good time.

This is for the bakery section only, although Citizen offers meals as well. 

The Raspberry shortbread was really, really good. Buttery, thick, shale-like layers with a generous amount of raspberry filling and crumbles on top. The banana chip muffin was okay, but the chips were interesting in that they melted at the slightest touch. If I blew on it, three chips disinegrated immediately! 

When I asked for the banana chip muffin, they accidentally gave me banana bread, and when I went back to the counter to exchange it, they told me to keep it so I gave it to my homie who said it was the best thing of the 5 things we got. 

With so many other bakery options on the Strip, I wouldn't make a special trip here, but it was nice that they had counter seating available for snackers like us :)

I'm writing the review even before receiving the food. I gave 2 stars just bcz I didn't taste the food yet. It would be 1 star. Their service sucks. I mean the host and server.  R they kidding me? I sat before 2 other parties. They sit 3 different parties right next to each other.  I got seated first. Waited fxxxing 10 mins while looking at other parties are getting service. Which restaurant serves the people who got seated last. 

Furthermore!!
This server took my drink to refill and forgot about it and never came back.  Wow.. unbelievable.

Best place to be after an all night drink fest!  My boyfriend & I shared the patty melt. It was by far the best patty melt I have EVER tasted (and I wasn't drunk)!! I'm still thinking about it 2 days later.  
As far as service goes, we didn't have a problem whatsoever.  The hostess and waiter were on it during our late night visit.    
In closing, I say GET THE PATTY MELT!
Really an exceptional spot, great food, awesome service. Chris Stanford really hooked us up. Looking forward to come back again.

Came here with my husband. I ordered the appetizer articoke spinach dip. The spaghetti Bolognese was way too spicy I had to return it. Since it was passed 10pm their menu reduced to small options of what to get. I chose the lasagna it was ok. My husband ordered mash potatoes and gravy and the half chicken.

Stopped in on a Sunday at 11pm 

Had the spinach artichoke, cheese quesadilla and chili fries.

Nice dime place and reasonable pricing

Elevated comfort food like a rueben, grilled cheese, burger, etc. Great service. Had the Cesar salad and chicken noodle soup. The salad was a great size and the small soup went perfectly together. All of the soup ingredients were the exactly same size so you got all the groceries in each bite.  Felt great to eat after a long weekend of indulgence. Fantastic people watching if you sit on the patio. Will return with friends.

Ate here every am for breakfast for 5 days- awesome breakfast.  After first meal my hubby and I shared all others cause much food- hot- Delish and great service most days.  Bar is best!  Decent drinks but save $ for pool drinks.  Can't wait to come back!
The French dip was really good. Staff was pretty friendly until we had to ask for something they forgot to bring and then they didn't show up as much.

Okay, so it's midnight, you just got out of the Michael Jackson One show, you are hungry and don't want to drive and lose all that money you spent at the Mandalay Bay Valet Parking. Your selections are slim for food. Alcoholic beverage are what most places offer at this time with alcohol snacks. But wait, the Citizens Kitchen and Bar is open. 

There are two parts to this restaurant. There is a "to go" side where you sit on bar stools to wait for your order and there is a "sit in" restaurant side, which is what my wife and I picked. 

Our waitress Lotus was very friendly and and checked up on us frequently despite being very busy. Although, it was a sit in type of restaurant, the menu was very slim. It was basically a card, no bigger than a greeting card with less 10 options. All sandwiches, hand burgers and breakfast burritos. 

My wife ordered the breakfast burritos which came with nacho chips. The chips arrived warm, hinting they were freshly made. The burrito was filling for my starving wife and she could only eat half of it. I ordered the egg and ham croissant. It was good. But it arrived warm cold at best like it was sitting for about 15-20 minutes. The potatoes squares that it came with was cold. It was sitting for at least 30 minutes are more. I couldn't even finish it. 

They were pretty busy at the time, I'll give them that. But, it also got them a 3 Star at best. Would I try them again, probably not anytime soon.
Omelet and egg burrito were good.  But service was poor.    Found server not to happy to be working.   Simple request became issue.   Ashamed since food was good

Yelpers have rated Citizens at 3 out of 5 stars.  When that's the aggregate rating out of hundreds of reviews, for me personally I begin to think the establishment might be shitty.   Especially when there is a sprinkling of reviews that are at 1 star with all kinds of jacked up things being written.  "3" may be "A-OK" according to Yelp, to me it means the place is questionable.  

So if you don't want to fuck around with Citizens and risk disappointment, here's my advice:  Go to the the takeout counter and order either the Reuben or else the turkey avocado sandwich.  Simple as that.    

These sandwiches are so good.   The ingredients, the breads, the thinly-sliced soft and moist deli meat... Adds up to an amazing sandwich that I go out of my way for.   Trust me.   

Yes, these sandwiches are expensive.   Around $15 for one sandwich to give you some idea.    But damn worth it, and I keep going back for it.  For the times I drive in to Vegas from So Cal, I typically order extra sandwiches to go as a snack later on.   

But if the price still seems completely outrageous to you, I won't fault you.  Just do it if you're comfortable.   However, to put it in perspective, what did cost you to get a bottle of Grey Goose last night at Hakkasan?   Or even one cocktail at Light... How much did that cost?  How much money did you put out in the casino?   What did you spend on the stripper with your buddies?

Exactly.      So shut the hell up and get one of the best sandwiches you'll ever eat!!!

Came here on business and prioritize exceptional customer service in my daily life. I went to The Citizen 3 times for sit down service (twice for breakfast and once for lunch) as well as twice for take out. Yes their food is excellent but Robert was our server the three times we had meals. He made the entire experience here absolutely wonderful. He took my daughters special diet needs seriously and had an impressive memory for details. He was a pleasure to watch his interactions with other guests and  is truly authentic in his demeanor. He is a true gem and will ensure every detail is exceeded. I hope he gets to read this and knows how appreciated he is and that what he does each day very much matters. Those who value that personal touch with excellent food should request him. Thank you Robert!!!!!!

So this is my first time coming here. We waited extremely long for our food to arrive I ordered chiliquiles with over easy eggs. The eggs were definitely not over easy. I expressed concerns about the wait time to the manager on duty Amanda who instead of apologizing for the wait said the ticket was dinner in 20 minutes. It might have been printed in 20 minutes but that's not when I ordered my meal. My daughter's volleyball team was seated next to ours and they ordered and finished eating their meals and or food had not come out. I can appreciate a place being busy. What I can't appreciate is the look that this manager gave me when I told her the eggs were not over easy. She wasn't too concerned about improving my experience. The pancakes were very blonde looking and tasted like rubber. There are many other places to eat in Vegas go head over there. I should have went to Hash House. Lesson learned. I wish this place was better.

Very expensive, as Las Vegas is no longer inexpensive in the food department; however the service was great, with a smile and quick. Rachael, my server was pleasant and even though she was really busy - she served with a smile

A great find in the Mandalay hotel. Had the chicken club and it was a great hearty sandwich. Our waiter was Robert and was very professional and attentive. The Manager Marjorie came over to introduce herself to make sure everything was fine. It was a nice touch.

I was just in Vegas for a convention and after a long day on my feet I decided to grab a quick bite and head back to rest my body. On the way to my room at Luxor I stopped by at Citizens. 

We sat down right away and the waiter greeted us and got us drinks. He came back a few times but we weren't ready yet, but I appreciate that kind of service. When we did order I got the half chicken over mashed potatoes. The chicken was pretty good and moist and it came with a generous helping of potatoes and also a ginormous head of broccoli which was good. On top of that I ordered a side of brown rice to fill me up because eat larabars all day couldn't fill me up. The food itself was a 3.5-4 not knock your socks off but not terrible. What pulled this down to a 3 was the amount of time the food took to come out considering the place was relatively empty when we were there. I think the chef forgot our order. They actually sent out a Caesar salad to apologize so that was a nice gesture, would rather have had them discount the meal given I'm not eating the creamy dressings on salads anymore. 

Hey if you need a quicker meal, you don't want to pay $80 for a salad and Le Fluer then give Citizens a shot, I'm sure the food order being overlooked isn't common and I'd change he review in the future if so.

I've been here before on another trip to Vegas, and enjoyed the food, this trip I have mixed reviews....The first day we stopped in for lunch, I ordered a chicken Caesar a box of cut fruit, and a sandwich to share - the fruit came to me molded, and when I asked for a new one, she gladly gave it to me, but put the old one back in the case!  A bottle of water was $5 - bringing our small-ish lunch to share to $40.  We thought we'd give it another try the following day, it was better - the food may have been restocked overnight, not sure, but sandwich was great, fruit was fresher, water was still $5 - and total was $43 again, but better experience over all.  Ate out on the patio outside, not served, may be a different experience - overall great when on the go in Vegas, just a little pricey for a sandwich and salad.

PRO: open 24/7, cool ambiance

CON: food isn't great, very slow service

if you're looking for a quick late night bite be prepared to sit and wait around for your food. we waited for over an hour and it was pretty tasteless.

My entree was great! I ordered the brick chicken which came with mashed potatoes, gravy and broccoli. YUM. My boyfriend ordered the teriyaki bowl which wasn't very tasty compared to mine-pretty bland. 

It is a bit expensive here, however, they have a prix fixe for $29 that includes a three course meal before 7:00pm. We did not do this because adding a salad and dessert isn't our thing but if you like a multi course meal this would be great for you.

The overall ambiance of this restaurant is very "kitchenette modern" looking. A lot of old school black and white decor and vintage addings. The dress code is business casual, however, in Vegas anything goes. 

Out of all the restaurants in Mandalay bay this one has the most to offer.
Food was just okay and no one was very happy.  When the waiter talked to us it seemed forced/fake. I would not go back.

Are you kidding me? I asked for a Pinot griego, the waitress said they don't have that yet. I see several bottles on the shelf. I wanted to say, I'll help my self. Never mind! Ordered a French dip and onion ring, it was not any better than Arby's. But four times the price. Could not chew the sandwich
Terrible service! Slow like a turtle! Very frustrating. I think the servers needs more training and efficiency.

My wife and I just enjoyed a delicious prime rib dinner, the meat, broccoli and baked potato were cooked to perfection. We enjoyed a wonderful glass of Pinot Noir and the service was excellent. Nice casual atmosphere. Most enjoyable. We'll definitely be back!

Got a burger to go, medium rare.  One of the worst overpriced burgers I've ever had.  Dry, no flavor, soggy bread.  Soggy fries.  1 star.  Only thing they got going is that they are open 24 hours.  Avoid!

I have stopped here several times every time I stay here at the Mandalay.  Service is awesome and food is yummy!  I ordered the Ruben sandwich per our waiter's choice.....it was delicious!  Until next time!
Food was ok.  Just your generic restaurant.  Feels like an upscale version of Applebee's. Save your money.  Service was friendly
Solid for breakfast.  Basic but well executed menu.  Eggs Benedict with eggs done perfectly, but bland sauce.  Pancakes fluffy and cooked right.  Pricey for breakfast, but hey . . . it's Vegas.

We just had a very nice dinner with two salads and one dessert at citizens! Although all food was good, I have to highlight the Quinoa salad- it was THE BEST!  The service also was excellent. Kevin knows how to make guests feel welcome!! Thank you :)

Giving it two stars because the food is good. The service is terrible. 
Staying at Hotel been here twice already. Same problems both times. 
Stood there while three different employees walked past without acknowledgment. Had to flag someone down to get a seat. Coffee delivered without a spoon. Stir with a fork is not the best option. Food delivered. Asked for tobasco and watched the guy walk to the back and just start doing something else. Literally forgot to get it for me in seconds.
General uncaring atmosphere.

I should have known better, when a colleague had told me the day prior that he had ordered the worst tuna melt ever from this place.  BUT, it was late and I needed a snack and this was open.

At the late hour, they have a limited menu. Asked the clerk what was best on the menu. She recommended the French Dip. She warned me it could take a while. I agreed.

Food came out faster than expected (10 minutes). French Dip with au jus and fries. Fries were no good. Ate 2. As for the sandwich, bread was too hard. I ended up picking out the meat with a fork.

Disappointing late night snack and pricey too boot.

Best fish and chips we've ever had! Glen, our waiter and Steven, the bartender, were fantastic. They made our evening!! 
Nice to have a 24 hour restaurant available in Vegas. We will be back!

3 stars for the food and fast service. But I'm pretty sure my friends and I got the Norwalk virus here. Minus at least one star for that! So that kinda was not fun for the rest of the weekend. The tot mash was great. But then we had lunch there and I watched a buser pick something out of our calamari bowl. Anyhow... Wish I could have given this more stars! But 3/4 of our group left with acute gastroenteritis. At least we didn't gain weight in Vegas!
Average food at best, slow service and overpriced. Ate there twice due to the location and an invite from a friend..........if not for the location, this place would be out of business.
Our rodeo girls group and me sitting here now having breakfast of variety. All excellent and same service. Did not take long to get either, with the busy crowd.
Perfect for a sit down meal or grab and go! You can't beat the location smack dab in the middle Mandalay Bay!

Ate at bar. Bartender / server Raquel could care less.  No sense of hospitality. No greeting. No eye contact. Not that busy. Not even basic Waffle House service. As a local our visitors deserve much better and there are people here who need jobs and could easily make a better impression. Who trained and supervises the staff here?
** UPDATE 2/10/14 **
Within a few days both the bartender and GM wrote to me directly with their sincere apologies and regrets for this lapse in service. While you would expect this of the GM, for the bartender to do this independently is a very stand up thing to do.  Both showed integrity and pride in their work in doing so.  I'm a local and will go back on my own (no comps) in the near future and see if this was an isolated incident or not.
Eggs Benedict and cappuccino! Best start to a day in Vegas. Staff is wonderful and accommodating. Amazingly quick but delicious!!

The food was great, the service was great, and the prices were not bad. The place can get a little noisy and the tables are close together. 
So we choose to sit at the bar. Great idea...Loved our bartender. She made us really yummy Bloody mary's with infused in house Jalapeño vodka and she was very attentive even though she was super busy making drinks for the tables. 

I did realized menu is more comfort food than anything but we were craving salads so we both opted for two of the salads and we both shared. 

1. Kale and brown rice salad with grilled chicken
2. Quinoa vegetable Salad with grilled Salmon

Yummy....Huge portion, tasty and fresh. I was fully satisfied with our selections. 

It's open 24 hours!! It's pretty awesome when your in Vegas knowing you'll be up all night and hungry at any time.
You can either sit and be served or order and pick up...but if you order and pick up, you must eat out on the patio of the restaurant.

Your better off ordering room service. Waitress seemed annoyed and didn't want to be working. The late night menu was limited and we decided to order nachos without chicken, hamburger and side order of French fries. We waited almost 45 minutes for our food and never saw our waitress again. 

Nachos: chips were too hard and stale, they added chicken we didn't want and not enough cheese!!! 

Hamburger with fries: room temperature burger and fries were hot...go figure. 

A different waiter, Chris, approached our table to let us know that our previous waitress had an emergency and he would be taking care of us. Much more attentive and quick. 

Not returning. Mandalay needs to get a better late night cafe/restaurant or have more options.

Had breakfast here.  Decided not to do a buffet and come into this restaurant in Mandalay Bay.  It was relaxing and food was excellent.  Crab Cake Benedict was excellent.  Breakfast Burrito was good, but I didn't like french fries inside burrito and it was not that flavorful.  This place isn't cheap but it was good.  Service was good.  No lines to get in when buffet restaurant had a wait.
Big Bloody Mary looks great, tastes ok.  Crab was NASTY in bloodyMary.  Fruit not good,choose else where if you can

We went for breakfast just about everyday we were in Mandalay Bay.

My husband really loved the crab cake eggs Benedict. The French toast dish & Belgian Waffles were also thoroughly enjoyed by family members.

Our breakfast experience with Citizens was that it was a  solid way to start our vacation days.
Slow as molasses in an igloo. A line of ten deep took 25 minutes to go through. Also severely overpriced. $25 for a pre-made panini, two croissants and a bottle of water ($5!) yikes.

This past weekend we were in Vegas and stayed at Mandalay Bay.  We stopped at Citizens late on Friday night as we needed just a bit of food to get us through till breakfast.  I ordered the grilled cheese - which looked awesome - but in reality, it was awful.  It tasted bad from the get go and had me throwing up later that night.  $11 for a grilled cheese that will make you sick?  Ya, I think not.

Sunday morning on our way out, my girlfriends stopped there to grab a quick bite and it pretty much ended in the same result.  NO one liked the food. Service was meh...Definitely don't think we will be going back there.
