I made a bad choice coming here for breakfast/brunch.  My husband and I didn't want to drive out and we should have!  I ordered the biscuit with sausage gravy-- eggs where rubbery when they were supposed to be poached! Waffle was bland and the breakfast burrito was okay.  Even my son's kid's meal did not taste good.  We could went to Hash House or somewhere else for almost $90 bucks!!!! Lesson learned

Had the Creme Brûlée French Toast.  It was ok but not the best I've ever had.  It was tough and dry like it had been sitting for a while.  We had a table on the patio outside so the people watching was great!! The wait staff was a little slow, had to wait on refills for our coffee, which was annoying since they weren't very busy.  Convenient location when staying at Mandalay Bay but not a place I would go out of my way to visit again.

The pricing is high but they give you portions that could feed an entire tribe so it's not that pricey if you buy one plate of something and split it 3 ways. 
But this is only helpful if the staff tells you that, which they don't, so...you heard it from me. 
Unless you're a sumo wrestler or you typically eat 4000 calories in one sitting, split the plates two or three ways. 
Food is ok, it's not bad, it's not stellar, especially by Vegas food standards, but it's ok/good & it definitely handles the job if you're hungry and hanging around the Mandalay Bay.

I stayed at THEhotel with my friends and we ate here because it was the least expensive compared to the other places nearby. I will say that they have tasty sandwiches, salads and burgers. Great for the price! Service was good too, so no complaints here with this place. The decor was pretty cool as well.

Meh. Service is decent. Food selection is mediocre. Food is okay. This place is pricey, hence the two star rating. Actually, this place is not worth the money in all honesty. That being said, it's open late, choices are rather limited

I'm quickly learning just how overpriced Vegas is. 

Typical hotel overpriced X 2= Vegas prices

Anyway, hungry. Want salad. So hungry regular sentences not used and speaking in passive.

Greek salad. Perfect.

$18. At this point don't care.

Take-out was super speedy,

Actually the salad was great and the ingredients were super fresh. Two varieties of tomatoes, tons of lettuce, onions, feta, red peppers, great pita chips. Literally my perfect version of greek salad.

$18...not the perfect price

Cafe says its 24 hours - well not exactly. Waited 5 minutes in one line to be told they weren't seething for breakfast but weren't seating for lunch but I could wait in another line for take out order. It gets better. Waited in other line to be told they weren't serving breakfast or lunch - so no sandwiches etc but I could buy a bag if chips and a drink. Also if I bought them I could not sit in their dining area because they're in - wait for it- transition. At the ripe old age of 52, I have never gone to a place with a big sign that says 24 hour service inside a 24 hour hotel inside a 24 hour inside near 1000 restaurants that serve at least part of all their menu all the time, to wait 15 minutes for the high privilege of buying a bag of chips and some no name coffee.

Was not even going to write this review if the cashier was a bit nicer. I know its 5:30am and you're tired but you are working in a 24/7 restaurant inside a     Hotel, your menu is not from Gordon Ramsay whats a little bit of effort to make my order a bit right eh? Smile a little, say hello atleast. And don't roll your eyes  n customers. 

Btw. I wanted breakfast not garbage. $18.xx for this Bacon,Ham & Cheese they got me. Not even happy even if its free. stale bread, flat and overcooked eggs, It seemed like reheated potatoes and bacon. Blah.

Everything at lunch was yummy. We started with the chili cheese fries and they were very good and upscale comfort food.
I had the turkey, avocado, sprout, w/muenster sammi. I wish they had listed the tomato on the menu so I could tell them to leave it off but I pulled it off and am ok with that. I switched the bread type to sourdough. Waitress was nice and attentive. Service was fast & good overall.

For a city that doesn't sleep, it sure is hard to find a place to eat at 3 in the morning, and it doesn't come cheap. The food is not bad, but its nothing special. You're paying $20 for a Chilis burger, but drunk you probably wont mind, sober you will when you see the bill in the morning.
Ordered a $15 PB&J at 10:45pm.  Slower than crap and the thing was slapped together with so much carelessnes it was impossible to eat. Come on, this is the MANDALAY right? WTF!!!

Came in for appetizers in the afternoon. We ordered the calamari and meatball appetizers and they were so good it was totally worth it! Both dishes were big enough for three of us to share. Would definitely come back for these!!

We were in town for my boyfriend's 30th birthday and had a fantastic experience here. We were walking around Mandalay looking for a place to eat during a convention lunch rush. The hostess Daija was super friendly, she sold us at the door when we asked about what Salmon dishes  they had and she recommended the salmon teriyaki bowl. She found us a seat right away. Our server Robert was personable, knowledgeable and gave us great suggestions, the Ruben was on point. We loved the food and service so much we asked to speak with the GM Marjorie so we could make sure the staff was recognized. She appreciated the feedback and recommended some other cool places to check out. All in all a great place to eat!
Been here a couple of times. Strip-pricey, but great food and portions. Burgers/wings/nachos are all very good. Large bloody Mary's look awesome, but didn't have one.

Went here last night for dinner and it took almost 45 minutes for us to get our food. There were several tables that came in after us and got their food before we got ours. Maybe it was just a fluke but, not apology or explanation as to why it took so long to get our food. The food was good but, overpriced. The service makes the experience and I will not go back.

Service was phenomenal, first night we had a server named Kevin, who described the whole menu to us being newbies. Every time I turned around my drink was re filled, even got a to go cup of water. Went back in the morning for breakfast and phenomenal service again. Our waiter was Jeff who also explained meals into detail. Breakfast was a huge portion and well worth the money. Deffinetly   will be back again before leaving.

Decor: Loved the inside Decor, it had a clean slick modern feel. With a twist of sweet home Alabama meets Downtown Boston feel to it. (I've been feeling a little theatrically lately #SorryNotSorry) 

Beer: It was a hot day so I decided to have the All American comfort meal & what better way than to top it off with a nice summer Ale. Since I was in Nevada I thought the Sierra Nevada Kellerweis was my best bet. This was the best part of my meal. Served bottled with an empty tall glass that tasted like Beer on tap. Super crisp and refreshing exactly what I wanted. It tasted like a cool summer day.

Lunch:
My All American comfort meal the Blue Beat, included Blue Cheese, Red Wine Mushrooms & Cherry Peppers. Although the burger was cooked to perfect (medium rare). I felt this burger lacked sauce, it was very dry and hard to eat. The mushrooms were barely sauteed almost raw. I felt like something was missing. The fries were delicious, fluffy almost like truffle fries. They were served in this cute basket. 

Overall I'd come back for the beer & fries. It's not at the top of my list but if I was starving I wouldn't mind coming back.

I wish I had lower than a star for this restaurant. First, Price posted on a filet mignon was 37 while when seated, the menu showed it 39. The waiters were fine but the food was not a filet mignon but a steak. I ordered medium to well, which I always order like that but it came so dry. I wasted my money for sure. Juice 5 dollars a glass, refill is the same cost. There's apparently no restaurant manager ensuring that everyone is attended. You are on the mercy of waiters' attention.

Located at Mandalay Bay, went in for the $49 Prime Rib Special, unfortunately they ran out of Prime Rib. The bartender, who was awesome, made some recommendations. I had the French Dip, my wife had the patty melt, and both were outstanding. The Cole slaw and macaroni salad were also great. The couple next to us ordered dessert. The slices of cake were enormous. They took most of it to go. Will go again but will get there earlier and hope they have the Prime Rib.
No bad for breakfast. But like most restaurants at these so called resorts, the prices were marked up at least 50-60% from normal. Food and service were good. Prices keep me from giving 4 stars

The food is good for the most part.  It falls short in speed and value.  The to-go option is convenient but takes way too long.  They offer good portions and solid food, but it is priced like it is a higher level locations.

The kobe beef chili cheese fries were quite tasty.  The chili and the fries both had good flavor.

The queso cheese dip is ok.  The flavor is ok, but I expected more bold flavor from the Chorizo.

It is not a bad option, but you will have to be patient and be willing to pay a little more than it is worth.
Have been here 3x for breakfast in my trip. Staff is friendly & prompt. Food is outstanding!!!!

After a SUPER FUN Friday night out in Vegas, we needed some breakfast to kickstart our Saturday.  I suggested Citizens Kitchen and Bar to my husband as I thought the menu looked yummy.  I was not wrong!  The food is SO GOOD!  My husband ordered an omelette with breakfast potatoes, and I had a breakfast burrito kind of thing that was served with chips.  Everything was brought out to us super fast and piping hot.  And the service was A+.  We had questions on the menu and our server gave us his excellent opinion on choices.  Can't wait to try more stuff on the menu!

I just left from my table still hungry after waiting for over an hour and watching at least 6 different parties be seated AFTER me enjoying their meal. My waitress only came over twice, once after I'd been sitting 20+ minutes to take my order and once again 40 minutes after that to ask me what I ordered. Bish, BYE! 

Now I'm in bed starving eating a $5 hummus and pretzel chip snack back.

I really do not understand the bad reviews.  I ate here twice while in town (once for lunch and once for breakfast) and each time the staff was friendly and efficient.  Food was really good, too!  

I also like that you can get a Macallan 18 neat for $24 versus in the other restaurants and bars inside Mandalay at $68.  So stop in and get your Mac 18 here versus elsewhere so you can have nearly 3 for the price of one. ;)
Great food and service. A wee bit expensive. I had spinach and artichoke dip and lobster roll and it was great!

Good service and yummy breakfast. 

Had a vanilla latte ($5) and the eggs Benedict ($14) both were good! I loved the smashed Tator tot hash, very good!

There's lots of beautiful restaurants in Mandalay Bay, but Citizens Kitchen is the right choice for something simple & lunchy.

I came for a Cobb Salad, and it really hit the spot. While it doesn't have the cobb-cornerstone of avocado, it was delicious nonetheless.

The ingredients are all very fresh & sitting pretty on a crisp bed of iceberg lettuce. I like that the egg whites & yolks are chopped and topped separately, in case you want more of one than the other.

The check-in deal is a slice of cheesecake! I was feeling stuffed from the cobb, but my server happily boxed it to-go.

Since my mom was still sleeping my dad invite my brother and I to grab some breakfast. And since we didn't want to go far we found this restaurant and decided to give it a try. My brother ordered the ultimate breakfast which included pancakes, two eggs, a slice of ham and potatoes, my dad had the classic eggs ham potatoes and toast. I settled for the body builders omelette which was made with egg whites, veggies and chicken breast with a side of fruits. I really enjoyed the omelette it was perfectly cooked and satisfied my cravings!

Dropping my rating from a two star to a one star DISASTER!

I just wrote a review for the Citizens Kitchen & Bar last week.  I mentioned that the waiter George was "AMAZING!"   I retract my statement.  He is unethical and unprofessional.  He automatically included an 18% tip in our bill (see my original review) and not tell us about it (he got a 40% or an $80 tip on a $210 total bill).   We would have been OK with the 18% tip for a party of 8, but just tell us about it so we wouldn't double tip you!

We just checked our credit card statements, and George DOUBLE CHARGED us when we asked him to split our bills.  This means that he charged us 150% for our food and drink bill!  UNETHICAL!  Here's a summary of this horrible restaurant:

1)  We weren't told that Waiter George included an 18% tip on our bill.
2)  We added an additional 20% tip, raising his tip to $85+ on a $210 bill.
3)  We were charged an additional 50% for our food, bringing our total charge to $300+ on a food tab of $168.
4)  To top it off, the food is HORRIBLE here!

AVOID!  Shame on the owners and wait staff of Citizens Kitchen & Bar!  We're working with the credit card companies to resolve this mess!

Food Grade:  D+
Service Grade:  F
Worth the Money Grade:  F
Overall Impression Grade:  F!
Food here is always fantastic! But the best thing is to sit at the bar during the week and chat it up with Raquel.  She is an awesome bartender, and makes this place awesome!

Please don't go to this place. Management is horrible. This place never takes their customers seriously. Now I know why many people left bad review toward horrible/rude customer service and managers. When the good service comes along with the good food, then it makes the restaurant good.

Menu: I think this place has good selections from sandwiches to good soup menus.
But I have no idea how the taste are because I had to return the food. I bet the overall quality and taste decent by reading other people's reviews.

Price: Pretty high as a quick bite casual place. Of course, this is in Vegas. But Wynn has much better casual restaurants with the same price level.

Service: If you are planning to order something over the counter, don't expect to get treated nicely. Just think you are at the local $3 burger shop, but the price is 5 times higher. First, the cashier / hostess at the counter, is not professional (I don't think they are rude. It seems like they just didn't get trained enough about how to serve customers politely).

The worst part is the manager, who is even worse. This place's manager (Mike) is the RUDEST manager I have ever met in my life. I saw another bad review about this place's manger, now I know why. if you have any issue with this place, don't even try to make it fixed with a manager, cuz it will make you look like you are the one with the problem. And don't try to explain what went wrong with your order, because the manage won't listen you.

If you don't care about the service, this place is good to go.
Poor experience, had to pay an extra $7.00 for a salad without  cheese, then they didn't give us dressing, and Heather had a ton of attitude. Food was good, service was not...

Spend your money elsewhere!!!! The music is RIDICULOUSLY loud. I don't know how anyone inside could have a conversation. We asked to be seated outside because we did not want to eat breakfast and have to yell at each other. The hostess said she'd tell her manager, but that didn't happen. We are still sitting here and it's blasting. Extremely inappropriate for a morning setting. We ordered coffee and water and received those pretty quickly. Not sure what is up with the water here, but it was disgusting. We also received them in skinny glasses without ice, while tables around us received them in bigger glasses with ice. The waitress took our order and it's easily been 20 minutes and we have not gotten our order. There is a couple that was seated about 10 minutes after us and they already received their food. Are you freaking serious?!? 

(10 minutes later) ANOTHER table was given their food that came in 5 minutes ago. If I could give this place zero stars I would. Our waitress never checked on us to tell us why the food was taking so long. So we left. HORRID service. Now I see why they have such mixed reviews. I guess if you complain about the music they treat you like shit.

This was the recommended restaurant for breakfast business meeting among the restaurant row in the MGM hotel.   I was told that we should get there before 7 am to ensure that we get a table - and we did.   It was not crowded at 6:45 am.   

I was there for 2 consecutive mornings for my breakfast business meetings and my server remembered me on the 2nd day.   Perhaps my tipping made an impression?  (Not sure if that was good or bad).   The service was okay but my second serving of cappuccino took over 10 mins to get to me.

I had my custom omelette both mornings but due my focus on the business interactions, I actually didn't remember if the food were good or bad!   :-).   

I like the casual setting and the atmosphere that could facilitate a discussion.
Stopped in for some hot chocolate, it came out warm not hot and our server was very apathetic. We were there for maybe 30 minutes and he never checked on us once. No plans to ever return.

I ordered a Caramel Macchiato and I get this cup that is 1/4 full.  I was thinking "really"????  I went back and talked to the girl who made it and she was so rude.  She said it was an Italian macchiato. I don't care you don't serve a 1/4 cup of a shot with foam. Get smaller cups if that's what you are going to serve so the customer from Texas  isn't disappointed.  Secondly the girl says to me "what do u want?"    I said not this. I want more coffee and substance. Give me a Cappuccino. She handed me a cup without me knowing and I said is this mine?  She said yes.   Rude!   If you're not happy making customers happy. Find a new job!!!!!!!!

Besides the server, this place is a disappointment. Ppl who order and got here way after we did, got their food way before we did. How did that work? We got our food 30 mins or so after we ordered. And when we got our food, my food was super salty!! I was mad, sad, and definitely HANGRY!!

Boyfriend and I are staying at Mandalay Bay for the weekend and we decided to stop here for a quick bite after we checked into our rooms. We ordered a Caesar salad ($16) and a turkey avocado sandwich ($10ish). First of all, you think you can't mess up a salad. Especially a Caesar salad that's $16, right? Wrong. This was the worst salad I've ever tried. The croutons were extremely soggy and chewy (probably from the moisture)- all their salads are pre-made and sitting in refrigerators. The chicken breast was also extremely dry and inedible. 

The sandwich that we ordered was okay, but the "avocado" was NOT real/fresh cut avocados. It was some kind of green, mixed with things avocado paste, a poor excuse for avocado.

There are better options if you keep walking thru the casino (I.e. burger bar). Avoid this place if you can.

This was probably the most ok'est of ok restaurants to me personally. My boyfriend and I came for dinner and a drink on a Friday night. There was no wait which was nice and the server was super friendly, but the food was just really ok. I felt it was pretty overpriced for what it was.

We started with the tempura shrimp as an appetizer. The flavor was good, but it only came with about 5 pieces and wasn't anything too special. For an entree I had the Caesar salad. The portion size was large and taste was good, but once again nothing special. Probably the two most exciting things about my meal were my Bloody Mary and the giant carrot cake. Those were the only things I could recommend.

I'm not sure I'd come back here again unless it was really the only option open or around.

This place was awesome! 

We happened upon this place while we were knocking out our bucket list item of walking the entire strip. Our waiter Joey was friendly & attentive. The General Manager... I think his name was Nick (?) seated us, and was also extremely personable. 

Will definitely be back when friends and family come into town to visit. 

Try: Mac n' Cheese & Carrot Cake!

We had a breakfast meeting here during a convention. It was a bit loud even at 9am but then again this is Vegas. Service was very good. I had a stuffed French toast (banana and Nutella) which was good but a bit on the sweet side. I know- what should I expect when I ordered it! 

I came back the next day just to get coffee to go. But at $4 I thought differently! It doesn't seem bad with breakfast but just a cup to go...
What a great place to eat and its 24 hours Ever wanna check out Light Nightclub first nightclub inspired by cirque du SOLEI Let me know and I will take care of you 702.809.9045

Story:  I ordered a slice if cake at around 11pm that my wife and I was going to share.  We had no idea of how much it was going to cost. Upon paying my wife asked for a cup of water. I followed. Total came to nearly 12 bucks and I hand over the credit card. Cashier hands me card back and wife says, why so expensive?  Found out it costs $1 per cup for tap water. I was upset but cashier tells me sorry, already ran the card. I left feeling ripped off.  While my wife picked up cake I asked for manager to come to my table. Sean came over and listened to my complaint. Afterwards I learned employee was new, and that the $1 charge was because of night club people often came in just for water.  He then asked how he could make it right. In the end he did way more than we asked. He turned around an a angry customer.  Having said that the cake was really good as well. I'd go back. Hopefully they will be informing customers about the charge for water.

Mediocre food at best. My friends and I were desperately trying to find a restaurant in Mandalay Bay to eat at before we headed to Daylight. So we just settled for this place.
 
Food: I asked the server for recommendations and he recommended the corn beef hash skillet. Since he said it was one of the popular dishes, I took his word for it and I was so disappointed when I got it. It was lukewarm and just not good, wasted my $16 on a dish I didn't even finish. 

Service: Our server was nice and came promptly to take our orders and refill our waters throughout the time we were there. However, there was a situation that happened when we were paying. We asked for the server to split our bill by entrees and when he return with our change. My friend didn't her change back. We are generous but we weren't going to tip you $10 alright.

Definitely not a memorable dining experience for me in Vegas!

Worst service I've ever had. Inside was completely empty but they wouldn't let me sit inside to watch the games when I ordered food because it's for sit down guests only. Tried asking for a water from the waiter to be redirected 3 times until the manager finally came around. This place sucks.

Would I come here if I was not staying here at MB, no.
Would I eat here when I am, YES. One yummy dish and I'm sold. French dip all they way for those seeking to fill a simple light palate with some yummy meat. Light and  fluffy french dip all the way.

MB's 24 hour cafe is perfectly positioned across from the nightclub. ha!  We left the club early and beat the crowd. Good thing too! Not many people were seated, therefore our service was excellent. They have the usual selection you would find at any 24 hour Vegas hotel cafe including a fully stocked bar. I ordered a breakfast croissant, nothing special stood out. It was tasty, a little on the oily side, but satisfying nonetheless. Hubs ordered a loco moco. I wasn't a big fan of the long grain rice they use or the gravy. Our server was friendly and prompt. She came by to check in on us and take refills in a timely manner. Decent place to grab a late night bite and clean.
This was a Great Dinner with the Best Service in town!! Priscilla out-did herself with a truly genuine smile! So personable and real Get down to Citizen's tonight for a terrific meal.

Wow! You can start with the bright eyed waitress Rachel and stop there!! She really made my experience!! I wandered in here by accident and was greeted with such smiles I said I MUST dine in! I asked Rachel about flavored coffee and she suggested caramel!! It was simply amazing!! Then I ordered the smoked salmon Benedict!! Wowsies!! It was simply amazing!! I guess I know where I am having breakfast every day while I am In town!! Their lunch looks great too!!! If you stay at Mandalay Bay you must try this place!!!
The cheeseburgers here are really good and the nachos are great with large portions to share.

I have been coming to Vegas for years, particularly for an annual convention at the Mandalay Bay Convention Center. This means that pickup lunch to carry with me is pretty important and having something that doesn't taste extremely processed or like it's been sitting in the glass showcase for days is also important. Here's where Citizens comes in. 

For breakfast, they are ok. The early morning staff doesn't seem to be very helpful, perhaps that's because the coffee is pretty weak. There is a decent amount of confusion when it comes to seating and they are pretty unfriendly. Service was pretty slow - so do I recommend coming here to sit down? Not really. 

BUT!!!! The sandwiches and salads are SO GOOD! I highly recommend the quinoa or the kale salad - both of them top my list as does the turkey sandwich. But if I had to go with one, I would choose one of their amazing salads. 

The staff here is ok and the confusion due to long lines in the restaurant can get annoying but I say that salads are worth it, just take them to go or be prepared to sit there for a very long time. Also, cocktail of choice is the Berry Wise. 

Happy eating! Recommended.

Food is Ok. Nice selection of healthier fare. However, the staff needs basic training in customer service. We were given the wrong food item and when it was brought to the attention of the staff, the response was "I know, I know. I'll get the right one."

It took 10 minutes to get a juice with ingredients listed as follows: kale, blueberries, grapes, apple and beets. Unfortunately, the main ingredient was apple juice with honey running a close second. Yuck.

The last straw was when after waiting for 10 minutes at a nearby table (for the juice), we were told we had to move because the table was for non-"to-go" guests. The place was empty and we would have stayed exactly 5 minutes since we were running so late already. Horrible experience.
Green & mean smoothie was good but really? $10 for 1 regular sized cup of puréed lettuce? Overpriced and It didn't make me feel magical. Make it $5.73 a-holes!

What is advertised as Juice is actually a flavorless smoothie. I got the Ginger Snap and there's neither ginger nor snap to it. I'd get more flavor chewing on a celery stick. The blend job was abhorrent with lumps and leaves floating in the concoction. Not to mention the staff was lifeless and frigid... note to management -- don't put people on the AM shift if they're not morning people! The entire experience left me with a bad taste in my mouth... literally and figuratively!

So we are at a concert inside the Mandalay beach. During intermission my husband went out to get Starbucks; unfortunately they were closed. He came back to our spot and handed me this drink in a cup; I was like this is not Starbucks. He said he did not have any choice but to order from citizens because its the only place open. His bill was like $18 for two medium drink. I took a sip and phew, it tasted like watered down peanut butter and the bitter after taste of not so ripe banana. It made my tummy rumble inside and we ended up not finishing the concert because I don't want to have any accident in there. I don't even know if its a smoothie or a juice because its not thick or icy, it's watery and tasted so bad. Not a very good first impression. Makes me not want to try to eat here because they can't even get their drinks right.

Are these ppl serious??! How patient do they think drunk ppl are? hahaa 

All we wanted was a bit of water n to be able to place our order ... No demands of the timeliness in which u brought it out... Just some water and attention. Ughh.  

They took so long we went to their to-go area and picked up our own "cheese platter" appetizer http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/citizens-kitchen-and-bar-las-vegas?filter_by_userid=True&select=VbTLyvrPncloIwfJ1XjaIQ&userid=ydIdyGQyO8eZe0yqgs0DfA#QS0SSvYIraRV0PTdWSQTzQ to hold us over until someone decided to come talk to us.  

Closest place at the moment that was open though.  I hate that beggars can't be choosers--I'll just be a whiny beggar then :/
Maybe one of my worst experiences dining out. Terrible service from several ppl with the terrible attitudes.
Customer service was really good. The spinach dip is not good has no flavor and the pizza is kinda dry.

Went here to meet some friends for a quick snack. Food was good. I had a marble cake and my boyfriend got a sandwich (forgot what it's called) but it's like a double cheeseburger sandwich which was so good. If it wasn't for the hostess/greeter, I would've given this place 5 stars. We were ignored when we arrived. Seems like she was busy working on some papers when she should be greeting customers. She just looked at us and continued to work on her papers. We sat down, waited for about 10 mins, nobody came to get our orders. We decided to walk up to the cashier and just ordered for to go.
the turkey avocado is unreal!!!!! i could eat it everyday... Cranberry walnut bread, lemon aioli(wow), sprouts, tomato, lettuce... Delist I love Mandalay bay!
I had a horrible experience and bad customer service, dry and lousy croissant that they wouldn't even warm and very bad PB&J sandwich. Beware of this cafe...

OK I realize this is a tourist trap in Mandalay Bay where there is limited lunch choices for a reasonable price.  However, the service here is terrible.  

Saturday afternoon -- half empty.  We came in and were seated.  15 mins to take our order.  AFTER we ordered another group of four was seated, order taken, and food arrived for them before we were served -- our order was not complicated.  Order came wrong -- asked for cole slaw and got fries.  Other party paid and were gone before we got our check.  Never saw the waiter until we asked for him.  Two simple taco plates, two cups of soup, one club sandwich and four soda = $94.00 (minus tip which I did not leave).  

Walk down the Strip a little and get something more reasonable.

Solid establishment. Sat at the bar and the Barntender EJ was professional and courteous.  His "What up dawg?" and "I got you bro, you already know" made me feel welcome. Like my friend was serving me drinks. Keep EJ... as a matter of fact, give him a raise.

Best Reuben sandwich I have ever had.   The place is surrounded by expensive chef restaurants like Emeril.  Being a normal person, none of them appeal to me.  I would absolutely recommend that you eat here.

I gave this place two chances.  For lunch, I had the rice bowl with salmon which consisted of 90% rice, 2 pieces of broccoli, 2 snap peas, 2 carrot slices, and 2 slices of zucchini.  They should call the dish "Brown Rice with a few veggies".   The salmon was cooked well which made me bump them up from 1 star to 2 stars.  Add a sparkling water, tax and tip, I ended up paying $46.  Definitely not worth even half the price tag.   The second meal was breakfast.  The coffee was good but I didn't get further than that.  They were out of oatmeal which is the only thing on the menu you can eat if you are gluten-free and can't have eggs.  My suggestion is they pop of gluten-free bread in their freezer so people have some more options.  Also, swap real maple syrup for the fake stuff.  It's all just a reminder that high prices don't equal high quality.

On the tab
Shrimp Cocktail
French Onion Soup
Kobe Chilli
Chicken Noodle
Prime Rib
A bunch of Juices

PRO:
Lots of tables
Easy to get a table on a Friday night during MLK weekend
Get the KOBE Chilli

CONS:
The juices.. it was a frothy juice so we couldn't call it a juice or a smoothie. For the price, pass on it.

Overall, typical American food and nothing noteworthy.

I was looking around for some place to have lunch before going to the Shark reef Aquarium and I just happened to pass this place. They had their menu on the outside and I saw they had a lobster roll. That is all I needed. So I went to the hostess and got seated. I was told a server would be by shortly. Um not what happened. Now the place was virtually empty and I noticed my server had looked over and saw me sitting there waiting but he never came up and offered me a drink or anything. He just kept staring at me and carried on conversations with his co workers. It made me very uncomfortable. Then he finally comes up and asks me if I am ready. He offers no apology for the wait or the fact that he saw me sitting there and did nothing. He did not ask me if I wanted a drink or anything like servers normally ask first he just asked me if I was ready and had a huge attitude when he asked. The annoying tone in his voice was like I had kept him waiting while I stared at the menu forever or something like that. His attitude surprised me considering I knew what I wanted from the second I walked in and I was the one who was kept waiting but ok. I also wanted to get to the Shark Reef aquarium before I started collecting my social security so if anyone should've been annoyed it should have been me. I ordered my food and guess what more waiting. Again he was too busy doing his own thing to go check on my food. It took almost 30 minutes to get my food. I know it was not the kitchen for one thing the lobster is served cold so is not like they have to cook the lobster and heat it up or anything and my side was coleslaw. How long does that take? I had already thought it was a mistake coming there because my server acted like a complete asshole but it was even worse after I tried this pitiful excuse for a lobster roll. It was disgusting. After I picked through my food I waited and waited for the server to bring me my check. I had to flag him down at some point because if not I would have sat there forever. Well wanting my check must have been a problem because Mr. Attitude acted even more stuck up when I flagged him down and asked for my check. Needless to say after $23 for that lunch I felt leaving unsatisfied and downright stupid for wasting my time and money there. The food was shitty and the customer service was even shittier. others many have a better experience but personally for me I will not ever waste my time and energy here again. Mandalay Bay and Vegas itself has WAY too many superior options for dining for me to waste me time where I am clearly not wanted.

We got 4 sandwiches and one salad, most were pretty good except for the roast beef sandwich, which was more fat than meat.  Completely gross.  I can't believe they actually thought it was okay to serve.

Just flew in from Birmingham, and boy are my arms tired.

I was so hungry it felt like my stomach was eating away at my spine. So I went straight to Citizens before check-in at the hotel. I sat at the bar and enjoyed the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich and a cold Bud Light. The sandwich was big, and it hit the spot. The Buffalo sauce was tangy and it was neutralized nicely by the ranch dressing. The chicken breast was thin and fried just right. The side of fries was on point. They were hot and crispy.

Very good calamari. The breading and seasoning on it made it awesome. I also had the Mac and cheese with ham. It was a nice blend of cheese but not too heavy on the cheese. I also like that it wasn't oily. Sometimes other places have a pool of oil from the cheese at the bottom of the bowl. Not here. Perfectly cooked. Mmmmm. They have tater tots!
Ordered nachos no chicken, they added chicken and charged us. The toppings were jusr dumped in areas instead of being spread out. The black beans were not drained enough.

Oh Citizen's, how you never failed us. During my 5 day stint in Vegas, I probably dined at Citizens no less than 4 times. Maybe, because the restaurant was in our Hotel's Lobby or maybe I was too lazy to search for other food options. Either way Citizens was good. The first day in Vegas I ate lunch there and they were cranking out some good late 90's and early 00's R&B tunes. My guests and I were really enjoying the music, so much that the young lady at the next table over started dancing with us. I ordered the Chicken Sandwich that day and it was good along with their fries. Others in my entourage had chicken wings (good) and their mac n cheese (which was the bomb!). The rest of our visits to Citizen's were for breakfast and let me tell you, their breakfast is bomb. Their potatoes are too die for. I'm glad I stumbled across this gym.
Nos sirivieron porciones muy grandes y la comida estaba sabroza, aunque el precio me parecio algo exagerado.
This place is so fun! Chicken club and blueberry spritzer were amazing! And Tony even remembered my berries . Thanks for being a great server Tony!

Went in for dinner. Greg was our waiter. My friend wanted spaghetti and a salad. He told her she didn't want salad the pasta dish was enough. REALLY! We were both drinking alcohol. Was not asked if we wanted another drink. Brought check to table before plates were removed. REACHED OVER ME to grab my wine glass without asking if I was done or wanted another glass. His service and attitude were so bad I can't even remember what the food tasted like.

It's a solid choice for hotel place. Not fine dining but not fast food. Solid selection and if you stick with wheelhouse (prime rib special, spaghetti and meatball, sandwiches) you will be happy. Prices are more reasonable for the location. I really like the "cafe" side for sandwiches and desserts where you order at the counter and pick up when ready. Great place to grab a late night snack or treat.
Ordered the ultimate breakfast and it was more like the mediocre breakfast. I guess thats Vegas though. It was pricey and just ok. Service was great!

We ordered the brick chicken and the steak frites.  The steak was ordered medium and came out very tough and dry, more well done than medium.  The chicken was also very dry and not good.  The food was very poor.  The service was excellent and to be fair, we didn't comment on the food.  We were in a rush and didn't have time to ask for correction.  Overall though, I'd expect food not to be so over done the first time.

Good breakfast, but like most of this city,
VERY expensive. $21 for eggs, bacon, pancakes & potatoes. Coffee is $4.50
Mind-bendingly slow service without a smile. Definitely not coming back here in a hurry

Food was expensive, and extremely mediocre.

It was a convenient spot for dinner, considering I was staying at the Mandalay Bay and it's pretty much at the end of the strip.

I could tell that the waiter was trying really hard to provide good service, but overall, I wasn't too happy. The restaurant was relatively empty, but we still had to ask for simple things like water refills, bread, and condiments. (Bread was stale and toasted to warm, just sad.)

The food didn't make up for it either. If I am ever in the area again, I won't be back.
Very casual place very unassuming. The portions are huge but everything is made with lots of flavor and taste. Excellent causal dinning if in vegas. Moderate prices but it's all worth it

Skip CITIZENS. It's a Sat morning in Las Vegas. Citizens in Mandalay Bay has nothing available!! No cappuccino no macchiato no caffe latte no cafe au lait and no cafe mocha and no breakfast burritos nor bacon egg and cheese sandwich. Only half of juices available. But you can get a regular coffee fruit croissant. Even the girls at the counter acted snooty and could care less, but they sure expected a tip. Pathetic! 
First gal never poured our regular coffee even though there was only one couple on line behind us. 2nd gal ROXANNE claimed that my MLife card had no points. I explained I wanted bill for MLife discount and gave her my credit card or offered room number and she refused saying my MLife card was incorrect. 
Later, I had to spend time with MLife from my hotel room phone to fix the problem. Well there was no problem! Only problem was ROXANNE at CITZiZENS! 
Thankfully Ashley at MLife applied the discount over the phone so I wouldn't have to stand in line. Thank you Ashley at MLife. 
SKIP CITIZENS!

I'm very conflicted on this place - my wife and I have been there for breakfast a few times while in Vegas. 

The food itself is decent.  My wife usually goes for the eggs benedict and she enjoys it - she gives them a 4/5 (and she eats them just about everywhere).  I've had a number of different breakfast dishes and find them to be good, but not any better than anywhere else.  

I find the service to be very inconsistent however.  Like others have written when they are busy service can be really slow (I know it's difficult when it is busy - but this is Vegas and you know weekends will be extremely busy - you should plan around that).  So if it looks busy and you're in a rush you might want to avoid this place. 

The weird part is that even when they're not busy service is hit and miss.  Most recently they couldn't get our order straight.  My wife was offered fruit or hash browns with her meal - she ended up being given both (although it looked like a half order of each).  I asked for bacon with mine and ended up with ham.  They fixed it all and no problem but she wrote our order down and it wasn't busy... How do you mess that up?

We ate breakfast here on a Monday morning, 7am.

Eggs, bacon, pancakes, toast & hash browns.  
We divided the meal between the two of us.

Eggs were not tasty.  Bacon ok.  
Pancakes...not fluffy.  They were just flat.
We asked for more butter.  Left 20 minutes no later, no extra butter.
A guy by us came in, waited, got no service and left.

Our bill was $40.  We ate at Seabreeze Cafe 2 other mornings for less cost and better food.
The best breakfast in Las Vegas! Especially since I refuse to go to any of the buffets. The service was prompt and our waiter was great.

Food is extremely mediocre. The service was ok nothing great. We came in around 4am and they only had a late night menu available. It was overpriced for what we got. My friend ordered a tuna sandwich it was very dry, canned tuna taste better in my opinion. All of the sandwiches come ale cart. The fries were disgusting and costed 7 bucks. We also has breakfast burritos which were ok nothing amazing. I would never come back here and don't recommend anyone else either.

We were seated on the "outside" patio. 

Our waitress was friendly but rarely visited our table to check in on us. We didn't get any water or coffee refills, even after asking. 

The food was mediocre and overpriced for the quality. 

A cute and convenient spot but not worth it.

I'll just share my experience. Although service was good, the food was not worth the price. Appetizer (chili fries), 1 salad (Caesar), 1 entree (penne no chicken), soda and tea was $92!!!  Dakota was attentive and was on his 7th day of training.  I can't give this more than 1 star because I expect the whole package. Especially for $92!!!

Yes, I know this is a restaurant within the hotel,
Yes, I am prepared for the overpriced menu,
Alas, I'm still disappointed with flavor and the portion size.

We ordered quinoa salad, burgers, pasta, and some kids menu items. Surprisingly the best value items were kids menu with an entrée, side, and drink, which could have easily fed an adult.  The regular adult menu items are hit and miss. After finishing their plates, most of the adults in our party ended up finishing my nephews' tater tots since we're still hungry.  Surprisingly those tots are quite good.

TIP: You could ask to substitute fresh cut fruit, tater tots, fries, or pasta salad as side without additional charge.

Easy location and fun ambiance but for the price, the food is just ok. I ended up going twice because I was staying in the hotel for a convention. Their coffee actually isn't bad and it's serve yourself. The bacon, egg cheddar sandwich was just ok and I didn't care for the side of potatoes at all. The 2nd time I got the corned beef hash and it was a bit bland and dry. I had to ask for more hollandaise sauce and hot sauce. Like I said, not bad but for the price, I'd expect more.

Greeting- nice
Vibe- none
Service- very good
Price- good for vegas
Bathroom- casino bathrooms- pass
Food
The pastrami sandwich is tasty and all homemade $18. Big portion with good fries
Burger $17 is good
WIGB? Yes

I came here because it is open 24/7. It was only late night menu being served at 4:00 am. 

Spinach & artichoke dip- $16: extremely bland and devoid of taste, only ate 1/3 of it. 

Cheeseburger- $20: please see the picture I posted. More lettuce than hamburger. Bun was over-toasted and hard. Burger patty was once again very bland. I had to ask for mayo to just give it some taste.

Only positive was the french fries, which were 

Service- hostess was very friendly, server was average for a late-night diner sort of place, however he brought me the wrong bill. I was one of only 3 tables currently occupied. 

Summary: Hands down worst food I've had in a while. I have never given a 1-star rating before,. In fact, I would happily go to a Denny's everyday of the week over here, and also for half the price. $38.97 pre-tip, even on the strip was a complete waste for the quality of food. 

I sincerely hope the F&B department @ Mandalay Bay takes time to read these reviews. Honestly, just a little effort would go a long way at this establishment. Just because this is a 24/7 eatery, does not mean that everyone who eats here late at night is intoxicated and would scarf down whatever is put in front of them.

Eh...Comme ci comme ça. Came here for lunch about noon on a Thursday and it was dead besides a couple other people in the restaurant. We were seated in the back and the environment was dark and somewhat dreary; actually the entire Mandalay Bay hotel is dark and somewhat uninviting. Our waitress was quick to get our drinks and our order, and the food came out in a timely fashion. 

First out was chicken noodle soup with "butter crackers"...the soup was good but nothing special and the butter crackers that were cleverly worded on the menu were simply saltines with a slab of butter plastered in the middle...sort of strange. Next came our salads; we got the bbq chicken and the cobb that were both significant in size. They were ok, but nothing special. While our waitress was attentive neither she or any of the staff seemed very happy to be working there. The experience was underwhelming all around. There are lots of fantastic places to eat on the strip, I suggest skipping this joint and finding a better option for your tastebuds.

Good munchy late nite? Yes please!

The only 24hr eatery in Mandalay Bay and it's a life saver.  After long night of dancing at Light nightclub, Citizens was a few steps away.  Got seated relatively fast and we quickly ordered off the one page menu.  Our party of four ordered quite a few items to share and all was quite good.  
The Prime rib was AWESOME!  Highly recommended.  
The Mahi mahi fish taco was ok and had a spicy kick in it. 
The Cheese dip chips was amazing!  The dipping of cheese and chili was perfect filling for the late night cravings.
The Buffalo wings were ok.  It was a bit acidic for a late night food but the taste was still good.

Server was really busy and the whole place was understaffed.  On a Saturday night, one large section was held down by only one server.  He seemed very collected but I can tell, he was a little overwhelmed with the requests from each table.  We didn't bother him much but there was a tables that had many requests every time he walks by- not sure if the server forgot and had to be reminded or it was simply the patrons asking for different stuff each time.

I wouldn't mind coming back again especially for the prime rib and the cheese dip chips.

"Meh" sums it up....I felt that way about Red, White and Blue and Citizens is no different. Honestly, it feels like casino management said "hey, let's change the sign on this joint..but we're totally cool with the slow, indifferent service and so/so, overpriced food".

You can do better, and you probably should.

Excellent!  Love this place, great service as well as food.  I've been here 4 times and love their French dip-get it!  Raquel is an amazing bartender!  You have to sit at her bar, immaculate!  Clean organized and ready to serve you with a smile.  I've tended bar for 10 years myself and she hits the nail right on the head.  Can't wait to go back!!!

Service was great. 
Friendly and pretty attentive considering we are sitting outside in the corner.
Food and drink was decent.

I can't even BEGIN to write a review that expresses how tickled I am to have found Citizen's Kitchen! It all started with coffee...good coffee that's reasonably priced (in Vegas!) and with free refills! As I was at the Mandalay for business, refills are a wonderful thing. Next, I tried a salad-- it was HUGE and FRESH and delicious! The following day I had a sandwich which, again, was HUGE and freshly made and delicious! The sandwiches actually lasted me for 2 meals...two delicious, hearty meals! I wish there was a clone of Citizen's Kitchen where I'm from...but if ever I cam back, I'll come back!

http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g45963-d3863532-r314000113-Citizens_Kitchen_Bar-Las_Vegas_Nevada.html#

I give it a poor two due to the expense. There are tons of other options nearby so I will explore to try and find a more reasonable place. 

I had a ham and egg croissant and a small coffee and a yogurt and the cost was 29.59. And you wonder why I could not afford a tip (it was a to go order at the cashier).

The croissant was terrific. The "hash browns" came right out of the ore Ida bag in the freezer and were undercooked. Coffee was fine. 

Vegas is weird and the Madalay Bay is like having a captive audience for which you can be charged three times what you should be charged. I am the dummy that did it.
The hostess seated us fairly quickly, and I like the outside tables. Our waiter was rude, and didn't really take care of us, but it's open 24-7. Important in VEGAS.

Great food, better service!  During the course of our weeks-long work conference, we ate at Citizens nearly every night for dinner.  We had the pleasure of being waited on by Priscilla.  She had exemplary customer service, and was friendly, courteous, and upbeat!  Now, on to the food -- over the course of the week I had a BLTA, Fish & Chips, Turkey Avocado, as well as the BBQ Chicken Salad.  Every meal was delicious, but be warned: portions are enormous!  So come hungry or be prepared to split a meal with someone.  For people staying at Mandalay, I would highly recommend this as a dining option!

We stayed at MB recently and tried this out for lunch...some healthier menu options than other places at MB.  I ordered the chicken salad sandwich and loved it...very filling.  My wife ordered the turkey burger...she liked it, but felt it may have been a bit undercooked.  Not a cheap place, but this is Vegas.

$4 for coffee water!  We walked all over the Strip to find a good cup of coffee. McDonald's coffee is far superior. That should give you an idea had bad this coffee tasted.  Sorry McDonald's, I should not have compared you to such horrible coffee.

Side note. The service was really good.

I don't know how to really rate this place  
We stayed at Mandalay Bay 10/21-10/25 2017 first night I saw the place we decided to put our name in the list and was told that waiting was 1hour so decided to move to another resto but what we did I ordered a food for my partner to go and still was told waiting was 30 mins I ask if we order and just eat on the other side since it empty I was told a big NO so decided just to pick up to go since too lazy to walk 
Then my friends ordered roast beef sandwich and chicken salad but when our ordered came it was a roast beef  sandwich and a chicken salad sandwich we questioned them and they stated it was a misunderstanding so what the lady did took the bread in-front  of us toss it into the trash and said there your salad  and we ask there is a difference the lady stated yes ask for the $2 
Even it happened we went back got seated since it was early.  Order and everything 
So here is my final rating 
Chris server 5x5   STARS
JP manager 3.5 STARS never convince us what action will be done 
Food 2.5 STARS
Atmosphere 3 STARS 
OVERALl its a 2 STARS 
SORRY your place needed a lot of improvement

Had dinner here on my last visit to Vegas and it was just okay.  Honestly, I was travelling solo on business and it was the only resto in Mandalay Bay that had open tables so, I really didn't have a choice.

I ordered their French Onion Soup to start, which was pretty good.  It was definitely cheesy and baked to perfection but the broth wasn't as robust as I'd hope it would be, however, they sure didn't skimp on the onions!  Soup was $12.

For my entree, I had their Lobster Roll w/Pasta Salad.  I've had my taste of what a true Lobster Roll tastes like from a couple spots in the East Coast.  Unfortunately, this Lobster Roll had more pieces of celery than lobster; it was really disappointing, especially with a $23 price tag. The Pasta Salad also seemed like it was under cooked; the pasta that is.

Overall, there are FAR, FAR, FAR better spots to eat in Vegas, can't speak for the other restos in Mandalay Bay.  So, unless you're in a pinch like I was, I'd skip this place.
Their plain cheeseburger was delicious soda was flat are here two time got same thing never waited food was quickly served and in my and girlfriends opinion awesome time is limited in Vegas

Had lunch here. Sat in the outside seating, which unfortunately included the smoke from the rest of Mandalay Bay. Small table for 3 folks; can't imagine trying to seat one more.

Ordered the chicken wings with sweet chili sauce (GF!) and they were decent. My husband (who travels and dines out a lot for his job) said his French dip sandwich was the best he's ever had....The prices are quite high, but it's a nice resort, so we understand. Our server was nice but not over the top. 

I'd probably go back for late-night grub, but not lunch or dinner.

Where else do u go when it's 4 a.m. in da morning?!?!
Potato skins are not bad either are their buffalo wings at this time in the a.m.

Affordable dining when compared to the rest of the restaurants at M Bay.  The staff is very accomodating and handled a large party of eleven under a tight time constraint.  Rushing off to see Michael Jackson The One and did not want to miss any portion of the show.  Most popular and newest of the Cirque shows in Vegas.  Very good service by Justin!

Nice large sandwiches, while the Loco Moco needed additional gravy.  Salads were also huge.  Also good for late nights.

The French Onion soup is deep with tasty cheese.  The lasagna is huge. But the main reason for the review is the bartender, Steven (dude with the handlebar mustache).  He's friendly, and had a lot of knowledge about the food.  He convinced me to have the pup and lasagna,  and both were great.  Props to the gent for helping making this a great dining experience.

This is a review for the cafe part of Citizens, not the actual restaurant.

Hungry after a night of partying and wanting something of sustenance in our systems before hitting Daylight, our group wandered into Citizens to pick up some food.

Between Boyfriend and I, we got a bottle of water, a fresh fruit bowl and a croissant. And it totaled to just over $16. WHAT. WHAAAT. The bottle of water itself was $5. FIVE DOLLARS. Even my croissant was only $3.50 (ONLY, she says). My poor wallet.

At least the food was okay. The croissant was light, flaky and huge, so I suppose it kind of made up for the price. The fruit was pretty good -- but unless it's spoiled, it's kind of hard to mess that up.

The other members of our group got various salads (I distinctly remember seeing the quinoa salad) and a tuna sandwich. Their food looked pretty good, but I didn't try it. Regardless, I didn't hear any complaints, so I suppose it was decent enough to satisfy our appetites.

Next time, I think I'll just go hunt down either a Starbucks or something instead if I'm craving a croissant. That's just ridiculous.

This place is one of the best dining options at Mandalay. I had a half portion of the french onion soup and it was magnificent - loaded with cheese, enough for every bite. The quesadilla I ordered was pretty plain, I wished I had gotten more of the soup. The next night of our stay we found ourselves coming back here for a quick bite. I couldn't help but order the soup again, along with the buffalo chicken sandwich. I was disappointed that the soup didn't have nearly the same amount of cheese as the night before, though the sandwich was really great. The food is pretty expensive, but that's par for the course for a vegas resort. One strange bit is that the regular portion of soup is $14, yet the half is only $5 and is a good size.

I'll give it 3.5 stars, but I only got food to go. I found out its the only 24 hour place in Mandalay which is nice. Their take out menu is much cheaper than dining in. 

I asked what salad they recommend and they told me the Cobb so I got it. I was hoping it was the same size as the display in the counter but it wasn't. $11 for a salad is high, but it's Vegas. The salad wasn't bad.

Citizens is separated into two areas. The main part is the to-go deli like area (left side) and the other is the nicer, sit down Bar (right). This review is for the To go deli.

It is an in-house establishment staffed by Mandalay Bay. I mainly came here because I wanted to use the credits I got from staying at Mandalay Bay. I have to conclude that if you aren't spending credits from the hotel, avoid using your hard earned money here.

The first day, I had the Chicken Salad Wrap ($10) and a latte ($5). The wrap wasn't too bad, but it was extremely plain. I wouldn't eat it....if it wasn't "free." Mcdonald's make better lattes (from its machines). Maybe it was, unfortunately, the person who was making drinks that day.

The Turkey Avocado, doesn't have actual Avocados. I believe it's a dressing. I had already left the premise to go back for questioning.

The smoothies are $10 each. I am from LA, but I'm not sure I felt my 'cold pressed uprising' agrees they are 'worth it.' They are prepared fresh.

Reflecting, I think my expectations for Citizens is a little too high. While the prices are high to reflect the convenience of eating at the hotel, I just feel it lacks so much. In Vegas, there are many eateries and lots of options if you are willing to look.  I definitely think sitting down at Citizens might have been a smarter choice, but the starting plate is about $17. If I could do it all over again, maybe I should have settle for a few cocktails and call it a day.

They don't even deserve one star.  By far the worst experience ever!  After spending some serious money gambling my friend and I decided to have a very late dinner, we were seated promptly ... other than that we waited 30 minutes for water and still patiently waited another 30 minutes to see if we were going to be served.... wishful thinking.... A table of 6 who arrived after us were served... We got up and left..... Poor poor poor service!!!  Never again...  We went to RePete's  Bar and Grill .... Immediate service and awesome waiter!

I have visited this venue a few times during my stay since the conference that our companies had was held here in mandalay bay. I had excellent fish and chips and wonderful fish tacos as well as very fulfilling french onion soup.

I notice that this place can get super pack in just a minute since the swarm of people that come in during that special lunch hour window rushing to be seated. And thats why i will give a little acknowledgement to the efficient little asian guy who gets our group going in and out, on point with all the drinks and food order as well as willing to deal with 10 different split check. We appreciate your speed and your tenacity to handle our needy group. I think his name is tommy. 

All and all, i am looking forward to dine in this place again soon.

The only late night option for food in the Mandalay Bay located in the back part of the casino near the nightclub & Mandalay Bay arena. The food is pricey, I think I blew 20 bucks for a sandwich & some chips (and just when I though the blackjack worked me over bad that night.) despite my resentment for the price that food was actually decent, not worth the price but if you're starving it hits the spot.

Go here! My family got two cubans, one turkey avocado and one grilled chicken sandwich. They were all so good! They were able to make bread accommodations no problem if you didn't want the bread it's served on. the waiter was very nice and efficient. Portions were large as well. I would go back!

Went there this morning for breakfast, and in the past was very pleased with the service and quality of good.  However, Sat morning 3/5/16 my fiance and I went to Citizen for breakfast after grabbing a cup of Java at Starbucks.  As we approached the young blonde woman who was the hostess, I immediately saw the sour look on her face.  She was leaning on her elbow and was either in a bad mood or had a terrible hangover. I stood by and waited for her to look my way so I could make my request.  Mind you there was only one other guy waiting to get in. After waiting a minute with no acknowledgement,  I walked all the way up to her, and said excuse me, but we'd like to have breakfast.  She looked at me like I kicked her buns, then said just two of you?.  I said yes, and thank you. She said sternly, stand close!  I shrugged her attitude off and we checked out the posted breakfast menu.  Then she smugly told us," I'm sorry, but no outside drinks are allowed you'll have to throw it away". That was before she even planned on seating us. At that point I told her to forget it, and we would go elsewhere.
Round 2... We returned for dinner, and it was like night n day.  The young brunette woman greeted us warmly, and sat us within 10 mins.  The waitress was excellent as was the food. 
I'm giving this a 3 star but would give it 5 had that first employee not ruined my morning .. Management should do random attitude checks to improve their customer's experience. Their Mac n cheese and mahi tacos were outstanding.

The quinoa vegetable salad ($15) was tiny! There was a tiny scoop of quinoa, which was actually cooked and seasoned well. Then there were a few green leaves. That's about it. I expected much more greens, or vegetables, when the name of the dish is something vegetable.

This was a convenient location to dine at since it's inside the Mandalay Bay hotel and we stayed there. One morning I came by around 8 am and wanted to get a quick breakfast. With all the convention going people everywhere, that was not going to happen so I went elsewhere (to a "dessert" place on the other side of the casino inside the hotel)....

Better than I expected after reading all the crappy reviews.

I've been here at least 3 different times on 3 different visits and it's been consistently decent.  On our last visit, Greg took our order and was really cool and gave us attentive and thoughtful service.  The food was not bad and was definitely good enough for a cafe type of restaurant.  I liked the chicken soup a lot.

Iced tea is brewed which is a surprise because the buffet and Raffles both serve crappy soda fountain iced tea.  The sandwiches are filling and pretty good.  The presentation is nice and the fries are tasty. 

I personally prefer the tables away from the entrance but if people watching is your thing, the front location is the best part because you can see all sorts of people coming from the clubs and the arena when there's an event going on.  It's loud and lively and good to go at 2am for some steak and eggs or other late night fare.

I was here for a drink one night, and for a smoothie the next morning while staying at Mandalay Bay. The drink I got was one of their special cocktails -- I can't remember its name, but it was whiskey with some sort of fruit flavor served in a martini glass and a sugar rim. It was strong and tasted pretty awesome, but the sugar rim wasn't necessary at all. 

The smoothie I got was carrot, ginger, apple, and agave nectar -- again, my forgetful ass can't remember the name. It was pretty decent, but nothing great. I mostly say that because I didn't taste any ginger at all. It was like a carrot and apple smoothie. Meh.

Aesthetic of Citizen is great. That much I know. Can't say anything about the food since I didn't have any (not vegan friendly for anyone who is wondering or cares), but they don't skimp on the drinks, and the smoothies aren't terrible for a quick breakfast.

Side steamed veggies: broccoli had black-moldy goodness on it. 

French onion soup: HUGE & covered in a massive amount of cheese .... Delicious. 

Like the atmosphere and staff was friendly & attentive. 3 stars because they gave me veggies that should have been tossed out but instead served it to me - great presentation though. 

Customer service 5 stars. 
Soup: 4 stars.

We stopped in for a quick dessert and cup of coffee and it was anything but quick. The staff was not very friendly and the wait was simply unacceptable. 20 minutes for a piece of mediocre chocolate cake. I am willing to wait in a long line and pay extra for good service and great food, but not this. Don't waste your time and money!
Me and my husband decided to find us a place to eat after our wedding.  And this was perfect.  The drinks were spot on,  the portions wear huge for the price.  Will come back for sure.

1 = never go here; 5 = you must go here; that is what the stars mean to me. This is exactly why this place got 3 stars. I wouldn't put it in the never go here camp or the must visit. It's food is decent, ambiance is decent (loud at times) and service was nothing to rave about. I got the au jus sandwich which was not bad. If you can't make a decision on where to eat and your strolling through the Mandalay this place will work as it won't excite or disappoint you (at least too much).

I'm sorry but the cashier had a very bad attitude and literally made us stand aside and wait thru 20+ more customers when finally another gal who had originally taken our order realized we were STILL waiting! She gave the girl at the register a look as to WHY didn't you call out their order?? She ran and got the cake. In all we waited almost 30 minutes for 2 pieces of ALREADY made cake while people after us actually were getting HOT food!!!

I typically don't write reviews but I was so blown away by the service. I have NEVER had such an amazing bartender as Steven!!!!  And I love his mustache!!  He knew the menu backwards and forwards. And gave us great suggestions for what to do and see here at the hotel and in Vegas. Plus his drinks were amazing! We  so have to come back!!!

The worst service. Other people that came after us got their food even though they ordered after us. This place is horrible. I do not recommend coming here. We have been waiting over 40 minutes. This is ridiculous.

Ejay was the definition of welcoming. New exactly how to treat a table with assistance and space. Food was yummy and decent prices for the areas. Got the burrito and satisfied and the perfect poached eggs on the biscuits and gravy.
Excellent food. The baked chicken was perfectly cooked & tasty. I had the burger & fries. Without doubt the.best burger I've ever had. Also, the service was impeccable.

Huge portions of classic comfort food that unfortunately fall way short. The focus here is on quantity and presentation rather than quality or taste. Ribs were tough and undercooked. Steak frites totally bland with too large fries. If you come here stick with hard to f up food like the burger. Service is good if a little tired.
Overpriced even for Vegas.  Bland dull food and horrible service.  There is no reason to go here

What a great place for breakfast! I had the egg & potato skillet, which was tasty & nicely presented (in a skillet of course). There was no wait & the food came out in a reasonable time. The cappuccino was good, but had a burnt chocolate taste towards the end. The to-go line was long, but looks like it's a popular place among visitors.

Such a great dinning experience here! Food and service was a 9 out of 10. We were greeted by the hostess as soon as we arrived. We decided to sit at the bar. The Bloody Mary had the perfect amount of spice for someone who doesn't like to burn their pallet while they sip. We had to ask the bartender if we could order, but she was very friendly and efficient. We split the meal very easily; the bartender took the extra step to have it served on two separate plates. When our plates reached us the food was still hot and flavorful.We had to ask for our bill. This restaurant is very clean and organized; everything always comes out correctly and tasty.

We went there for the late night meal.  The menu was very limited and overpriced for what you can get.  The place was half empty and they made you wait (not sure why).  The artichoke dip was not good.  Unless you were like me...the flight got delayed and no other choices, I would stay away from this place.
Food was excellent, drinks are excellent, Service was excellent. My husband liked the ACME Pale Ale beer. Had the turkey burger and chips and queso. Both were good. :)
The food is OK but the service isn't great... I waited 45 mins for a soup and a bacon egg and cheese sandwich.

WARNING: do not come here!! This place sucks. My bf and I went to the food court and saw that we had just missed the last call for food there. So we were walking back to our room to leave for MGM when we saw Citizens had sandwiches for sell. 

We went to order at the counter. The chick at the register is super rude. I don't know what she was doing, but it didn't look like anything except looking down at something. So we waited there for her to take our order, she didn't say "Please hold on" or anything. She just continued looking down for 5 minutes and then finally came up and said "What do you want?" I asked her what's the difference between their two menus - one is an a la carte sandwich menu, and the other includes a side. I didn't feel too hungry, so I got an a la carte wich, but my bf got a sandwich plate and a side. I don't know if the girl has a hearing problem or what, but she couldn't get my bf's order right even though he didn't get anything super special or altered. Finally the meals come out, we were sitting indoors and they said we can't sit there because it's full service for people who got something with a side. Excuse me!...my bf ordered something with a side so let us sit there already. We were already exhausted from being treated so rudely by the gal taking our order, now they're saying we can't sit where we rightfully have permission to. We then asked for everything to get packaged to go so we could sit outside as they demanded. 

The sandwiches themselves are decently sized but nothing special at all. Does it warrant a $13 price tag? HELL NO! I wish I could ask for our money back because this place left such a sour taste in our mouths. I got the Turkey, avocado, and sprouts sandwich. The ingredients are fresh seeming enough, but seriously nothing to write home about. My bf got the Reuben, which poorly assembled and just messy. This was the worst spent $40 of our lives. I don't know how anyone else gives this place more than 3 stars (and even that is too generous). We are paying customers, we should be treated with respect, not whatever they say is passing for service here.

Fantastic breakfast experience.   We had the best waitress ever. (Shanna) my friend and I were not easy customers because we didn't order anything off the regular menu.  She was so accommodating and served our "multiple sides" to complete our meal without making us feel like pains in the you know what.  She went above and beyond with a smile on her face.  Also the coffee was great! :)

Looking for a quick bite before we went to see the Michael Jackson One show.  Cheaper than most restaurants at Mandalay Bay with a good variety of appetizers and main courses. The appetizer of Disco Fries was the best part.  Piping hot and nice ooey gooey cheese with bacon over crisp waffle fried. Could have been more generous with the bacon.  The gravy we asked for on the side and made a nice accompaniment rather than slathered on the top.  The Mahi Mahi Fish Tacos for $26.00 were a rip off.  Let's just call them slaw tacos.  The ratio of fish to slaw was one part fish and six parts slaw.   Should have sent them back.  I had to dissect the taco just to get to the fish. The slaw was dripping in over sweet mayo sauce.   The teriyaki chicken bowl for $22.00 was boring.  Tasted like frozen veggies were used.  Service was good.

Service is poor. Very slow. I sat for 10 minutes and restaurant was empty. Other people that were seated after me were waited on before me. I asked hostess if they had gluten free options and they told me my server would be educated. Not the case. He had no clue and he couldn't even lie well. His explanation was its got cheese. They don't make anything there home made. Management needs to give a PK on good service.

Unremarkable experience, food is overpriced ($$-$$$, I know it's Vegas) and service wasn't great at all. Even though it wasn't that busy, the service was lacking and the guy seemed rushed and seemed more like we were in a diner. 

They have few bottled craft beers and wines. Came here for a late night drink and snack. Got the cheese quesadilla which was alright. My friends got the potato skins and the fish tacos. Overall not a great initial experience, not sure if I'd come back here again.

Just got out of citezens and server was not attentive with any of he's tables. And finally when the bill comes all of the sudden I finally hear the most of him "thank you guys, have a good night". Wow! Well guess what!? I wrote NO TIP. And the final charge. I'm sorry, but I'm tired of unprofessional ppl.

Maybe being in l Las Vegas a few days spoils you, had an afternoon snack , it was just ok, attentive service, bland fish tacos, horrible Quessadilla!! 

Overall  not a Fan.

After logging in some time at the Daylight day club we were hungry and looking for a good place to get our grub on within Mandalay Bay. A friend remembered having a good experience here so we figured it should be pretty good. Well, it fell a little short of the mark with pricey food and slow service. My tuna melt was good, but it better damn well be for $16! The accompanying seasoned criss-cut fries were a tad overdone, making them overly crunchy. The service was nice but slow; it seemed like it took forever for the food to come out and we were HUNGRY. It was crowded, to be sure, with 4th of July weekend and the MMA fights and all, but it seemed like they should've anticipated this and staffed appropriately. Not a special destination in my book.

I was somewhat short on time and ate at Citizens. Omelet, coffee toast and a glass of milk. $37???? Seriously? $37???

The omelet was not hot so it had obviously sat out there before being brought to me. The food is decent at best but the prices are just silly. 

Drive or take an Uber/Lyft car 3.5 miles away to Mr. Mamas on S Jones for a superb breakfast or lunch.

Please do not go here. Worst food ever, and worse yet it is way overpriced. Paid 7.50 for frozen fries and another 11 for a soggy kale salad. Everything else on our table was horrible. Just do yourself a favor and go elsewhere or just go to sleep.
Awesome food! Try the fish and chips. We took Naomi's suggestions for meal and drinks and she was spot on! Great service and fun atmosphere. We will definitely visit again and request Naomi.

Went to Citizens the other day for breakfast/brunch with some colleagues. I've been here before and it was great the last time. They took great care of us! Tony was our server and he did great! Memorized everyone's order without writing anything! Normally, that bothers me, but he got it right! Everyone's orders came out exactly as desired. Drink glasses never dropped below half the entire meal!

The Crab Cake Benedict was a hit! That was a unique meal with a great taste! Very well cooked and the crab was actually crab! The breakfast burrito, banana waffle and the California omelet were stated to be delightful! However, the plate that matched the Crab Cake Benedict was the Brioche French Toast in a mixed berry syrup! Little on the sweet side, but delicious! I highly recommend this place for a good meal!

After a night at Foundation Room, me and my date had a case of the late night munchies. Citizens Kitchen and Bar was like a shining beacon that drew late diners in like a moth to a flame. Honestly though, it was our our only dining option at 1AM inside Mandalay Bay (thank goodness for 24 hour eating establishments, right?). Citizens was actually pretty crowded at this time of night. We only had a 5 minute wait to be seated, so no sweat.

Citizens is washed in bright lighting and white decor. Me and my gal pal were seated at a small table amid all the hustle and bustle. Our waiter promptly arrived to take our drink orders. When I got to looking at the menu, I quickly realized Citizens wasn't really a vegetarian friendly kind of place. I wasn't too worried because I was hungry but not like starving or anything so I was fine with getting an appetizer. Artichoke dip and chips it is! Unfortunately, I wasn't able to get a photo because my phone had died. :( The food came out in less than 10 minutes and was a good sized serving. I wasn't able to finish it all and left full. The dip had a great consistency and tasted great. Chips were yummy too.  

Worth a Return Visit?
I wouldn't go out if my way for Citizens, but if I find myself at Mandalay Bay in the wee hours of the morning I'd have no qualms about coming back.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #138

Items Selected:
Lavazza Coffee
Ultimate Tots Smothered & Covered - Cheddar, Chicken Gravy
The Big Meatball Parm - Beef, Pork, Grandma's Gravy, Ricotta
Kobe Chili Cheese Fries - Kobe Sirloin, Cheese Sauce, Waffle Fries
Chicken & Waffles - Bacon and Cheddar Waffle, Fried Chicken, Jalapeno Maple Syrup
Crème Brulee French Toast - Strawberries, Custard, Whipped Cream
Red Velvet Pancakes - Whipped Cream Cheese
Classic Carrot Cake - Cream Cheese Frosting
Reese's Peanut Butter Cookie
Chocolate Chip Cookie
