Perfectly fine with French food and well experienced with 'modernist' cuisine, both at local spots as well as internationally revered recipients of three Michelin Stars, but born in the Midwest and raised on anything but foie gras or liquid nitrogen cocktails suffice it to say that I'm a fan of the whole "upscale American" movement - the sort of food that takes the shake n' bake that mother used to make and turns it into something worth leaving the house for, the sort of food that critics love to critique even though they likely cannot make it as well themselves...the sort of food being served at Citizens Kitchen and Bar in Mandalay Bay.

Open 24/7, and still operated by Light Group despite the recent Hakkasan acquisition, it was just after 11am that a friend and I arrived at the Citizen hostess podium and dining as guests of the manager it was mere moments before we were led to a large four-top at the restaurant's back corner - the low-slung leather banquets of soft leather so comfortable that one might want to take a nap in them, particularly with the sounds of Dylan, Zeppelin, and Pink Floyd playing from the speaker system above.

Obviously a restaurant of dual personalities, the weekend brunch a casual and laid back affair while late nights are said to be a raucous mess of patrons exiting nearby Light Nightclub, it was under the watchful eye of a British gentleman named Tim that our meal took place and whether an effect of being known to the chef or simply the young man's mannerisms the service could not have been better - easily the best I've experienced in Mandalay Bay with plenty of whit and knowledge to compliment an eight plate feast with enough food that it could have fed two-to-three more.

Noting up front that the 'grab n' go' section is mostly devoid of housemade options, instead outsourcing all but the cookies and a few cakes due to kitchen constraints, it was with four savory dishes that the meal began and with plenty of par-for-the-course Lavazza to wash it all down the first round was a bit of a mixed bag - the chicken and waffles excessively priced at $24 with both items less crunchy than would be ideal, though the tots and waffle fries each proved crisp and quite capable of holding up to cheese and meats with substantial depth of flavor, an adult-fist of a meatball also standing out with impressive tenderness beneath a good sear in a bath of bright tomato sauce with grated cheese adding just enough salinity to make it all shine.

Moving next to a duo of sweets, it was somewhat surprising that the Red Velvet Pancakes were not to be found on the weekend menu, but with a simple request a substantial stack of three Frisbee-sized discs was produced with each proving exceptionally fluffy and loaded with cocoa beneath a checkerboard of cream cheese frosting, the neighboring French Toast another hefty option with a crunchy topcoat overlying four supple-centered slices dripping with custard as fresh cream and strawberries completed the picture - both plates on par with the best in the city, and the former amongst the best nationwide.

Unwilling to forgo desserts, and as such requesting the rest of the pancakes be packed up, it was with little hesitation that a slice of carrot cake was ordered and clocking in at probably 12-ounces the four layer slice would prove not only enormous but also outstanding, the moist base bespeckled with carrots, raisins, and nuts amidst a bold spice heavy in cinnamon and nutmeg - a pair of freshly made cookies proving equally delicious and thus leaving one to wonder just how much better Citizens could be if it brought the whole pastry department in house.

You know your in the Mandlay Bay and you want to get something that is not going to totally screw up your expense account.  Overall the standard fare is good and stick to the basics of a bar and grill type of food and you're good for a good meal.  Yes you're still in the hotel so it is going to cost you, I had a nice big meal-size salad and it was enough for a good lunch.

I sat at the bar and a very friendly bar tender kept my ice tea filled up the whole time.
I had the lasagna, garlic bread, belline and artichoke dip appetizer.  The lasagna had short rib meat and was so yummy!!!   Would definitely recommend it!  Tony was our waiter and did a great job!

My favorite thing about this place?  It's open 24 hours!!  It's pretty awesome when your in Vegas knowing you'll be up all night and hungry at any time.  

It's basic comfort food so nothing to adventurous.  I ordered the BBQ Chicken Salad and dang it was a freaking huge portion!  There were 5 different portions to it and was separated by avocado slices.  The waiter was very helpful to the table and it was excellent service.

Enjoyed this place for dinner. For what we ordered, the serving was huge. Got the nachos and filled us up (2.5 people because one person only had a few bites) We didn't even need anything else really! Drinks were strong. Waitress was nice!

Skip it, skip it, skip it.  Food was just okay, service was less than okay, and the prices for the food were the equivalent to spending steak money on a 10% patty.  When my wife asked the server what was on tap, he said "nothing" and walked away with no suggestions,

If you find yourself stuck at Mandalay Bay on a Sunday night, understand:
They know it too.  

They shut everything down but this hole, so you have no choice on where to go.

Tip, order a Pizza or walk to Jack in the Box!

This place is bomb. I stayed at the Mandalay for 4 nights. I could have hiked it over to the food court for a pleble $5 Nathan's hot dog, but for $15 for a sandwich 24/7 365, why now. The French dip is insane. I had it twice. Also had a cold turkey sandwich. Very legit. Also tons of pastries etc. Prices are not too bad, food is quality.

On a whim my wife and I visited Citizens.  It was.. well... just okay.

It was also vastly overpriced.

My wife very much enjoyed her turkey avocado sandwich.  She said it was quite tasty and really loved the bread, sprouts, and muenster cheese.  She's not normally a potato salad person, but she even liked that.  The only thing she didn't like was the price.  It was $17.  Were it $11-14, that would have been better.

As for me... I wasn't much of a fan of my moco loco.  In fact, it might be the worst I've ever had.  The burger patty had no personality to it.  The rice was undercooked.  The gravy wasn't plentiful enough.  Also, it was $17.  Should have been closer to $11.  At least the over-easy egg was nice.

Overall, wouldn't go back unless it were in a pinch.

5/8/16: Just don't.  Yeah, it's the only restaurant in Mandalay Bay open late (past 10pm ?).  And no, nothing wrong with the service or the environment.  But really.... better to walk out onto the strip and take a short stroll to try your luck with fast food than to empty your wallet here.

Yeah, the food was that bad and that expensive...

1. Chicken Soup $10.00:  Ever had a $10 soup?  I have.  I believe one was a farm-to-table asparagus wonderland of flavors.  And I've had some others at various ultra-high-end restaurants, most of which very special and very delicious.  But... diluted canned chicken soup with some extra vegetables and spaghetti thrown in?  Seriously?--ten bucks!?  1/10

2. Frisco Melt $16.00 "sourdough, grilled onions, swiss, thousand island dressing":  And if the chicken soup didn't blow your brains, well, here we have a burger for $16... how do they top the ten dolla' canned soup with spaghetti?--with multi-day-old leftover over-cooked cardboard cheap frozen patties.  I couldn't eat it.  Took 3 bites and threw the rest away.  1/10

I dunno, maybe if you're high and couldn't make it to White Castle?...

Otherwise, just turn around.  Just don't.

1/5

PS--It appears the manager left a comment to this review with her email.  I want to note that I did in fact write her an email, but am still waiting on a response.  If there is a status update, I will update you here.

#american #vegas

If you are at Mandalay bay this is only one of a few places you can get a late nigh meal. The other is an Irish Pub in the mall between Mandalay and the Luxor. Anyway went here twice. It's usually packed even on a week night, but there was a convention in town so that may have added to it. Place is quiet and quaint compared the crazy casino, bar, and rock band stage that is blaring outside. The touchscreen menu outside said they had hamburgers but I guess there grill was broken, kind of disappointing because the burgers are the reason we came in. Anyway I got a plate of a dozen wings, my girl got a plate of wings and I got two beers $70!. I know Vegas is expensive so I guess it is what it is. My girlfriend and I both weren't able to finish our food, maybe because we really didn't want wings or because we weren't that hungry, so I guess one plate would have done for both of us.

Eh, it's okay. It's a hit or miss.  When you're staying at the Mandalay Bay, it's late night and there's nothing else to eat, this is the only option (besides room service but I honestly think room service and this place are one in the same.)

The 3 times I had to eat here was all different, experience wise and food wise. I only utilized the take out counter, thinking that this would be the "faster" route but it's not necessarily.  Price wise it's all going to be pricey because you're at the Mandalay/on the strip, but again if you haven't eaten all day and you have not other options, a $16 sandwich is suddenly doable and you're at the mercy of their service. I'll sum up my review in my visits:

1st visit - Was 10pm, went in to grab a quick snack of fruit and a muffin. Really wanted ice cream but they don't serve that. Was expensive but at least service as quick as nothing needed to be prepped and there wasn't much of a line. Muffin was good, too. 

2nd visit - Was about 1pm, hubby ran in to grab a reuben sandwich, not sure how long his wait was but that reuben was way too salty! Could only handle 2 bites, not a fan...

3rd visit - It was 11pm and I have no idea what was happening but it took them 20 minutes to even acknowledge my husband standing there at the take out counter! My husband has the patience of a saint and saw that they were extremely understaffed but why the hell does it take the manager 15 minutes to make one espresso? The poor dude who ordered the espresso just seemed amazed at the whole process too, but you can't badger someone who's touching your food, ya know? There was people just standing there waiting to pay for a canned soda and the one of only two employees behind the counter just said, "take it" and waived them off.  The more annoying thing? That there was other workers in that restaurant meandering around the take out area! Come on now, help them out! 

Anyways, I was ready to leave after the first 20 mins but my husband was really hungry and again, we're at the mercy of being out in BFE Mandalay at midnight. After being in there for over 30 minutes and not even having anything to show for it, I forced my husband to leave and bought him a banana and some Dibs ice cream in the sundries store to quiet his stomach until we could get a proper meal in the morning. 

Thank goodness we were checking out the next day as well.

Citizens is located within Mandalay Bay and is a great place for a low key lunch or laid back dinner. The concept is open with indoor and "outdoor" (walking area of hotel)seating as well as to-go options. Aesthetics could be described as a classy American diner.

When my coworker and I landed at night, we were starving and quickly decided on Citizens. I went for the French Onion Soup and a side of the Mac and Cheese. Be warned! The French Onion Soup is not meant to be an appetizer. It comes in a very large bowl and was a meal in and of itself-I'm sad to say much of it was wasted, as delicious as it was. The mac and cheese was also quite good. I also had a glass of red wine-which also came in a huge glass. Ok wine, but not worth the price tag. 

Days later, when my husband and I were enjoying the pool, we were looking for food options and decided on Citizens for take out by the pool. We opted for the chicken and cheese quesadillas which came with sides of guacamole, sour cream, and pico de gallo. The portions were large once again and the quesadillas were excellent! 

If you're staying within Mandalay or an MGM resort, you may charge it to your room, along with any other restaurants.

They were out of Swiss cheese the entire first round of the 2016 NCAA tournament, when every grocery store in Las Vegas could instantly replenish them.  If you want Mayonnaise, salt or pepper on a sandwich they will not apply it themselves and will instead give you the bread, cheese and meat and force you to make your own sandwich... That said, it wasn't bad or over priced and I ate there a few times.

Didn't liked my experience. 
Waiting time was to long- we got our appetizer about 30 min after we order it. Chicken strips was moist on inside but really hard on the outside. My husband liked his lasagna it was big and testy. I order meatloaf, it Didn't say anywhere in a menu how spicy it's going to be. When I mentioned it to waiter his response was its probably that green peppers chopped inside. I couldn't eat it I got a few bites of it and ate mushed potato. They didn't offer to change my order or to take it off the bill or even give us a discount. Not even sorry u go home hungry.

I visited Citizens for a late dinner after checking in. The restaurant is pretty big so there was no wait to be seated. We sat in the "outdoor" area, which was nice to people watch and at least have the illusion of being outside. 

We had the artichoke dip, which was among the best I've had and was served with both homemade tortilla chips and grilled pita. My friend is a vegetarian and ordered a veggie sandwich off menu. I had the Mahi Mahi fish tacos. The sandwich was huge and loaded with good veggies. I was barely able to finish two of my three tacos, as the portion was also large on my plate.

The service was sort of slow but our server was friendly. The only bummer is that, since the mini frig in the room is pre-stocked and full, we had no way to take our leftovers with us. Overall, the portions were almost too big, but the price was still reasonable, and I enjoyed the view of the restaurant courtyard area. Citzens is a good stop for a quick, simple meal.

I honestly don't know how this place place only has a couple of stars! Over May 19th, me and a big group of woman went to vegas for my soon to be sister in laws bachelorette weekend. 

It was Saturday night and they needed to be somewhere by 11pm at the latest. Having 12 women, getting a table ANYWHERE was nearly impossible without AT LEAST an hour wait. We were just walking around trying to find a place to take us and we asked the hostess for a menu and asked her the wait time for 12. Just then the manager, Matt, walked up and told us politely it would probably be about an hour wait. With the group not wanting to wait that long, we said thank you and started to give our menus back. 

Just then he looked over at the "closed" lunch side of Citizen, and stopped us. He says "You know what ladies, let me set up a table for you guys! Dont go anywhere"  
So we watched him go over to the "closed" side and set a table of 12 JUST FOR US!! We had a great server (and i feel horrible that I cant remember her name) 

She was attentive and took care of us! EVERYONE was extremely happy with their food. It may seem like steep pricing but the portions are pretty awesome! 

To make things better, he was constantly checking in on us to make sure we were being taken care of and happy with our food. He even brought to HUGE pieces of cake and ice cream for the bride to be (and the other half of the table too :) ) 

Thank you Matt for making our visit to your restaurant memorable and being SO accommodating! 

I cant wait to eat there again on my next visit to Vegas!

I had the triple bacon burger which was a standard burger with 3 strips of bacon... There is something to be said about truth in advertising. I had the hamhock mac n cheese. The pasta was a bit over cooked for my taste. However, you do get the smokieness of the hamhock. If the pasta was bit less overdone, it would be one of my favorite mac n cheese plates. The burger is juicy with everything served on the side, mayo, lettuce, tomato, onion and pickles are on the side. You add whatever you want to add to it.

We were heading to Starbucks but decided to check Citizens out for coffee since it was something new. So disappointed! First off, we waited in line for almost 30 minutes. I understand, Vegas is busy and everyone wants coffee BUT the line isn't long because this place is busy, the line is long because the service is so slow. You think a place that offers coffee and breakfast would be better staffed in the morning. There was only one girl working the register for the to-go cafe and restaurant. She was supper sweet and it wasn't her fault the wait was so long.  So it was finally our turn...Yay! Right? Well, we waited for a very long time to be told that they were out of mocha lattes. Wth?  Ugh. Go to Starbucks!

Citizens Kitchen and Bar would have gotten just 2 stars from me, but a couple of items are able to bump it up to 3 stars.  First of all, if you opt to dine in for dinner, at least the couple of times that I've gone (Sunday after 10pm), it gets really LOUD because of the band that plays just across the way.  Sometimes you just want to wind down with some good conversation, but you can't really do that with the extremely loud music playing.  If you have a headache, forget about coming here!  When we went back recently, we opted to just take our food to go.  Anyway, I like a cozy ambiance or a place with a trendy/sexy vibe; Citizens has neither.  So no problem not dining in that time.

On both of my visits, service was meh.  The hostess the time we dined in started to seat us out on their patio area closest to the live band. When we requested a quieter table inside, she sat us at a table right next to the patio making little difference in the noise level :/  There's definitely no service with a smile at Citizens, at least from my experience.

As for the food, I definitely wasn't impressed on my first visit.  I wasn't too hungry, so I opted for their french onion soup and got to taste my dining companion's penne prosciutto.  Again, meh.  Even though we weren't impressed on that visit, we went back to Citizens on a recent trip to Vegas since we were staying at the Four Seasons next door and our options were limited for late night dining.  We ordered at their to-go counter, and I chose their cheese quesadilla this time and their salted caramel parfait.  Their quesadilla I didn't care for but I did like the parfait.  I ended up coming back a few days later to pick up a blondie.  It had some toffee in it and was tasty overall and it did not disappoint!  (I forgot to take pics of the food I picked up to go.)

Overall, I would recommend Citizens for their treats at the to-go counter, or if it's late and you're not in the mood for fast food and there are no other options nearby.  Otherwise, I wouldn't go out of my way to have a meal here.

I don't know why this place has such a bad rap. We had the kale salad with added chicken and an order of the fruit salad and it came to $27 which was way better than pretty much anywhere else in Vegas and it was healthy!

Most of the restaurants in and on the strip come with their hefty price tag for convenience, no doubt! When friends or family come to Vegas and stay in Mandalay Bay we do recommend Citizens!

There's a little bit of something for everyone! From sandwiches to salads, vegetarian to meat-lover, appetizer to entre, it works for everyone! 

I love their kale and brown rice salad! You can add salmon or another protein to it (well-done salmon is my spirit animal!) and you're solid! Their artichoke and spinach dip isn't too creamy and packs a perfect punch for small bites everyone can share. 

Their wine and craft beer selection is just right along with having cocktails that fit the happy hour vibe.

As with most places on the strip, the service is under par which is my reason for not rating this place higher. Our server wasn't very attentive or friendly this time around but I've had better service in the bar area.

First off, a disclaimer.  I would like to point out that this experience happened while I was high on acid. This fact does not have any bearing on the specific rating of the food in general that will follow. 

We entered the restaurant. I was greeted at the bar by a man that was quite muscularity toned and had a curly fancy mustache. He had a mildy creepy vibe about him, but he was nice. At this point I figured that I would just order a Reuben sandwich (one of my favorite go to's lately) 
The food came and though the exterior was only lukewarm, the interior sandwich was what seemed like 600+ degrees and nearly resulted in 3rd degree oral burns. As I bit into the sandwich, it had the consistency and taste of what I can only imagine a mixture of elmers glue, sawdust and corned beef meat flavoring would taste like. How can you fuck up a Reuben sandwich this badly!?

 It felt  like I was chewing sandpaper in my mouth. Remember now, my mouth is already burned by the hot coals of mysterious corned beef meat dust.  Unfortunately, this was all happening on top of loss of my overall perception of time and space. It was utterly horrible and terrifying as this moment started to replay over and over in my head. Mere seconds felt like hours.

I had to work very very VERY hard to eat through the sandwich that not only was shit, but also very highly priced. I proceeded to eat it because I was starving and wasn't going to be able to eat for a while. After complaining about the food with my buddy and also seeing that a fellow customer had walked out and complained about their food, we went onto the venue. It was at this point that I suddenly felt nauseously ill and proceeded to go to the bathroom to vomit profusely and watch this piece of shit sandwich enter the toilet in a plasmatic form all while mentally transforming through different layers of human existence and universes in my head due to the trip. After I had removed the majority of the sandwich from my system I realized that I had a little bit of coke left from the previous day.  I did a couple Trump bumps before exiting the bathroom.

Overall for food and atmosphere, I confidently rate this restaurant a - 1 out of 5. 

EDIT. I just remembered that I had forgotten how shitty the cold French fries were. -5 out of 5. That's zero for you math geeks out there.

I was staying at Mandalay Bay for a conference and tried many of the restaurants there. Citizens was one of the better ones. Firstly, the food is very good. The cob salad is perfect. I liked their clean fresh decor. 

The service was mixed. Depending of who's working there, you may or may not have a good experience. I often walked by to see if I Katie was working at the bar. If she was, I'd definitely walk in for a meal. You need more like her Citizens.

Citizens Kitchen & Bar is located inside the Mandalay Bay hotel. They offer the typical American fare. The interesting thing about this place that I did not know at first is that they have an actual restaurant and they also have a to-go area where all of the salads and sandwiches are basically pre-made and ready to be sold. I came here twice on my most recent visit and ate once at the restaurant and I also got some food to-go the other time.

When I did eat at the restaurant, the service was great. The host was very nice and so was the server. The manager even stopped by to ask how my meal was going. They definitely take customer service seriously here which is a good thing!

Food:
Chicken Cobb Salad- Chicken, cheese, egg, cucumber, tomato and bacon. The salad was pretty good and refreshing. They also give you a choice of what dressing you want, but I stuck with the typical cobb salad dressing which is bleu cheese. $18

Turkey Avocado- Turkey, cheese, sprouts, tomato, lettuce, avocado, lemon aioli on a cranberry walnut bread. A really good sandwich for the most part. It tasted really healthy which is good since I always eat the worst food while I'm in Vegas. $18

French Dip Steak- Thin sliced prime rib, caramelized onions, provolone cheese and au jus. Served with cole slaw and a pickle. This was probably one of the best tasting French dips that I've had. Towards the end it started to be a little on the salty side, but overall I thought it was a delicious sandwich. $19

Typically, I would probably lower it to 3 stars since the prices are pretty high for the amount of food, but it is Vegas and nothing in Vegas is cheap. I've spent over $10 on a lousy piece of pizza before so I'd rather spend $20+ on a delicious sandwich! I would definitely recommend Citizens Kitchen & Bar to anyone that is at the Mandalay Bay and is looking for your typical American food.

Came to Citizen, for a quick dinner with family.


At 7pm on a Thursday they weren't super packed, they seated us immediately. I didn't drink however, a member of my party enjoyed their lemon drop martini. Our waitress, was very attentive and quick!
I order the Turkey Burger which was massive ( I added some pepper jack cheese to seal the deal) .I quickly chowed down and couldn't attempt to even eat dessert. I left happy and fell into a food coma less than an hour later.

Ate at the bar side on the 26th and had the best service out of any restaurant we ate at all week. Are server Joyce was awesome. Are drinks always full, never sat with dirty dishes, even brought us new napkins after we had the wings. Was recommended by my cousin to have the hot wings, I wasn't disappointed. They were the best wings i have had in a long time. Also had the stir fry and it was pretty good. Cant wait to go back next time I'm in Vegas.

food and service were amazing! a little pricey but everything on the strip is.. just comes with the territory. i ordered the eggs benedict with their signature breakfast potatoes and i've been full for hours! super satisfied with this restaurant and definitely recommend

4/29/2018 2am this review is for the the cashier, with glasses, earrings and had a very rude sassy attitude. After waiting 30 mins in line, I proceeded to order a sandwich and the rudely said we don't serve sandwiches and you have to order from a certain menu. I calmly asked why there was no sign that stated  this. He rudely said he was the sign and tried to obnoxiously shake my hand. This "guy" obviously does not know anything about customer services. He should quit but I'm sure since he is working this crap job he can't do anything better. If you can't do a simple minimal job you will not make it in life. Good luck.

Got to eat here with my coworkers after we finished walking about MAGIC.

We got seated in about 15mins. Thought that was quite fast. We all ordered appetizers since we werent super hungry. We ordered the waffle fries that came with gravy and bacon bits...yea If you plan to order it, dont... Why? Wholly cow, it is heavy on the sodium. So the ones that got soaked in the gravy is not edible :(. The other items we ordered were pretty generic, chicken fingers (basically just fried chicken strips) and a cup or veggies (you know the ones you get in the frozen aisle in the market?)

If we were crying over the appetizers already, imagine the main course!!

I love this place! Stopped by in here today looking for breakfast and the decor caught my attention right away. My server Chris was very attentive and made great reccomendations. The food was really good. I recommend the ultimate breakfast cause the pancakes were delicious. I also got a iced coffee to go. I will definitely be back next time I'm in town!

This place is overpriced and has meh service.   I ordered the croissant BLT and Turkey.  It was dry and just tasted boring compared to to others. It was expensive $17 for a sandwich.  The burger was also dry. Service was slow and not very enthusiastic.
The two hosteses in the front were not friendly at all.

So this is probably the most affordable place to eat inside Mandalay Bay . This eatery has indoor seating as well as patio seating . They are located next to Lupo restaurant .

I wanted a low carb option for breakfast so I stopped by to take a look at their quick to go offerings . They have pastries , salads , coffees .

I ordered a Cobb salad to go which cost about $11. It had lettuce , cubes of Swiss cheese , bacon , eggs , scallions , tomatoes . It was a decent size and the nice cashier gave me an extra ranch dressing for free . The salad looked a bit messy compared to the other ones I saw in display case but it tasted pretty good nonetheless .

The caffe latte was $5 and made to order . It was a delicious hot coffee that was made well .

I'd stop by again to try out breakfast items if I stay in this hotel again .

I came here with a group of friends for lunch and overall would give it 3.5 stars.  It is your typical casual Las Vegas lunch spot with American Food.
Food: Portions are large and for the price it is a pretty good value.  
Teriyaki salmon bowl:  filling, but the salmon portion was very small compared to the huge amount of brown rice.
BLT sandwich: Tons of bacon and my friend said it was very tasty.
Fish and Chips- the piece of fish is enormous and my friend really enjoyed the dish.
The fries here are delicious and they have a good wine/beer list.

Customer Service: very friendly and accommodating.  They were easily able to split checks for us.

Overall I would not go out of my way to eat here as there are multiple restaurants in all the Las Vegas hotels that are very comparable.  But if you happen to be in the Mandalay Bay hotel and want a casual spot to eat at, this would be a good spot.

The food here wasn't bad, but it wasn't particularly good either. Pair that with the relatively high prices ($9 breakfast burrito, $9 smoothies, etc) and it's not a particularly high value proposition. 

The smoothie I got was the "Green..." something? I can't remember. But it had Kale and Avocado in it, and wasn't bad. My stomach wasn't feeling to great from a heavy dinner the night before, and it had a soothing effect. However it wan't the best kale smoothy I've had, and was probably the most expensive I've ever had at $9, so ehhh... 

The breakfast burrito wasn't particularly good, but it was hearty and satisfying. They are pre-made in the morning, so you can't change anything about them. And while they are pre-made they need to be grilled to order, so they take quite some time. The worst of both worlds overall, but still was the best option for a relatively quick and hearty breakfast in the morning. 

Still, we stopped by here almost every morning that we were staying at Mandalay bay for a business conference, as there really wasn't much competition for quick morning eats in the vicinity. 

I would likely stop by and get food here if I was attending morning conference sessions at the Mandalay Bay conference center again, but probably not outside of that circumstance.

We ordered food from their cafe's counter. When we sat down at one of their tables, a server came to tell us that, because we didn't order directly from a server, we couldn't sit at a table. 95% of their tables were completely free. The server then reiterated "you have to leave"

Save your money for somewhere that doesn't kick out its customers.

Ate here with some friends whilst waiting for a show at the House of Blues; since parking in the Mandalay Bay either involves coming a little early and grabbing a spot next to the escalators in the parking garage or coming on time, driving around for thirty minutes as you scour every level of the monolithic parking structure trying to find a place you can only barely fit your compact car into because the rented Hummers on either side are straddling the lines, we opted to come early and have a bite while we waited.
The service was fairly good, though my iced tea ran out a few times during the meal. It wasn't hugely busy, but our waiter did have several tables concurrently and I can forgive that oversight. He was still friendly and courteous. It's service that sets most any restaurant on the Strip apart, since the food is usually pretty decent but often over-priced.
The food was quite good; I had the double burger that's on two grilled cheese sandwiches, which is to say that my fiance wondered whether we'd make it to the show or not when the ambulance was called. I survived by some miracle, and came out of it with a smile on my face and half the burger in a to-go box so that I could finish killing myself later after NASA got back to me with the calorie count calculation for the thing.
Overall, I'd probably come back here; it was a pretty friendly little place and you got a decent amount of food for the money. Yes, the prices are higher than an off-strip restaurant, but the portions are still good.

This is basically a counter style food place.  Everything is fairly fresh but all pre-packaged. The coffee selections are oddly named but the coffee is decent.  My son did not like the tuna salad at all but scarfed down an apple cinnamon muffin easily enough. My Cobb salad was chintzy with the good stuff and used iceberg lettuce, ack. 

It filled the need but barely.

For the food, I would've of given them 3 stars. I had the tuna salad sandwich. But the service is horrible. I was sitting inside with my daughter because I had just ordered my sandwich and she was eating her donut. I was drinking my hot chocolate. The gentlemen who called my name to give me my order decided to approach me & tell me to get my daughter and sit outside!! Because I wasn't dining in. Very unprofessional and douche bag! Just because I wasn't dining in, didn't give him a right to treat me that way! Never again am I even stepping into that place!!!!

Great breakfast place, although awfully pricey. They make a solid California omelette that'll keep you feeling well fed for hours, which is great because if you're traveling for work it'll also eat up a good chunk of your per diem. I ordered juice and coffee also and believe I was at $25 before tip.

Like most people mentioned previously, it's mediocre food with Vegas price. It's convenient because it's open 24/7, and you don't need a reservation, but the food is just ok. I had the crab cake benedict for breakfast and it was not very good, and the soups I had for dinner were super salty (chicken noodle & french onion) to the point of being inedible. Would I eat here if u had a choice? No. Is is convenient? Yes.

I give kudos to this place because it's the only eatery (besides Subway) that's open 24 hours in Mandalay Bay or The Delano. Note: the evening menu does change and doesn't provide a lot of options. I ordered a cheese quesadilla which was yummy and fresh, but something I could make at home. 

We ate there for dinner and the crispy shrimp
On the appetizer menu was so delicious! I'd go back just to order that. We also had the Mac and cheese, which was tasty, but comparable to other places. We also had the spinach dip and mashed potatoes which I wouldn't order again. Tasteless and the spinach dip said it had artichoke, but the pieces were so small and infrequent I can't even consider it to have artichoke. 

Service both times was mediocre. My opinion: go there when all other options are exhausted. And thanks Citizens for staying open for the drunk people!

Okay. Food is pretty good. Seating is efficient. Biggest issue is customization of your order. They ask about how you want your eggs but the result doesn't match with the results. Went here yesterday and today. Yesterday I ordered two poached eggs, medium. I received one very easy and one very hard. Today, they were both in the easy side. Lady next to me similarly complained that he fried eggs were under cooked for what she ordered. I think this gets lost in their desire to turn over tables quic

Located inside Mandalay, I was in search of a good breakfast. This place was ayyyy-ok, but not the greatest. I ordered the corn beef hash skillet and was a little disappointed on how salty and greasy it tasted. I know, it was corn beef hash, but I was hoping for a little more pizzaz.
The coffee though was really good. I am happy I did not stand in the long Starbucks line in the morning.
Next time, I am not sure if I will visit this place again since it was not that memorable.

I was surprised to find this was the only place open to eat at 1:30 am on my last visit to Mandalay Bay.  This used to be my hotel and I always thought there were more options.

Anyways, I ended up eating here 2x within 4 hours.  

You can sit down in the restaurant and have a decent menu available to you or you can order from the counter.  The latter is better, over priced smaller bites.  The former has a wider selection - Vegas strip priced diner food.

I wish there were more options.  But at 4:30 in the morning after being up all night and still wasted, this place ain't bad.  

p.s.  the pastries at the counter are good.

My wife and I consider this restaurant our favorite in Las Vegas. You may find it peculiar, however for $49 having prime rib that's like butter in your mouth is absolutely ridiculous. The deal also comes with a glass of wine a Caesar salad as well as great waitstaff. It is also of note the fish and chips or equally as awesome. 
Every time we come into Las Vegas, we always ask for Bailey to serve our table. She is absolutely amazing and we highly recommend that you see her if you decide to go by this establishment.

I ate at Citizens twice on this Vegas trip. Once for late night and once for breakfast. Citizens is open 24/7. Good for breakfast, lunch, dinner, late night, etc. 

We never had to wait too long for a table. Both visit's wait staff were cool. Very attentive and nice. 

The food isn't bad either. A bit expensive but what else do you expect from a restaurant inside a hotel (Mandalay Bay). 

- Loco Moco was good, needed more gravy over the beef patty though. 

- Cheesecake was awesome...check into Yelp for a free cheesecake with your entree. 

- Citizens' breakfast (pancakes super good). 

Two good experiences here. Redeem your M Life card or use your M Life points.

Attracted by the idea of comfort food done upscale brought us to Citizens hoping to find food akin to some of the similar concepts around town.  Although the decor is actually quite nice and the pastries do look tasty (we didn't sample them) we were utterly underwhelmed by the delivery.  

Our server was friendly and honest( very much appreciated) and responded to our requests for suggestions very well but we got the impression our server had sampled all the offerings and was having a real struggle recommending anything to us.  

I started off with a drink called American Pie (you guessed it, apple flavored) which was the best thing I had all night, right down to the ring of cinnamon around the martini glass.

We shared a spinach artichoke dip which had a sprinkle of parmesan on top.  The chips were a mixed bag of tortilla chips and pita chips.  The problem were some chips were soggy and stale tasting and some were crisp and fresh. The pita was mostly hard with a few soft bites.  The dip itself was lacking in flavor but tasted ok.  

For our meal, at the server's suggestion we split an entree due to large portion size.   To our delight, the split entree was brought on two separate plates.  Some establishments do not separate it for you and I thought that was a nice touch.

However the blue cheese burger was quite disappointing.  The bun was boring, the burger dry and over cooked, and the blue cheese had no distinguishable flavor from a goat cheese.   The mac and cheese with hamhock also lacked any identifiable cheese flavor with only a light hint of a mild cheddar.  The side of fries were soggy matchstick size fries.

I expected more from an establishment in the Mandalay Bay.

There are a few interesting menu items but when we asked about them, the server hesitated to recommend them.

They do have a hangover brunch with $25 bottomless mimosas.
They also have a 24 burgers in 24 minutes challenge for $40.00 unless you eat them all and then it is free.  

I can't imagine I will be back unless it is just to sample a dessert.

Some of the most overpriced bland food ever.  The breakfast platter had what they called poached eggs, terrible.

Service was just average.

Waiter was really nice, it is convenient because it is opened 24 hours. Ordered fish and chips, it was a HUGE portion the fries were good and the fish was decent. The prices are a little on the pricey side but that is expected.

We ended up here after going to the shark thingie in Mandalay Bay. We were 5 adults and three kids aged between 10 months and 3 years. Food is overpriced and subpar but it was not a surprise. My friend asked if it was possible to get bolognese for her 10 months old. The waitress didn't even blink to tell her "we don't do that". We then asked another waiter for it and then our waitress came out again that she spoke to the chef and he agreed to make a one time exception and prepare a small portion of it but that it will be $7. We didn't care about that - she could have/should have said that from the beginning. Then, after a lifetime the famous order came out and it was super spicy. It was for a 10 month old. We haven't touched it - but of course we were charged and we paid the $7. We took it home and it ended up in the trash.

Overall, I would give 2 stars for the food - nothing special, overpriced, and over cooked, but edible, and 1 for service. There's nothing more annoying than not getting any service when dining. 
Would not eat here again.

Vegas, in many, many ways, has it all wrong. Their motto should not be that it's some sort of city-wide ziplock sealing so tightly that not even vapors can escape, the metaphorically alluded-to "municipality as black hole". No. Their motto should be one more truthful and perhaps more pithy. That new motto of which I speak would go something like this: Nothing exceeds like excess.

And perhaps no place encapsulates that better than this place. Want to know what's in the dessert case? Well you can just walk (or waddle) yourself over there and go look. The dessert menu has five things on it (order any of these and they're huge). The dessert case has probably 5X that, but damn if they will tell you what that is. The menu itself has a number of things on it. Order any of them but appetizers and they come on a cookie sheet. This not only does wonders for the carefully crafted ambiance, but adds a flair of mystery to things. For instance, I can't begin to imagine the food waste this place must go through, but I'm betting they toss a lot more than anyone ever eats. 

Actually, given the flavor, this is almost a guarantee. I can almost hear you smacking your lips right now? You mean to say we can get a bunch of substandard - and here, this word is best - "grub", served by some very smarmy prick who looks vaguely like Fred Arminsen, but is far from funny or even amusing (wait, maybe it is Fred Arminsen!), yet has a full-tilt condescending attitude that all but insists we should be grateful he can be deigned to bother with us mere mortals. Maybe that's it. Maybe the wait staff in this elegantly laid out pristine and serene little oasis from the flood of body odor and stale cigarette smoke isn't here for us, but rather that we're here for them. Now I know why I flew here. I wonder if it would be an insult if I tipped 150%...I'm in but I have to get back out somehow.

Then again, it's a great deal, if you get a lot, right? It may be expensive, but at least it's mediocre! Expensive is the nature of the biz in Vegas and comes with the territory and so, apparently, does throwing any old thing in front of people.  This place clearly doesn't care about patrons coming in and out and is one of the more jaded places I've seen. Maybe they ought to just throw all in and go for "Citizen" by way of the old Soviet Union. I'm thinking a food line with metal bowls and plates. The only thing served will be potato soup with cabbage and garlic, along with a small roll that may or may not be moldy. Drink choices are cheap vodka or brackish water. If nothing else, it would at least accurately mirror the contempt for the customers this place clearly seems to have.

Also, like everything else in Vegas, this place is loud.
Love this place! Staff are super friendly and hospitable! Wells and Heather were awesome! Great food! Great staff ! Great service!!!!

The most memorable thing about my experience here on Saturday night was I thought the light fixtures were cool.  We tried a couple of apps: chicken quesadillas and Kobe beef chili fries and nothing really good or comforting about them.  The server was nice enough but brought  the check without a pen and after seeing us looking for a pen could not find one himself and or ignored that we needed one.  I thought food was slow coming out of the kitchen as well.  It is sad this is only late night option available at Mandalay Bay.

45 minutes for a to go order.

Don't come here after midnight, unless you're willing to wait an awfully long time for subpar food.

Worst service and rudest people I've come into contact with in Vegas. Ordered a breakfast sandwich to go. The girl said it would be out in 5-10 minutes. At 17 minutes I tried to get anyone's attention. Finally I asked someone to check on my order and her response was. I hen it's ready we bring it out.

Overpriced for.mediocre food. It seems they are more concerned with creating this hipster draw than serving food that warrants the price.  



The servers try hard but there is a weak link in this chain from kitchen to table

Let's start on a positive note. It's open 24 hours. The atmosphere can sometimes be fun. But mostly it's loud. The furniture is not comfortable and it's overly crowed. The food isn't the best but if u are hungry at 4 in the morning then it will do.

I love this restaurant and especially their wonderful to-go counter.  The hostess always greet and are very polite as well as the counter staff. On several occasions the manager working named Margaret or Marjorie (not sure but she works morning and afternoon) has been extremely rude and unfriendly. She doesn't smile or make eye contact with anyone and looks miserable. It's very sad to see someone dislike their job as much as she does and I'm sure her employees pick up on it. Hire someone friendly they are supposed to turn around bad experiences not create them.

KEEP YOUR RECEIPT!  I left my receipt and the bartender added a nice $10 bonus tip for herself.  My credit card was charged $10 more than the total I wrote in (with a 20% tip I might add).  Shady stuff...

Just stopped here for banana, coffee and a donut.  Banana was good, as was donut.  Coffee tasted a little burnt.

At least it wasn't too expensive.

We didn't even get to eat here becuase the host staff was so dismissive and rude when we went to eat breakfast. We arrived at 11 am and were militantly told breakfast ended at 10:45 by two people who were standing side by side reapeating everything each other were saying. I am not a dense person, I don't need two people telling me the same thing over and over again and then walking away from me before I can even take a look at the lunch menu. Do not come here asking for breakfast any later than 10:45 or you'll get ganged up on. Will not ever try to go here again. We ended up at Seabreeze Cafe, it was amazing so everything worked out for the best.

This place is yummy! We decided not to do brunch, but lunch instead. Here's the breakdown:
Signature Bellini: very very yummy. We ordered a second round
Queso and chips: the dip was very tasty and not too spicy. However, the chips were stale. We asked our waiter to bring fresh ones, and the 2nd batch was not much better. 
French dip: overflowing with meat and caramelized onions, used a knife and fork. Very tasty, recommend for sure. 
BBQ salad: typical salad. Didn't have much dressing, but didn't really need it. The toppings were tasty. 

Would we come back again: for sure
Stayed at the Delano and ate breakfast here. Great service from Robert and nicely prepared omelette and ham/eggs. A bit pricey but higher end ingredients used. Nice job!

This was a great place to eat although it was inside a casino. The food was delicious, the prices were high, but the cocktails were good. Service was excellent. I had a great breakfast as well as a nice bar menu.

Lotus was a super waitress!  She didn't even write the order down and got our order perfect-- with six of us.

My mahi mahi tacos were excellent but I had to eat them with a fork because they were so stuffed full of food!

My husband had the meatloaf and it was the best I ever tasted.

Five stars!

Fish and chips were plain and  fries were soggy. BBQ ribs were more flavorful than the fish and chips but doesn't compare to other places. Ordered a lemonade and the cups were beyond dirty and when I asked for another cup because of how dirty it was, he came back with another cup but it was just as dirty as if he took a washcloth and rubbed off the dirt. Beyond disgusted. Wouldn't come back. The bill was a whopping $65 for some plain food.
A great casual place to grab a drink during the day at The Mandalay Bay. Very nice atmosphere and vibe. While we didn't eat this time, we have our last trip and the food is spot on!

I went here with a group of girls, late night, and wearing everyday jeans and t-shirts. The server was very nice, but the service sucked. Not to mention that they set him up with three tables at the same time. After we ordered our food, it took them over half an hour to get our food to us. Other tables were being served before us even though they got there after us with the same amount of people in their group. Not cool. 

The food was good. The pasta salad was not so good.

Experience it for yourself, but as for me and our group, we will not be going back. I think that I would rather get their to go before going back to the actual restaurant.
Horrible over priced food - poor quality, poor service and unprofessional management! Food that makes you sick is unacceptable. Avoid this place, much better options just steps away.

I've been coming to Mandalay for years and Citizens always being open was convenient. But today I encountered the rudest hostess and that ended my run. House of Blues serves breakfast too and they are welcoming and courteous. The millennial at Citizens that wouldn't even look at me as she was too busy tweeting or facebooking or whatever it was she was doing, can figure out that when you are in the service industry, people will opt for service with a smile every time.
This Gets 4 stars, for 1 reason, OPEN 24 HRS. And its really good food. (Recommend the Bacon Burger and NY style pastrami)

Had dinner at Citizen's one night during a business trip and our group was exhausted.  Our waiter Giddeon, was amazing, he helped us with the choices on the menu and got our food out quickly and correctly.  I ordered a veggie bowl which contained rice, veggies and pieces of steak.  It was acceptable, but I wouldn't recommend it as one of their best dishes.  My coworkers had lasagna and the Citizens prime rib dinner.  Both are huge portions and both were delicious! I should've gone with one of those selections!  The lasagna was nice and tasty with a great short rib bolognese sauce, served with garlic toast, simply delicious.  The prime rib looked amazing, although I did not try it, the broccoli was nice and crunchy, cooked to perfection.  The steak fries were to die for.  Went back the next day and had the turkey avocado sandwich- exceptional! huge portion- was only able to eat half, but it was simply delicious served on cranberry bread. The mixture of the aioli and the sweetness of the bread was perfect.  My coworker order the mahi mahi fish tacos, I think it was 3 tacos to the order, they were a good size, served with fries, also very good.  I highly recommend this place and their service.

5 stars for the food, drinks, and service. Raquel was awesome our first day- and we are huge fans of Katie now that we've established our favorite bar at Mandalay. 
A great experience having a friendly staff. 

By the way, my Bloody Mary had a crab leg in it. Will certainly be back!

I've been to Vegas a plethora of times in my life, and a hand full since turning 21, my goal was to learn how to do Vegas right by 25 and I think I've succeeded. One of the keys is finding solid meals, not meals where you want to stuff yourself but something just right to fill your stomach before an eventful night. Citizens got the job done for me on this visit. Their burgers specifically. 

The meat is quality meat, ordered it medium rare, medium and medium well, all 3 times cooked to my exact demands and each and every time it was mouth watering. 4.5/5

Ingredients were fresh each and every time as well, the one time I ordered the bacon burger, it came through too. No staleness in any part of my burger. 

Bun- Bun was good, maybe a 4/5 which is good for my standards. 

Fries- For being just normal fries they left a great impression on me. Crispy and tasteful, mm mm delicioso.

Customer service was very mediocre though. That's all there is to say about that here.

If you're staying at the Mandalay Bay or any hotel within the block and you're looking for a quick bite, rely on Citizens to get the job done, they are open 24/7 which is reliability at its finest.

So when we landed and checked in were starving.  There aren't that's y choices to eat and this place looked decent.  I ordered the turkey avocado sandwich.  I felt a bit deceived because I thought I'd have pieces of avocado in my sandwich... But nope it's smushed in with the spread/sauce.  For $14 I guess I was expecting a piece of avocado.  Don't think I would go back for sandwich unless I'm desperate again like we were when we first landed.
Absolutely fabulous food and service!  I'm so glad we decided to dine in while visiting the Mandalay Bay!

I really like Citizens at Mandalay Bay Hotel!  

We ordered the following for a light lunch:

- Grilled Vege Sandwich - Really delicious - lots of thinly sliced grilled vege with intermittent mozarella cheese (boconcini) and a wonderful extra virgin oilve oil based dressing - I loved it and will come back for more!
- Chicken Noodle Soup - very tasty chicken noodle soup for a light lunch - comes with  crackers with a wad of butter between the 2 crackers - neat!
- Ruben Sandwich - very scrumptious with lots of meat and sauerkraut
- Spring Mix Salad - fresh greens salad

Restaurant is open 24/7.

Wait service was prompt and quick and served with a smile.  :o)

After a very long flight it was suggested we check out Citizens for a late dinner. We asked to be seated inside because the band playing in the bar outside was SO loud. It didn't make a difference. Our server greeted  us quickly and was very enthusiastic. We ordered the fish & chips and the tuna melt plus waters. Food presentation was beautiful.  unfortunately the fish was over cooked and the potato salad, al though made in house, lacked flavor. In the end our bill was $50 for a mediocre meal. The fish and chips was definitely over priced, $26!
Didn't get greeted on our way in. When she led us to our table, pulled the chair out in front of me. Left for another spot.

A few colleagues and I stopped by Citizens Kitchen and Bar located in the Mandalay Bay Hotel on the evening of Monday, October 17th.  I ordered the French Dip which consisted of thin sliced prime rib, caramelized onions, Provolone cheese, and Au Jus.  It came with a side of fries (which were hot temperature wise and salted perfectly) and a pickle spear.  It was somewhat challenging to dip in the Au Jus because of the bread.  It was more of a hoagie bun and full of meat, so it made it hard to get that big sandwich into the little "cup" of Au Jus.  However, when I was able to dip it, it was good.

Justin, our waiter, was FANTASTIC!!!  He was very talkative and friendly, and checked up on us quite a bit to ensure that we had everything we needed.  He is an asset to the restaurant.

If you are hungry late night, or anytime really, then sneak into Citizens for a bite.  You'll walk away happy!

We had an excellent experience at Citizen, and we totally credit our server, Michael for it. 

We were passing time during the college basketball championship game and decided to go to the aquarium and grab a bite to eat. We were seated at a nice table and the kids ordered sandwiches and I had a Maryland Mary (their version of a Bloody Mary) which is made with a homemade Bloody Mary mix. The sandwiches were a full meal, very nicely done. The Bloody Mary was REALLY good: very spicy and very flavorful. Couldn't even taste the vodka, which is how I like it, but it was definitely there. Yum. 

Our server Michael was very attentive, we didn't order a large or fancy meal, but we were treated like we did. Our water glasses were always full. We felt like he genuinely cared about our dining experience. 

We will definitely be back!
We really enjoyed breakfast here. The coffee was good (smooth), hashbrowns were nice and crunchy, corn beef hash was really nice, my omelette was delicious! Will be back tomorrow.

For our last night in Vegas, we traditionally find a steakhouse where we dine on some steak and crab. This time we had eaten a large late breakfast and missed lunch so we decided to grab an early dinner but looked for somewhere inside the Delano/Mandalay Bay complex where we were staying. We had never tried Citizens before and were also on a tighter budget and their prices fit our hotel credit balance better. Yeah, talk about cheap! Anyway, we decided we could live without steak and crab this time around.
Perhaps it was because of our timing, no apparent conventions in town, there was a marathon actually happening at that same time out on Las Vegas Blvd, and it was an early dinner but we got the best service anyone could ever expect. Erick "with a C-K" was funny, courteous, recommended his faves and left me thinking "I'll come back here to eat again the next time we stay at the Delano" unlike some of the other restaurants there.
The food: I started with French onion soup and had a French dip sandwich. Way too much delicious food. I couldn't finish it. Erick and I agreed we both like KFC coleslaw and he said Citizens was as good if not better and I had to agree. My GF had fish tacos in the lettuce wraps option instead of the normal tortillas and despite having some spice to it which she usually doesn't care for, she finished it all and kept saying how good it was. 
We'll be back Erick "with a C-K"! Hmm, the prime rib or full rack of ribs?
Exceptionally slow service even when half the tables were empty.  28 minutes and counting to get a chicken sandwich.
Really awesome breakfast. Try a smoothie I'm fairly sure it saved our lives after a rough Vegas night before.

I must say I have been to every major hotel in Las Vegas and you probably know how hard it is to get the best food so efficiently sometimes. I'm here at the JC K jewelry show and I must eat quick and I must eat good and healthy and with a lot of taste yes that's what I like and I have happen to find that for my morning take in my lunch and also dinner if I'm not going to fancy restaurant here at the citizens the service is fast the food is delicious and extremely well prepared from the Apple cinnamon muffin which is my favorite to the kale salad which has an anonymous amount of taste try it you'll be addicted.
Nice people. Very accommodating. But the breakfast is only ok. Pricey. Big servings. But food Taste and satisfaction is below expectations.

I enjoyed breakfast here on a Saturday morning around 9am.
They were able to substitute the potatoes that came on the side of each omelette with fruit, so that was a bonus. 
Service was fairly fast and friendly so I would definitely come back here for a healthier eating option.

This was bad. 

We had a dining credit due to our room at The Hotel being booked up so we tried it and it did not work out. 

This is the Mandalay Bay's answer to a 24/7 restaurant. 

We tried to go here twice. The first time was around midnight. The place was empty and I asked for another table so my sweetheart and I could sit side by side. There were probably 40 tables available. The hostess told me in an extra snotty manner that they are a 24 hour restaurant so they will need the four top table for another party. My sweetheart was offended by how she addressed me and suggested we leave immediately which we did. I should not have returned. 

The second time we returned I tried a side of mac and cheese and the French onion soup. The soup was meh. The mac and cheese was cold as if they didn't microwave it long enough. It was definitely microwaved. They were out of carrot cake. It was super super expensive- around $30 for one person. It was really really loud and hard to talk. Don't go here at all. There is no reason to. There are other places to eat like Grand Lux Cafe at the Venetian which are open 24/7 who won't be rude while overcharging you for bad food.
I have ordered take out from here several times. The food is just ok. Prices are a bit high. The carrot cake is amazing.

It was... Not that great. First off it is very pricey. Two of us our bill was over $50 and that's with no alcohol. Its run by Lightgroup and i have a bad taste in my mouth from them already. Service was sub par for Vegas and sitting where people are constantly walking right next to you is not enjoyable. The hostesses were probably the best part of the whole experience. The food was dennys quality so don't expect something amazing. (the belgian waffle was pretty amazing though!)

Ive been here before, days when i wasnt yelping, and i remember food was good.  Family and I needed to come down this way to check into Cisco Live and decided to stop by and eat lunch.  This place also has a nice bakery and a full bar.  So you can have a nice dinner with cocktails or beer, then head up to the bakery for dessert!
I was really disappointed this time.  I ordered the tuna melt and wife ordered the chili.  The tuna melt was dry and the rye bread didnt mix well with the tuna.  The chili had no sauce.  It looked and tasted like a chunk of meat.
I dont know....maybe ill try breakfast here and see how it compares with lunch, but do i want to spend another 100 bucks to get a bleh meal???  I guess you will have to follow me to find out!  Im here in vegas till July 15, so we'll see.

Citizens is a fairly new restaurant on the Strip, located at the Mandalay.  I believe it opened earlier this year...

Like many new restaurants at the higher end casinos, the interior is re-done and has an upscale feel.  Service here was fantastic--our server was very accomodating to our unusual requests, and he was speedy.

How was the food?  Hmmm... I ordered one of their signature items: the meatball grinder (meatball, gravy, and provolone sandwich).  It was missing something... I would start with a thicker gravy with some added punch.  In any case, I got the feeling their recipe was missing a key ingredient(s) and was real close to being perfect--meatballs had decent flavor, lots of provolone, and good, soft bread...  Pic is posted here http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/citizens-kitchen-and-bar-las-vegas?select=iw_BaDqhZdKca8szDQyqhw#4dzx70lU6_dOxSRCHlBerg

Another member of our party had ordered the Muffaletta.  I think I'm just not a muffaletta person as the sandwich didn't connect with me.  Visually, it did look good though...

With both sandwiches failing to wow me, great service and good decor isn't enough to woo a return visit from me... =(
Came here for a late night snack.  They're 24/7 and have a smaller menu during late hours.  We were starving but the hot dip, chicken soup and corn beef hash were all tasty.
Went here late night a few times (after 1pm) service was good food was good. Nachos are so good!  restaurant is clean and usually does not have a wait.

I hate overly priced restaurants. But when you are hankerin for something to eat and you are 25 stories up, overly priced doesn't seem so bad. This is a decent place to get a late nite bite or treat at Mandalay Bay. And for that only I give it 3 stars. 

I certainly would't come here otherwise. But if I'm at Mandalay Bay I would.

This place would be so much better if they could just fix their ridiculously slow service.

I went to the take out counter twice during my most recent Vegas stay. Both times the food took forever for what was a simple order.

The second visit was ridiculous. There was one person ahead of me who got her parfait and was on her way. We order a parfait, donut, hot tea, and fresh juice. Everything except for the juice was grabbed from the counter. The juice took over 15 minutes. Everything was already pre-cut in a cup, all the person had to do was add orange juice and blend.

They were clearly understaffed, and for the prices they charge there is no excuse.

Also, when I was paying the second day the girl working the register asked if I needed a receipt. When I said yes, she handed me the itemized receipt. I asked her where the credit card receipt was and she said she threw it away. I told her I needed it because this was a work expense. She then proceeded to dig through the garbage until she produced my crumpled receipt. That is not okay, if someone says they want a receipt they should be given both receipts, or at the bare minimum the credit card receipt.

This place would be good if they could just get their ish together!

Came here because it was one of the few restaurants open late at night. Food was excellent,  a little pricey, but it's Vegas, so no big deal. Service was okay. There were 4 waiters, 3 food runners, a bartender,  hostess and manager. We had to wait a bit for our check and they gave me a dirty spoon with food stuck on it yet, but other than that it was good. Nice atmosphere and drunk people are always entertaining.

We were totally hungry and wanted to grub before leaving Sin City. One of the homies recommended this place plus it was located in the hotel we stayed at. 

It was a cute spot. Service was not memorable.  My turkey burger was good but meat kinda fell apart. The bf liked his food. But, it was kinda priceyyy!  

3.5 stars for me!
Was looking for a super quick bite. The Mahi Mahi fish tacos blew me away. Some of the best I've had outside of San Diego or Mexico.

I enjoyed this place for lunch and breakfast (we came here twice during our trip to Vegas). It's located in Mandalay Bay, so it was close to us since we were staying at the Luxor. 

The service here was good, and prices are pretty affordable for being on The Strip. It's a casual place that's not affiliated with a celebrity chef, so you'll never have to wait for a table. 

Items we tried:

- French Onion Soup: HUGE portion. I think this is easily a two person starter. It was very flavorful, and had lots of cheese. The previous Yelp reviews on this did not disappoint. 

- Kobe Chili Cheese Fries: I saw "Kobe" on the menu and knew I had to order it. Seasoned waffle fries came out with Kobe beef chili and a mini pitcher of nacho cheese. It was good, but it was very high in sodium (probably all chili cheese fries are). I would suggest trying this if you like chili cheese fries. 

- 2 Eggs Any Style Breakfast: Yum! The tater tots were delicious! I ordered scrambled eggs and they were good. Not rubbery at all. If you order bacon as your meat, you will get three slices. It's breakfast, so it's hard to really mess this up. 

Overall, I good casual spot for a quick meal if you're hungry and don't want to leave the area.

The food was great I had meatloaf it was some of the best meatloaf I've had in years. The portions are huge the service was terrific our server, lotus, took our orders without writing them down and made no mistakes. We would come back here in a heart beat

Citizens Mimosa is the best!
I ate breakfast here twice this week. Breakfast burrito is delicious and today I had the corned beef hash skillet. My husband had the Eggs Benedict. Service is just as good. Love love love the Mimosa.
Their prices are insane. Food is mediocre, like eating at Chilis but paying 5 times as much. Ladies and gentleman, Las Vegas, The Greatest Show (um scam) On Earth.

Not bad for breakfast after a night of gambling before checking out and heading to the airport. Pricey? A bit, but it's Vegas, people! You want cheap? Leave the hotel & run across the street to McDonalds. Great cocktails - the Bloody Mary came in more of a bucket than a glass, lol, and was perfect. The corned beef w/poached eggs & hollandaise was delicious and a huge portion, in addition to the chilaquiles. Good stuff!
Wow this place was great , Amazing Rueban and fish Tacos are a must!! Service was also to the "T"

Walked by this place and my attention was drawn instantly from the outside inside patio to the modern industrial decor. Upon seating and looking at the menu it was a full menu which is nice to see on a Sunday. The brunch menu usually ruins it for me. The menu is well organized and has everything to appeal to your tastes. Looking around seeing the different food coming out I was drawn to the sandwiches. I ordered the pastrami on rye with spicy mustard side of coleslaw and a Brooklyn lager. Prior to food coming out drinks were brought out fast and server kept water glass full. Once the sandwich arrived which was very quick I was welcomed with a high piled sandwich. The quality of the meat was outstanding and the bread was soft and fresh. The side of coleslaw was a light based dressing. Overall the dining experience was outstanding and will be back to try more items.

Not impressed, not a lot of options, food was bland and over priced

Food - 1 star
Service - 4 stars

At 3am, after a fun evening out, we were hungry. Citizens Kitchen was the closest option between the club and the bed. My friend ordered a burger and told me it tasted good. I noticed that there was a check-in deal for a free slice of cheesecake (with the purchase of a signature entree) and in true Yelper fashion, I inquired about it.

Our server was so nice and gave me a free slice of cheesecake because my friend had ordered an entree (although there were no signature entrees at this time at night). It was creamy and delicious. We also found out that even though Citizens wasn't on the written list of places were we could use our $100 American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts credit, we were able to get it deducted from our bill when we checked out. Score!

Fast, friendly service but mediocre breakfast items. I expected the banana nut pancakes to have the latter IN the pancake but no: they were a stack of 3 plain pancakes with a sliced banana and some nuts sprinkles on top. That said, they were fine.  ($14) So was the granola & fruit parfait. ($10) The corned beef hash ($16) was nothing to write home about. And forgo the $14 basket of 4 'fresh' bakery items.  The Krispy Kreme doughnut was scrumptious but the other items (croissant, cheese Danish and apple tart) tasted stale.

I don't normally give 1 star reviews unless the customer service experience was horrible, which was not the case here.  The wait staff was mediocre, nothing special, nothing bad though.  I did however get a bad case of food poisoning though from my meal, which had their salmon in it.  I did not finish the meal entirely, and the food was also mediocre (3 star food at best), but the food poisoning did it for me.  C'mon guys, make sure that kitchen is clean and the food is cooked!

Bland overpriced breakfast with servers who had no clue what they were doing and were more interested in chatting with their friends instead of serving us.

Coffee cups sat empty for 10 minutes.  Eggs benedict looked pathetic and had no taste.  Eggs were horribly overdone.

Toast... man, what is it with breakfasts in the U.S. and places not able to simply TOAST toast?  We were served cold bread... when we finally were able to ask for 'toast', they gave us cold bread again that was slightly tan on one side.

Had lunch at the bar to watch football. We were served by Erick who kept us entertained all the while providing  exceptional service. Although the place was packed, he was on top of his game, anticipating our needs and doing it all with a smile on his face. Food was great (BLAT and Nachos) and I would definitely return, especially if I saw Erick behind the bar.

Went for breakfast.   Had the eggs/potatoes and Bacon.   Bacon was super greasy and the whole meal was over $100 for 4 people and not that good.......
House of blues has a $9.99 breakfast special so you can avoid this place

The food and service were very good.  I was thinking that we had a good waitress, Melanie S., when I saw her stoop down and have a conversation with a sweet looking older lady sitting alone in the corner.  I was so impressed.  She definitely takes her job seriously and cares for her diners.  Ask for Melanie to have an even more special dining experience.
